loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard,30, is a fish vendor in his village in San Vicente Tumauini, Isabela. It is located six kilometers from the town proper where he buys the fish at wholesale prices and then sells them in his village at retail prices. Jonard and his wife are hoping to sustain their fish vending business and to venture into another type of business to meet the growing needs of their family. They have been in the vending business for three years and earn a weekly income of PHP 1,000.00. He wants the best for their business. That is why he is requesting a loan of $150 (PHP 6,000.00) to increase his capital and hopefully start another business. Jonard said that together with his wife, they will work hand-in-hand to overcome every struggle they may encounter in their business.

He is married to Jocelyn and they have a two-year-old daughter named Cristel. The couple always prays for good health so they can work and do their best as responsible parents.

loans.use: Increase in capital to open a new business

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Jeni is a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $200. Every day she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jeni is 45 years old, married, and has five children ranging in age from 13 to 20. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Temi, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 37-year-old man who lives in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Hasan has owned a fish shop for twenty-five years. He sells all kinds of fish, depending on the season. Hasan requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new refrigerator and do some maintenance work in his shop. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan.

Hasan is special in his work because he fishes for different types of fish; his shop is clean as well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When Hasan first started his business, he didn’t have any difficulty. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, Hasan plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: purchase a new refrigerator and do some maintenance work in his shop

loans.name: Faitele

texts.en:
Faitele S., 50, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the donuts, pork buns, German buns and pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 2 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Faitele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use all of her loan on the business only.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of flour, sugar, yeast and baking powder

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Ms. Rhoda M. is now engaged in a business, a sari – sari store. She used start-up capital of 2,000 from her salary at a grocery store to set up a small sari-sari store at home. Her customers are her neighbors. To focus on her business, she decided to leave her job. She is now residing at P-5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. At the age of 34, she is still single and planning to settle down soon. She is living with her parents and taking care of them.

To add more capital to her business, she decided to join Paglaum MPC and obtain a loan.With the encouragement of her neighbors, she is now an active member of Paglaum MPC at Kauswagan Center, Gango, Ozamiz City. She is a very active leader in her group. Now on her 2nd loan cycle, she wishes to borrow 12,000 PHP to buy more grocery items. She is hoping that someday, with the help of Paglaum MPC and through Kiva funds, her small store will become a mini-grocery store at their place.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a sari-sari store

location.town: Ozamis-P5 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.ru: Джуманов Набижон- мужчина 32 лет. Набижон женат отец 4-х детей. Набижон занимается торговлей скота. С 2008 году он кредитуется в нашей организации. Набижон покупает скот в Киргизии. Набижон параллельно занимается переработкой сельхоз культур. Набижон на полученный займ хочет купить овец и перепродать мясникам по выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Nabijon D. is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. He is involved in livestock sales. He has been a borrower at our organization since 2008. Nabijon buys livestock in Kyrgyztan. He is also involved in agriculture. Nabijon wants to use this loan to purchase sheep and resell them to butchers at a profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: 8 De Septiembe Group

texts.es: El grupo “8 D. Septiembre” es un grupo integrado por trece miembros precedido por la señora Mónica Bartola. Todos ellos se dedican a actividades como al transporte público en mototaxis y a la venta D. diferentes productos como pan, bebidas varias, ropa, pescado, Cd. Y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio. A pesar del alto índice D. competencia existente en el mercado los socios D. este banco saben siempre como salir adelante sin importar las adversidades ya que del ingreso D. cada día dependen sus familias. Siempre con el compromiso D. seguir creciendo y cumplir con el pagos D. sus cuotas los miembros D. este grupo van cumpliendo un ciclo más con la institución con el deseo D. obtener mayores ganancias y ayudar a mejorar la calidad D. vida en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group “September 8th” is an integrated group of thirteen members led by Mrs. Mónica Bartola. All members sell activities such as public transportation in motor taxis and various products like bread, beverages, clothes, fish, CDs and groceries in neighborhood stores. Despite the high amount of competition in the market, the partners of this bank always know how to move forward without concern for adversity since their families depend on the daily income. With the commitment to continue growing and fulfilling the payments of its shares, the members of this group are fulfilling another cycle with the institution with the desire to achieve greater earnings and to help improve the quality of life in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio Martínez B. is from the city of Choré. He is 34 years old and is married to Mrs. Esmelda Villalba, who is 30 years old and owns her own house. Ignacio owns an auto body workshop, which has been running for seven years. He also owns a tire shop. Both are strategically located and Ignacio has a well-established clientele.

He would like to build a platform on which to put his spare parts and vehicles for sale. Ignacio is a hardworking man with great personal references.

loans.use: The purchase of crashed vehicles

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 49-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Imad has owned a restaurant for two years. He sells all types of sandwiches, fruit cocktails, and ice cream. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an Italian oven for roasting chicken. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan.

Imad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His customers are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Imad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, and he had always wanted to open a restaurant. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase an Italian oven for roasting chicken

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: M. Ruth, 37 years old, is hard working lady and the leader of Kibuye United group in Mubende. She is a farmer and, at the same time, a business lady. She is involved in the sale of produce that she buys from fellow farmers, in addition to what she gets from her own farm. She has been operating her business from Nyabuhula village for 6 years and, at the moment, she is able to make profits amounting to 400,000 UGX a month. She also buys goats and sheep for resale. The good quality of her animals and other produce attracts more customers to her business. Ruth has a dream of buying a car that will help in transporting her goods. As well, she dreams of constructing a family house for her 5 children, aged 4 - 14 years, and the 2 dependents she cares for, all still in Primary school. This is Ruth’s 20th loan with her lending group and she is grateful for the journey she has taken with the help of these loans. She needs a loan to help buy more goats for resale as well as buying more seeds and employing laborers on her farm for further improved outcomes.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale, more seeds and towards employing manpower on farm.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано Асоева проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. Рано более 5 лет занимается бизнесом, т.е. торговлей. Она ходит по кишлакам и селам, торгует одеждой. В основном: полотенцем, бельем, платками и т.д. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Rano A. lives in the Rumy district. She is 45 years old, a widow and has 3 children. Rano has been involved in sales for over 5 years. She goes to kishlaks and villages and sells clothing. She primarily sells towels, undergarments, scarves and etc. Rano is requesting a loan to purchase new merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise selection

loans.name: Silvia Petra

texts.es:
"La Srta. Silvia Petra G. A., tiene como actividad  la venta de jugo de fruta, realizando jugos vitamínicos y otros en la zona central de La Paz, es una cliente joven y dinámica, actualmente vive en casa de su hermana ya que es soltera.
La cliente fue recomendada por su hermana quien viene trabajando con nuestra institución de una manera responsable."

loans.use: Incremento de Capital

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan Thị B. T. was born in 1977. ( id: 010103060029). She lives in Ly Nhan, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. They have a workshop at home. Every day, Mrs Lan goes to work far her house. She parches wood to make mayches. Beside, she raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 About the other borrower in her group:
 Hồng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1957. ( id: 010103060025). She has three children. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed the pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en: Frederick is married with four children and lives at Ngyen-Mbo, Cameroon. Frederic and his entire family live in a house with two rooms. Frederic had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill-health, untimely death of family members, and inadequate funds to take good care of his family. He operates a palm oil production business with the loans given to him and people also pay him to process palm oil for them. Frederick has been a member of GHAPE since 2001 and this will be his eighth loan. He has been quite successful in the past with his business due to his location, and he is trusted by his customers. Also, with the experience he now has, many people are coming to have their palm oil processed. Part of Frederick’s profits from his loan will be used to take care of his children, buy necessities for the family, and give them good medication whenever they are sick. He will use part of the profits to save as a precaution. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a palm oil mill

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Arely de 42 años de edad, tiene una pulpería que desde hace seis años administra y desde horas temprana se levanta para atender a sus clientes en la mañana que es cuando se vende mas ya que muchas familias compran a diario para hacer el desayuno a su familias. El cual inicio con préstamo y unos pocos ahorros, madre soltera de dos hijos que los tiene estudiando,  vive en Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua. Sus planes es mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, carnes, gaseosas, golosinas, lácteos y otros mas para subir las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Arely is 42 years old and has been managing her own grocery store for 6 years. She wakes up in the early hours so that she can attend to her customers. Most of her sales are made in the mornings because many families come by every day to purchase the items they need for breakfast. Arely was able to start her business with the help of a loan and a small portion of her savings. She is a single mother of two school-aged children. She and her family live in Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua.

Arely has plans to make improvements to her home and support her children’s education. With this loan, she plans to buy basic grains, meat, sodas, candy, dairy products, and other items so that she can increase her sales and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, sodas, candy, dairy products, and other items

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2004. He is requesting to borrow for the second time a loan of $1,200 to add new decor to his shop in order to attract new clients.

loans.use: To add new decor to his shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera sin hijos, vive Capachica, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de venta  de salchimote (comida típica).

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar insumos para la preparación de comida al paso (maíz, condimentos, papa, pollo, combustible) los vende diariamente en la plaza de capachica.  También se dedica a la venta de pescado en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida.

A ella le  gustan  las charlas y los ahorros
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the district of Capachica in the Puno province, Puno. She is 28 years old, single without children. She lives in Capachica and has completed elementary level studies.
Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the inception of the communal bank. Her first loan of S/300.00 Nuevos Soles, allowed her to increase her working capital for her business selling ‘salchimote’ a local food dish.
At this time, Juana is requesting a new loan of S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, which she will use to buy cooking ingredients (corn, condiments, potatoes, chicken, gas). She sells food on a daily basis at the plaza in Capachica. She also sells fish at the weekly fairs.
Her greatest wish is to have a store with an assortment of products.
She likes the workshops and the savings offered by her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients (corn, condiments, potatoes, chicken, etc.)

loans.name: Roberts

texts.en: Roberts W. is married to Betty Namutebi. They are blessed with three children and he is thirty-five years old. Roberts owns a restaurant along Old Masaka Road just beyond the Rakai Project. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food items, such as beans, rice, and "posho" (maize flour) for his restaurant. Roberts’s future plan is to generate more profits so he can construct a better shelter for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Patricia  Janet

texts.es: La Sra.Patricia tiene 24 años de edad es conviviente tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, vive en la casa de su madre juntamente con su conyugue  y su hijo, ellos vienen en el Distrito de la Tinguiña en casa de material adobe, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora hace 2 años, su conyugue es operario de construccion civil, Patricia tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propia  casa, con el dinero que solicita incrementarâ su capital  de trabajo para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Patricia, 24, lives with her life partner and their 3-year-old son in her mother's adobe house, which is in Tinguiña district. She has been a clothing peddler for the past 2 years; her husband works in construction. Patricia has many dreams and objectives, one of which is to have her own home. The funds requested will be used to buy stock merchandise for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new materials

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ada Patricia S. C., tiene 34 años de edad  es casada y su esposo es electricista, ellos tienen 4 hijos y dentro de los principales planes esta la remodelación de su hogar para la mejora de las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y así poder brindarles un futuro mejor.

Ellos se dedican a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos y usados, dentro de los principales problemas que han tenido con el negocio, ha sido la irresponsabilidad de algunos de sus clientes que no le cancelan sus créditos, esto le obstaculiza  la inversión de un mayor inventario de mercadería o de una apertura de una tienda en donde ofertar sus productos,  ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, esto les brindaría la posibilidad de emprenderse hacia nuevos mercados, bajo nuevas medidas de pagos apra evitarse los problemas que poseen hoy en dia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada Patricia S. C. is 34 years old and married. Her husband is an electrician. They have four children, and one of their short-term goals is remodeling their home to improve the quality of life of their children and be able to give them a better future.

They work selling new and used clothing and shoes, and one of their main problems with the business has been the irresponsibility of some of their customers who do not pay their debts. This prevents them from being able to invest in growing their inventory or opening a store in which to offer their products. They are asking for a loan to buy merchandise, as this will give them the opportunity to branch out in new markets, with new means to make their payments to avoid the problems they have today.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elvira Josefina

texts.es:
Elvira Josefina V. A. tiene 49 años y vive con sus hijos  en el barrio Villa Katanga ubicado en Soledad; ella desde hace tres años se dedica al negocio de vender mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos surtidos y también comercializa productos que no están exhibidos es su revista; este es el motivo de acceder a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para obtener su tercer  crédito por valor de $2.000.000  el cual lo utilizará para comprar de contado y poder financiar a una nueva clientela que le hizo pedidos de vestidos femeninos ropa deportiva masculina, cosméticos y calzado para hombre y para mujer.
Su negocio lo inició cuando una empresa le ofreció vender sus productos cosméticos y como sus hijos trabajan y estudian, ella pudo hacer una buena gestión de ventas con sus amigos, luego acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través de una vecina que recibe créditos en esta organización y la recomendó; con su financiamiento ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener una referencia crediticia, que le ha ayudado a que muchas empresas le ofrezcan sus productos y con ello ha logrado diversificar su oferta.
Su sueño mas adelante es comprar un carro de servicio publico que le genere un nuevo ingreso y que igualmente le sirva  para trasladarse y responder oportunamente en sus actividades de negocio.
Siempre ha tenido grandes desafíos, pero su  fe en Dios y su capacidad de superación y su forma de resolverlos apoyada por sus hijos, que trabajan en buenas empresas, les ha permitido salir adelante y responder a cualquier problema que se le presente.
texts.en:
Elvira Josefina V. A., 49, lives with her children in the Villa Katanga neighborhood in Soledad. For the last three years she has sold assorted catalogue merchandise; she also sells articles that are not included in the catalogue. This is the reason for calling upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her third loan, valued at $2.000.000, to pay cash for articles, like women's dresses, men's athletic clothes, cosmetics and shoes for men and women, that new customers have ordered. Her business started when a company offered her the opportunity to sell cosmetics. Since her children were working and going to school, she was able to focus on selling to her acquaintances. Then, she called upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, thanks to a recommendation from a neighbor, who gets loans from this organization. She used the financing to increase her working capital and establish a credit history. This, in turn, made it possible for several companies to offer her their products and she has been able to diversify the products she offers. Her dream for later on is to buy a public transportation vehicle that will produce new income and that will provide her with mobility so that she can respond to her business' needs in a timely fashion. She has always had challenges but her faith in God and her capacity for improvement and the way she has faced them, with her children's support, who work for good companies, have made it possible for her to continue forging ahead in life and to respond to any problem that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay cash for women's dresses, men's athletic clothing, cosmetics and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Ruhusa Mweri

texts.en:
Ruhusa is a 33 year old Gentleman who is married to Mangi and they have three children. He is in the business of selling second hand clothes in New Market-Malindi where he targets residents of Malindi town. He gets a monthly profit of Kshs 5,000.

Ruhusa who is in his first loan cycle was introduced to Kadet by an existing client who was also a neighbor and he had never borrowed elsewhere before. He plans to use this loan to add stock of baby clothes with Kshs 5000 and to secure a better business premise Kshs 5000.

He plans to accumulate the extra profit he gets from this loan and expand his business. He describes himself as a hardworking man and he hopes to own a big building in Malindi town.

loans.use: to add stock of baby clothes

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 3,5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Accion (Women in Accion), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Many of these clienst have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and two children.

Maria is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by investing in four lines of hair products to sell to her clients. She will use the profits to purchase the necessary items to make her newly purchased house a home (plates, chairs, etc.). She thanks you all for your support

loans.use: Hair products to sell in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam S. est une femme mariée de 34 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et leurs enfants  dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni (troisième région du Mali). 
Elle a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente des bananes. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 8 ans, ce qui explique sa maîtrise dans ce domaine d’activité. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans. Après deux prêts correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de bananes. Elle s'approvisionne dans la commune de Sido (située à 25 kilomètres de Bougouni) et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente dans les différents quartiers et au marché de Bougouni.
Elle envisage  réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ressoude certaines dépenses familiales et  acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam S. is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four children who live in a monogamous family with her husband and their children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni (3rd region of Mali).  She soon dropped out of school in favor of income-generating work, especially selling bananas.  She has been in this business for eight years, which explains her command of this business sector.  In order to satisfy her customers, Mariam decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago.  After two loans, properly repaid, she is now on her third loan, which will be used for buying a large quantity of bananas.  She stocks up in the community of Sido (located 25 km from Bougouni) and in the surrounding villages.  She makes her sales in the various districts and at the Bougouni market. With this loan, Mariam envisions making a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for resolving certain family expenses and for buying a residential plot of land.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bananas

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es elaboración de ollas de aluminio. Hace más de 26 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que ella inicia por cuenta propia, ella misma salía a venderlos después de elaborar una cantidad, recorría muchos lugares para ofrecer sus productos ya que son muy pesados, pero a pesar de esto no deja de luchar para mejorar los ingresos y así proporcionarle a su hijo lo necesario.  Así fue que poco a poco ella fue creciendo con su negocio. Pues siempre sueña con establecer un taller para generar más ingresos a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de materia prima como aluminio, moldes entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maria De La Concepción is 47 years old. Her economic activity is making aluminum pots. She has been performing this activity for more than 26 years. She started on her own. She would go out by herself to sell them after making a certain quantity. She would go through different places, offering her products. They are very heavy, but despite this she won't stop fighting to improve her income and give her son everything he needs. In this way, little by little, she has grown her business. She has always dreamed of having a workshop to generate more income for her family. The loan she is asking for is for working capital destined for the purchase of raw materials such as aluminum, molds and more.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felicia Clotilde

texts.es:
La sra Felicia es soltera con 2  hijos que se encuentran  estudiando.
Ella mantiene a sus dos hijos mediante el negocio que ella tiene el cual es una despensa y mercería en su domicilio.
Su negocio tiene 16 años, al principio era vendedora ambulante y actualemente ya atiende su negocio en su propio domicilio.
Ella se encuentra muy bien con su trabajo, y desea adquirir una computadora ya que su hijo esta necesitando para su estudio por este motivo que solicita el préstamo.  
En el futuro  desea ampliar aun mas su negocio ya que esta en un barrio muy poblado y su meta es que sus dos hijos no pasen necesidades con ella.
texts.en:
Felicia is a single mother of two children who are students. She supports her two children with her business which is a general store in her home. Her store is 16 years old; in the beginning she was an itinerant merchant but now she has her store set up in her home. She is very content with her work and wants to acquire a computer that her son needs for his school work; this is why she’s asking for funds. In the future, she’d like to enlarge her store because it’s in a very densely populated neighborhood and her goal is that her children have all their needs met with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Avazaga

texts.en:
Avazaga is 55 years old and an internally displaced person from the Fuzuli region. For the past 15 years he has lived in Baku with his wife and two sons, aged 15 and 20. Avazaga has been a dentist for the past 18 years. His father was also a dentist and Avazaga trained with him after he graduated from medical school. His oldest son is also studying dentistry. 

Avazaga is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to by new dental tools because his current tools are outdated. He wants to make his clients happy with the quality of his work.

loans.use: to by new dental tools

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco F.  tiene 31 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Encarnacion  en el Barrio San Pedro, esta casado tiene una hija.
Es propietario de una despensa muy bien surtida con todos los productos de primera necesidad. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su microempresa.
 El Destino del crédito sera para realizar compras de mas mercaderias para su negocio como yerba, harina, fideos, azucar, y otros.
texts.en:
Francisco is 31 years old and lives in the city of Encarnacion in the San Pedro neighborhood. He is married and has a daughter. He owns a well-stocked store and carries a complete variety of staple goods. He is a very hard worker and as a result his efforts he has been able to progress and grow his business. Francisco plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise for his store such as herbs, flour, noodles, sugar etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale merchandise  (flour, oil, sugar, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 42 años, es un buen padre de familia, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su pareja Julia (33)  y sus 4 hijos que son su motivación diaria.Desde hace 20 años, se dedica al cultivo de papa, alverjas, maíz, y diversas verduras. Realiza su labor  junto a su cónyuge, y con la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que siempre mantiene limpios sus terrenos. Lo  que más le gusta es sembrar justo en la temporada, no antes ni después, de otro modo le resulta difícil retirar la mala hierba de las chacras, porque al regarlas  crecen junto a sus cultivos. El trabajo  de la agricultura para José, es bastante rentable, porque le ha permitido adquirir varios  bienes, como  su casa, sus terrenos agrícolas y demás enseres, por eso no piensa dejar de lado el labrado de la tierra, además pretende instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa, aprovechando que no hay un negocio así  por la zona donde vive.Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice sentirse satisfecho con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes trabajan para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues tiene como  ventaja que sus terrenos son de  acceso a riego, y de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and a good father, living in his own house with his partner Julia (aged 33) and four children, who motivate him every day. For 20 years, he has been growing potatoes, peas, corn and various vegetables. His partner works with him on the land and his children also lend a hand, as he always keeps his plots well-tended. He prefers to sow in just the right season, not too early or too late, otherwise it is difficult to remove the weeds from the plots, because when he irrigates them they grow alongside his crops. Farming work is quite profitable for José, because it has allowed him to acquire various personal assets such as his house, farming land and other possessions. This is why he doesn’t intend to stop working the land, but also intends to set up a grocery store business in his house, since there is no other similar business in the area he lives in. This is the first time he has requested an MFP loan, and he is very grateful to everyone who has made the money available for him to continue working. He says he is also impressed by the achievements of the members of his communal group, who work to pay their quotas on time. José plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several sacks of fertiliser to spread on his crops, since he has the advantage of irrigating his plots, and in this way he hopes to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser to improve the quality of this crops

loans.name: John John

texts.en:
John John D. is from the village of Manaoag. He is 35 years old. John John is single. To make a living, John John owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. John John has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, John John joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. John John has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 18,000 from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. John John is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by John John from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana T. is 28 and is married with two children aged 4 and 5. She owns a business venture providing men's tailoring services to local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. Ana needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or approximately US$111 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Ana joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en: Artashes A. has been managing a clothing business for a few years. In the past, he was purchasing the clothing from a neighboring country. Later on, Artashed decided to foster the local economy by opening a local clothing production facility. With the loan, he is planning to purchase fabric for clothing production.

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for clothing production

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca nacida en San Matías Provincia de Santa Cruz de la Sierra soltera de 25 años de edad, vive en la Av. 2 de agosto,  la Sra. Blanca administra un taller de conversión a gas recibiendo un porcentaje de los trabajados realizados. Muchos de los vehículos están realizando esta inversión de la conversión de gasolina a gas, uno de los motivos es que es económico y reducen el gasto en gasolina y esto les permite tener mejores ingresos y otro es para reducir la contaminación en las ciudades,  el crédito que se le otorgo para el incremento de su capital de trabajo (compra de emulador, variador de avance, fierros, pernos y otros), "manifestó su satisfacción agradeciendo por la rapidez y la confianza depositada en ella".
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca was born in San Matías in the Province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She is 25 years old and lives along August 2nd Avenue. Sra. Blanca manages a shop where she converts engines to run on natural gas and receives a percentage of the work being done in this market. Many vehicles are undergoing the conversion from gasoline to natural gas because it is more affordable and reduces fuel costs. In addition, it helps reduce pollution in the cities.

The loan being provided will be used to increase her operating capital for buying an emulator, timing devices, iron, bolts, and other supplies. Blanca says, “I am pleased with the quick response and the confidence that has been demonstrated to me.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an emulator, timing devices, iron, bolts, and other supplies for her gas conversion workshop

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. tiene un pequeño local de venta de accesorios telefónicos. 

Hace algunos años el tuvo problemas con su familia por su conducta pero por la buena dirección de su esposa pudo remediar sus errores y obtener un pequeño capital para tener su propio negocio. Compro accesorios de celulares y empezó a venderlos desde ese tiempo hasta la actualidad el tiene ya su local, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con ayuda de un joven. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar celulares para tenerlos a la venta de los clientes. En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia y construir un local en su casa para tener cerca de su familia y pasar mas tiempo.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He lives on the outskirts of Guayquil along the Perimetral highway, which is surrounded by a salt marsh. He has a small store where he sells telephone accessories. Some years ago he had problems with his family because of his behavior, but with the right guidance from his wife he was able to correct his mistakes and obtain a small amount of capital to open his own business. He bought cell phone accessories and has been selling them ever since. He works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm everyday with the help of a young worker. With the loan he will buy cell phones to sell to his customers. In the future, he would like to have his own house and to build a store in his house in order to be closer to his family and to be able to spend more time with them.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cell phones

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es:
Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros En los Arenales de la parroquia Crucita cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 6 de Julio.,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

La señora Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, uno de ellos ya es mayor de edad pero aun es dependiente de ella ya que estudia en la Universidad y sus tres hijos menores aun están en colegio. Hace varios años estudio belleza en una Academia de Portoviejo.
 
Se dedica junto a su esposo a la atención de un bar-restaurante que tienen cerca de la playa, trabajan todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta 22h00, preparan hamburguesas, papas fritas, alas de pollo asadas y otras comidas rápidas, también venden gaseosas y cervezas, nos cuenta que las temporadas playeras son muy buenas, en esos días trabajan desde las 9am hasta las 24h00. Dice que ya son 5 años que llevan en este negocio y han  salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo dedicado.

Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 ciclos, en la actualidad se desempeña como presidenta, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a este banco y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de la institución. Este nuevo crédito lo quiere ocupar para comprar productos para su negocio y dos licuadoras para preparar batidos de frutas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante más grande y un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
This place is known for it's beautiful beaches, which are much visited by many national tourists and foreigners.  In the sands of the Crucita parish every 15 days, the 6th of July Communal Bank meets.  It offers a diversity of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes typical of the region.  

Señora Rosa is 33 years of age, married and has 4 children.  One of them is already grown, but is still dependent on her, since she is studying at the University.  Her 3 younger children still attend secondary school.  For many years she studied to be a beautician at the Academy of Portoviejo.
 
She is dedicated along with her husband to tending a bar and restaurant that they have which is close to the beach.  They work every day from 2PM to 11PM preparing hamburgers, french fries, roasted chicken wings and other fast foods.  They also sell carbonated beverages and beers.  She tells us that the temporate seasons are very good.  In those days they work from 9am to midnight.  She says they have run this business for 5 years and they have done well thanks to their effort and dedicated work.  

She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 9 loan cycles.  Currently she is serving as the president of the group.  She is very pleased to belong to this bank and likes the aid that she receives from the institution.  She wants to acquire this new loan to buy products for her business and two blenders to prepare fruit smoothies.  Her dreams are to have a larger restaurant and a beauty parlor.

loans.use: To buy two blenders and food supplies.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very caring lady. She responsibly carries out her duties as a housewife and a mother. She also has a business selling goats, which she started a few years ago to help her husband financially. The business has earned her a good profit and she easily pays the utilities expenses. She is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Her first two children are enrolled in school and are in the 4th and 3rd class. The other two are too young to attend school. 

Razia is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. 
Her husband’s name is G. A. and he is a tractor driver. He drives a tractor in the fields and also uses it for loading items. He loads different items, such as fruits and vegetables, and drops them at their designated places. 

Razia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her animal selling business. With the loan, she will buy goats to increase her sales. She sells goats mainly to butcher shops. She is hopeful that her decision of getting a loan and investing it in her business will be profitable for her family, and that she will be able to repay the loan without any problems. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a good experience for her. 

In the photo, Razia is the lady who is holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K.  is currently in the business of selling sugar, soda, etc. in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock cartons of salt, boxes of soap, etc. to sell.  

Grace is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is an NGO staff.  She has 5 children, and 4 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock salt, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos menores hijos a su cargo, reside en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, un lugar que se ha hecho conocido por sus sombreros tejidos artesanalente a base de junco. La zona se encuentra situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en un puesto de venta situado en el mercado de su distrito, allí ella atiende a los diversos pobladores que diariamente recurren a este centro de abasto para adquirir diversos productos de uso diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para mantener a sus menores hijos.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Vilma es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y por ello diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para administrar su negocio de buena manera.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years of age, is a single mother and has two minor children in her care. She resides in the district of Ciudad Eten, a place which has gained a reputation for its traditional handknit hats made from rushes. The area is situated a half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

For more than five years she has labored retailing personal care items and groceries in a sales post located in her district's marketplace. There she serves the diverse inhabitants who each day flock to this centralized supply point in order to to acquire a variety of products for their daily use. The income she receives from this business is used to support her minor children. 

She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products in order to satisfy her customers' demand and receive a greater income. Thus she thought it wise to seek from Edpyme Alternative a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles with which she plans to achieve her goal. 

Vilma is a determined and enterprising woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She puts in maximum effort every day in order to run her business well.

loans.use: To purchase basic supplies and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Kikongo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
34-year-old  K. Moses has been operating an alcohol selling business in Kikongo-Mukono for 10 years. It is a business that appeals to both low and middle income earners in and around his neighborhood. 

Moses says he began this business with the sway of his mother. Before that he was more inclined toward a maize flour selling enterprise. 

Moses, who is happily married with 4 kids, says hard work, determination and prayers are what he has relied on to firmly establish his niche.  With this loan, Moses, who is affliated with Kikongo Development group, says he is going to purchase more bottles of alcohol to resell.

loans.use: The purchase alcohol to resell

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel B. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old. Noel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes and banana cues in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Noel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products he sells. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make the products he sells

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years in Kisii town in western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, millet, cabbages and milk, which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. 

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes that this dairy cow will improve his milk production and that he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for both domestic consumption and sale. His major challenges have been poor weather conditions and low market prices for his products. He would like to acquire a motorbike in the future that will assist him in the transportation of his products to the market.

Samuel is 58 years old and married with 18 children who are between the ages of 5 and 30. Sixteen of the children are attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, 66 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Pedro owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Pedro still works hard to be able to provide for his family.

Pedro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 47 años de edad, madre de seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya casados, su negocio es el alquiler de cuartos teniendo dos años en este pequeño negocio, anteriormente trabajaba con productos naturistas.
Cuartos que mejoro mediante el financiamiento de Afodenic, para lograr dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Lo que hará con este nuevo préstamo, es la compra de una puerta, ponerle verja, y reparación de las ventanas también, para dar seguridad a su casa como  a su familia ya que por ser muy vieja la puerta necesita del cambio.
texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are already married. For the past two years, she has managed a small business renting out rooms. She previously sold natural products to earn a living.

These rooms have been improved as a result of financing from AFODENIC. This enables Reyna to provide better service to her customers.

She will use this new loan to purchase a door, install a fence, and repair the windows. As a result, her home and her family will be more secure since the existing door is very old and needs to be replaced.

loans.use: Purchase a door, install a fence, and repair her windows

loans.name: Pilarina

texts.en:
Pilarina is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and an abaca weaving businesses. Her husband Joelito, who is 45 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have three children who are 10 to 23 years old. Pilarina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Pilarina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,200,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of products for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Pilarina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Emiliya

texts.en: Emiliya is in a business selling beans, onions, simsim and peas. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, and has 9 children.  Seven of the children go to school. Emiliya asked for a loan to stock more beans, onions, simsim and peas . She hopes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beans, onions, simsim(sesame seed), and peas to sell.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Basilia is a widow who lives in Negros Oriental, Philippines. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, pig fattening and a pedicab business. She has eight children who are 33 to 49 years old. Basilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Basilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 35,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 40,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 40,000 to purchase merchandise to sell in her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and for business. Basilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kaliba Development Group

texts.en: K. Prossy, who is 27 years old, has been selling food in Lugazi town food market for close to seven years now. Prossy is optimistic about the further growth of her business in the future given the high demand for most of the foods she sells such as paw-paws, cabbage, pineapples and maize. The mother of one says that her business generates 300,000 UGX as weekly profits. With this loan, she is going to purchase more foods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods to resell

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Plus Group

texts.en:
“Main dans la main Plus” is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Marie. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
Blandine N. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She started her general store business in 2008. Today, she sells chemical products in a market to the east of Kinshasa. With good management skills and thanks to accumulated profits, she has succeeded in making her business thrive. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which earns her $150 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts to achieve her goals. Blandine is a trustworthy client of Kiva partner, HOPE RDC, having obtained and correctly repaid eleven loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying chemical products in bulk and reselling them at a profit. Forty-year-old Blandine is married and is the mother of five children, whose ages range between 6 and 13 years old. Four of them go to school. Her ambition is to open a chemical product storage facility in her environment.

loans.use: to purchase chemical products in bulk

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elvisa works hard to support her family. She has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Elvisa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

Elvisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for abaca (natural fiber) weaving.

loans.name: Reida

texts.en: Reida is 21 years old and single. She borrowed a loan to stock more sugar and beans to sell. She hopes to buy goats and chickens in the future with the extra profit from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kiima

texts.en: Kiima is a 32-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the photo-studio business for 10 years, in which he started with two million shillings and now has five million shillings as working capital. His hardship is competition with other people in the same business, and his vision is buying a printing machine for colored photographs plus educating his children. Kiima needs the loan to buy wedding gowns for rental.

loans.use: to buy wedding gowns for rental.

loans.name: Efracia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Efracia; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y entre otros productos, la socia también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y gallinas y luego los vende en el mercado, por medio de estos pequeños la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y alimentos para los chanchos y gallinas.    
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Efracia is a member of the "Reynita de Belen Ccorao" community bank which is located in Ccorao district, in Cusco province and department.

Efracia is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.  Efracia also raises pigs and hens which she sells in the market.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.

Efracia would like to expand her grocery store business and her animal business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for her grocery store and feed for her pigs and hens.

Efracia is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store and feed for her pigs and hens

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José es un joven D. 26 años D. edad, que  tiene un negocio mediante el cual venD. helados en un vehículo que circuL. por las calles D. L. ciudad  y que lleva por nombre “Helados Yiuleima” . Él  vive con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades D. 1, a 11 años, con quienes sueña verlos prósperos después D. haberles brindado una educación D. calidad y en esto invierte todos sus esfuerzos.
Su negocio nació hace dos años motivado por su padre, quien también se dedica a esta actividad hace más D. 5 años. Cuando José inició invirtió en un triciclo y se lo dio a su hermano para que empezara en L. venta, como se dio cuenta que el negoció le había resultado, fabricó dos triciclos mas, puso dos vendedores y luego agregó el suyo también. Actualmente venD. en toda L. playa y los dos vendedores en  un  corregimiento cercano  y en algunos barrios D. sus alrededores. Aproximadamente cuenta con 1500 clientes, trabaja desD. las 2:00 p.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y dos D. sus hijos, pues los otros 3 viven con su madre y abueL.. A José le gusta mucho su trabajo por eso quiere ampliar su cobertura, está muy felíz porque cuenta con el apoyo D. su familia y su hermano también se dedica a esta actividad. En su infraestructura cuenta con dos congeladores ubicados en L. casa D. su madre,  donD. almacena el producto. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el tendrá un capital D. trabajo disponible para hacer las compras D. sus helados y planea con su credikiva reemplazar pasivos costosos, lo cual permitiría un crecimiento rápido del mismo.
texts.en:
José is a young man of 26 who owns a business selling ice cream from a vehicle that goes round the streets of the city.  The business is called "Yiuleima Ice cream."  He lives with his wife; they have 5 children aged between 1 and 11 years.  He dreams of seeing them prosper after having been given a quality education, and it is into this that he puts all his efforts.

His business was born two years ago, prompted by his father who has also been working in this line of business for over 5 years.  When José started, he invested in a tricycle and gave it to his brother so he could start selling.  As he realized the business that had resulted from this, he maD. two more tricycles.  He hired two salespeople, and later added himself as well.  Currently he sells throughout the beach and the two salespeople sell in a nearby township and some surrounding neighborhoods.  He has approximately 1500 customers, and he works from 2:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. He lives in his own home with two of his children, as the other three live with their mother and grandmother. 

He lives in his own home with his spouse and two of his children.  José loves his work, so wants to expand his coverage.  He is very happy because he has the support of his family and his brother also works in this business.  His infrastructure is two freezers located in his mother's house, where he stores the product.  His Kiva loan is the first financing that he has done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, he will have working capital available to make purchases of ice cream, and he plans to use his Kiva loan to replace expensive financial liabilities.  These actions will allow rapid growth of the business.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and to replace expensive financial liabilities.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Roselyn has a retail shop where she sells snacks, biscuits and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods and snacks.

Roselyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Roselyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros tiene cuatro hijos,vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta cocinar y hacer quesos.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years. She is married and lives with her spouse and unmarried children. She has four children and she lives in the Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. 

The "EL DIVINO NIÑO" communal bank is located in the grounds of Estero Lindo in the Ventanas canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle farming such as sowing corn and rice.

María is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies from AGRIPAC and sells them in the Ventanas wholesale market.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy seeds and fertilizers for corn and rice, and  then sow them. With the support of this loan, she would have the financial help needed to provide for her basic needs. She faces challenges such as crop pests and a lack of money to pay more workers. Her dream is to buy a farm.

She likes cooking and making cheese.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for corn and rice.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old and married to George; they have two children aged eighteen and twelve. She has a hotel business which has been in operation for the last two years and which makes a monthly profit of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She has been loaned 20,000 KES with which she plans to purchase food ingredients for her hotel (rice, sugar, flour, cooking fat etc.).

With the anticipated profits she plans to educate her children. Her hope for the future is to continue running the hotel and maximize profits.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her hotel (rice, sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Tal

texts.en:
Mrs. Tal is a 48-year-old farmer who lives in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province. Mrs. Tal is married to Mr. Ra, also aged 48. The couple, who work together raising pigs, have five children: three of them are single and another is married and lives in a separate house. To assist her profits, her daughter works in a sewing factory and her son is a local construction worker in Phnom Penh, where they earn enough salary per month. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Tal has begun a business as a fish seller in one market far away from her house. Because of the long distance, Mrs. Tal would like a motorbike to help generate her income over time but she lacks the money, so she has decided to request some funding from HKL. 

She hopes that this funding will bring her family happiness and prosperity and help her to gain more profit every day. From these businesses, she expects she will have a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Silvia tiena la edad de 31 años, estudio hasta la universidad y es madre soltera de una pequeña niña que asiste a la secundaria.ella y su familia viven en una zona cañera. Silvia nos platica que a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y nos dice que se gana un poco mas cuando se tiene su propio negocio asi que hace un poco mas de 4 años inicio a rentar un pequeño local en el centro de su localidad en el cual vende zapatos por catalago, ella habre su negocio todos los dias desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche y en ese horario sus clientes la visitan  y le hacen sus pedidos de zapatos, cuando ella ya reune mas de diez pedidos los encarga, despues los entrega a sus clientesy ella recibe el pago por sus productos.

Silvia es integrante de un grupo llamado vicente Guerrero que esta formado por 5 personas de nombres:

Paulina venta de abarrotes 
Mirna venta de zapatos 
Oralia venta de perfumeria 
Gloria venta de ropa 
Cinthya venta de perfumeria
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old and has a university education.  She is a single mother with a young daughter who is in middle school.  Silvia and her family live in a sugar cane area.  Silvia tells us that she has always enjoyed working and that you earn a little more when you have your own business.  For this reason, a little over four years ago she started renting some small business premises in the center of town where she sells shoes from a catalog.  She opens her store every day, from nine in the morning until eight at night.  During these hours her customers visit her store and make orders for shoes.  When she has more than ten orders from her customers, she orders the items from the catalog and then delivers them to her customers and receives payment.

Silvia is a member of a group called 'Vicente Guerrero'.  The group has five other members: Paulina, who sells groceries; Mirna, who sells shoes; Oralia, who sells perfumes; Gloria, who sells clothes, and Cinthya, who sells perfume.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: I Wayan lives in Ekasari Sari Village. He is 50 years old and married with four children. His job is a driver and he earns an average income per day of   Rp 70,000. Besides being a driver, I Wayan also raises pigs with an income per month of Rp 200,000. He applied for a loan of Rp 5,000,000 to maintain his car and purchase two pigs. I Wayan plans to save the profits from his businesses for the future of his children. I Wayan lives with his wife and four children. All four children still attend school. I Wayan spends Rp 50,000 for the cost of food every day. To help with the family income, his wife sells bananas and coconuts at the market.

loans.use: To maintain his car and purchase two pigs

loans.name: Alla Tanou Group

texts.fr:
Mme W.P.Rolande est la représentante du groupe ALLA TANOU. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant. Il a 05 ans et va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 23 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 05 cartons de mèches pour son salon de coiffure.

Mme économise ses bénéfices pour agrandir son salon. Elle ambitionne amélioré son activité et prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
W.P. Rolande is the representative of the "Alla Tanou" group. She is married and the mother of one child. He is 5 years old and goes to school. She has two people dependent on her.

She has been a hairdresser for 6 years. She stocks up at the sector 23 market in town. Her clients are women.

She would like to buy 5 boxes of hair extensions for her hair salon.

She is saving up her profits so that she can expand her salon. Her goal is to improve her business and to care for her child.

loans.use: to purchase 5 cartons of hair extensions for her hair salon.

loans.name: Peninnah

texts.en:
Peninnah is 54 years old and a single mother of two.  To earn a living, she sells cereals.  She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person.  Apart from selling cereals, she practices farming to supplement her income.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.

She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. Peninnah needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша умная и активная девушка. Она студентка 4-го курса экономического факультета Национального Университета Таджикистана. Она учится хорошо и участвует во всех студенческих мероприятиях. Она родилась в районе Файзобод в семье рабочих. Её отец работает водителем на птицефабрике, а ее мать работает поваром в школе. В семье восемь детей. Бунафша запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bunafsha is an intelligent and energetic young woman. She is in her fourth year of studies at the Economics Department of the National University of Tajikistan. She is a good student and takes part in all student activities. She was born in the Faizobod region in a working-class family. Her father is a driver at a poultry factory farm, and her mother works as a school cook. There are eight children in the family. Bunafsha is requesting a loan in order to pay for her studies. She thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Uganda. She is single and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister’s daughter. 

Grace has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Grace sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Grace has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through selling paint.

The main business challenges for Grace include seasonality, thieves, and ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to start importing used clothes. Grace lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, paying rent for her business premises, and paying school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Tania Frineti

texts.es:
La socia Tania sigue perteneciendo en el banco comunal “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad D. Cusco. 

La socia Tania alterna sus actividades D. hogar con el comercio minorista, ella sigue dedicándose a la compra y vende de ropa de forma independiente, ella en últimos tiempo a aumentado de clientes pues la mercadería que vende es de calidad y a precios cómodos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones, casacas, polos y otras cosas más.

La socia Tania agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y D. mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tania still belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  She alternates her household chores with retail.  She’s still an independent clothing merchant.  She’s increased her customer base lately because the merchandise she sells is of good quality and affordable prices.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like pants, jackets, polo-type shirts and other things, for example.

Tania values and is grateful for the loan granted by this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Shamwenya Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the facilitator of the Shamwenya group. Margaret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and pay debts and other bills.

In 2012, the members of Shamwenya group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Margaret with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana, nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, ella está decidida a contraer esta nueva obligación para comprar nueva con la intensión de ofrecer a los clientes nuevos estilos en esta temporada que se acerca, su compra será en blusas casuales y de fiesta, vestidos, camisas, pantalones y faldas.
Ella considera que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado mantenerse y fortalecer el negocio de productos domesticos, por eso hoy quiere experimentar con ropa.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to be able to continue investing in her business.  She has decided to take on this new obligation to buy new things with the intent of offering her customers new styles for the approaching season.  She will buy casual and formal blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, and skirts.

She believes that these loans have allowed her to take care of herself and strengthen her business selling home products, which is why she now wants to experiment with clothing.
