loans.use: to buy casual and formal blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, and skirts

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old. She has 5 children between 9 months and 8 years old. Two of them go to school. She has spent 4 years in the business of selling clothes and radios. The loan will be used to add more clothes and radios to her store. From the profits, she hopes to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and radios for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 30 años de edad. Cuenta con una vivienda propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, provincia de Chanchamayo. Ahí vive con su pareja, Wilson, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 3 años. Todos los días son un reto para Julia. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos y alistar a sus pequeños hijos para la escuela. Sus labores no tienen descanso, pues tiene que ingeniárselas para distribuir su tiempo y dedicarse a la siembra. La agricultura es su actividad económica, de la que obtiene dinero suficiente para educar, alimentar y vestir a sus hijos.
Ella es propietaria de 2 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, en ellos siembra café, maíz y achiote.
Estos productos son rentables, dependiendo de cómo se negocien, y Julia sabe muy bien de eso.
“El achiote lo vendo a 5 soles el kilo y sale rápido por su demanda para preparar condimentos”, explica.
En este trabajo recibe la ayuda de su pareja y de personal operario a quienes contrata para limpieza, siembra y cosecha de sus tres productos.
Es consciente de que la venta es rentable, por eso quiere ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo y mejorar sus frutos. Ésta sería la primera vez que Julia obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos y participativa dentro de su banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”.
Con el dinero del crédito, podrá comprar bolsas de abono y pagar al personal que trabajará en sus tierras, cuyo precio es de 25 a 30 soles por cada uno el día.
texts.en:
Julia is 30. She has her own home in the Pachacutec native community, Chanchamayo province. She lives with her husband, Wilson, and their three children ages 12, 9 and 3. Every day is a challenge for Julia. She gets up very early to make food and get her little ones ready for school. She never gets a break, because she has to figure out how to divide her time and take care of their crops. She is a farmer, and she makes enough income from this to educate, feed, and clothe her children. She owns two parcels of fertile land where she plants coffee, corn and annatto. These products are profitable, depending on how one negotiates, and Julia knows how to negotiate.
"I sell the annatto for 5 Soles per kilo. It goes quickly because it is in demand for making seasoning," she explains.
Her husband helps her with the work, and they hire labourers for clearing, sowing and harvesting the land.
She knows that her sales are profitable. For this reason, she wants to expand her land and improve her crops. This will be her first loan from MFP, so she promises to be punctual with her payments and active in her communal bank, called "Los Claveles de Pachacutec".
With this loan, she will be able to buy bags of fertilizer and pay the labourers who will work her land; each one is paid 25 to 30 Soles per day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire labourers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38 years old and a single mother of one child aged 20. She is a mixed crop farmer who has been rearing chickens for the past three years. She makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Ann is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ann will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 
With the anticipated profit from the business, Ann will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick was born in Amerikwa Village in Teso South. He is married and has a family. Patrick has been involved in a small-scale motorcycle business for four years in Busia town, close to the border between Kenya and Uganda. Patrick wants to own a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community and make a difference and expand his micro business as well. Patrick will link with a Community Health Worker (CHW) working in his community and will support the community health worker by providing transport on set days. This will give much-needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during counseling appointments and health visits. Patrick hopes to recruit other members of his small business organization to join in supporting community health outreach programs in Teso community. Patrick will also use the income generated from his motorcycle taxi business to support his family. He hopes to become a CHW volunteer in his community once he has finished paying for his motorcycle

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Christ-Roi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CHRIST-ROI  est composé de trois personnes qui sont de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, nommée Joséphine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 27 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Joséphine est mariée a un transitaire du nom de Djamiou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Joséphine  vend du maïs et des pâtes dentifrices à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis cinq ans environ. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité. Joséphine ensemble avec les membres du groupe CHRIST-ROI groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et des pâtes dentifrices.

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en: Murvat lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He loves his family very much. His son has came back from army and he is a master. Murvat has been in the agriculture products reselling business for many years. He is using the money which he earn from his business to help his family. Today he needs third loan in the amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan Murvat wants to buy more barley,alfalfa,wheat for reselling etc for reselling. In the future, he wants to have his own store in the bazaar. This will be more profitable for his business. Rashid is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy  more barley,alfalfa,wheat for reselling etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana Fast foods is a joint operated by Diana Q. and patronized by a lot of clients within the area Diana operates. She is has been a long standing client of Kraban and has participated in the TEACH lending skills program. She needs a loan amount of $1050 to expand her activities.

loans.use: Micro Wave Oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rebecca plans to buy 10 goats and two cows

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Kibuka is an active member of Life in Africa. She is a very respected lady whom most people at the centre address as mother(mama). She is a Muganda by tribe, and the respect for her is not only at the WE Centre but also where she stays. Her husband is the Local chairperson of the area.

She joined Life in Africa in 2003 as craft maker and since then she has participated fully in the community's activities. She serves on the community disciplinary committee where her wisdom is always valued. She is also a tailor by profession and even most of her children have taken up her profession at higher level.

Rebecca has a large home and wishes to have a poultry house at home. This poultry will help her earn some extra income and improve a lot more on her home diet. She is requesting for a loan of 250,000/= for buying iron sheets and ventilator gauze for roofing the poultry house. Part of the money will be used for paying the labourers.

Rebecca being a determined lady, she has already taken care of things like chicken, the feeds and other things required for poultry. All that she needs the loan for is roofing. She will be able to repay her loan monthly since she has many small sources of income. The business will keep some of her children busy during the free times.

Her budget is as below:

15 iron sheets each at 10,000/= ........... 150,000/=

Large ventilator Gauze ................ 50,000/=

Labour ................ 50,000/=

Total ................ 250,000/=

loans.use: Buying iron sheets, Ventilator Gauze and paying labourers

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Mrs. Priscilla O. is 35 years old, married with 3 children and hails from an urban sector in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years. She sells drugs and need the above loan to improve her business. She has been in this business since 2000.

loans.use: To buy drugs for sale

loans.name: Dewi Komala

texts.id:
Dewi Komala rents the house she and her husband lives in with their 2 kids, Sifa (4.5 yrs) and Agil (9.5 months). As a housewife, Dewi needs to take care of her children while running her fried rice business. Her husband works as a seasonal construction worker who earns about $45 per month. However her husband's income is not enough to support their family as they need to spend $45 for living expenses and $25 for children tuition (their other kids in Java). Dewi sells her kiosk from a makeshift kiosk and tent. She sells fried rice in front of her rented home. She earns about $5 per day. She plans to use the loan to increase capital. Hopefully she can expand her business so she can better fulfill her family's need and tuition for her 4 children.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Dewi Komala tinggal di rumah kontrakan bersama suami dan 2 orang anaknya. Sifa – 4,5 tahun dan Agil – 9,5 bulan. Sebagai ibu rumah tangga – sembari menjalankan usaha nasi gorengnya - Dewi mengurus kedua anaknya yang masih kecil. Suaminya bekerja sebagai kuli bangunan – yang baru bekerja apabila ada proyek. Pendapatan per bulannya mencapai Rp 450.000,00. Penghasilannya saja tidak mencukupi untuk kebutuhan mereka. Per bulannya, mereka harus mengeluarkan Rp 450.000,00 untuk biaya hidup dan Rp 250.000,00 untuk biaya pendidikan anak (2 anak mereka yang di Jawa). Sarana yang digunakan Dewi untuk berjualan adalah rombong. Dia berjualan di depan rumah kontrakkannya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perharinya mencapai Rp 50.000,00. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dia gunakan untuk tambahan modal. Harapannya supaya usahanya ini berkembang. Sehingga akan mampu memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarga, maupun biaya pendidikan keempat anaknya.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Amina Abdul

texts.pt:
Amina is not officially married but she lives with the father of her 5 children. Amina's husband is unemployed at this time. He works with Amina at their retail counter - while she cooks, he helps the costumers. Amina joined the program in 2006. Her work location is in Homoine, in the distict of the same name. Amina's children are all in school. If business goes well and generates a profit she will use it to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Amina e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. O marido de Amina nao esta empregado. Trabalha com Amina na Barraca, enquanto ela cozinha ele atende os clientes.Alima entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela faz o seu negocio em Homoine, sede do distrito do mesmo nome.Os filhos de Amina estao a estudar. Se o negocio correr bem e tiver bons rendimentos pensa reabilitar a casa.

loans.use: Amina wants to use the loan amount to purchase products for her retail counter ( ingredients that will be used to prepare food and beverages.)

loans.name: Luz Jacqueline

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Jacqueline belongs to the communal bank La Amistad (friendship). She lives in the Jr. El Dorado #232, Moyabamba district and province, San Martin department. She rents a stand in the central market of Moyabamba in which she sells breakfasts such as juanes (a rice-based dish similar to a tamale wrapped in bijao or banana leaves), tacacho con cecina (barbecued bananas mashed into balls, with dry meat), chorizo, and drinks like coffee, oatmeal, and different flavors of tea. Her sales have increased because of the careful attention she offers her customers, and this motivates her to improve every day. She decided to start her business because she likes cooking and being financially independent, as well as helping out with the expenses required to support her family.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 (US$ 675 approx), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy sacks of sugar and rice, gallons of oil, and other ingredients required daily in her business. With part of it she will help her husband buy a motorcycle to generate more income.

Mrs. Luz Jacqueline is 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children, a boy and a girl, and is very happy in spite of the enormous effort required to attend both her household and business activities. She has the support of her husband and children with the housework, and she takes advantage of the afternoons to do housework herself. Her goal is to have her own food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz Jacqueline pertenece del Banco comunal La Amistad, vive en el Jr. El Dorado No 232, del Distrito y Provincia provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Tiene alquilado un puesto en el mercado central de Moyabamba en donde vende desayunos como juanes, tacacho con cecina, chorizo, bebidas para tomar como café, avena y te de diferentes sabores, por la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes sus ventas aumentaron, lo cual la motiva a seguir mejorando cada día. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta cocinar, ser independiente económicamente y apoyar en los gastos que requiere para sacar adelante a su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones y los demás ingredientes que necesita a diario en su negocio. Con una parte apoyara a su esposo en la compra de un motocar (moto) para generar mas ingresos. La señora Luz Jacqueline tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, un varón y una mujer, esta contenta, a pesar del enorme esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para poder atender las actividades de la casa y del negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos con las actividades de la casa, ella aprovecha la tarde para realizar las actividades domesticas. Su meta es contar con un puesto propio.

loans.use: Buying supplies and ingredients; buying a motorcart. (Compra  de insumos e ingredientes.  Compra de un motocar.)

loans.name: Nolia

texts.es:
Señora Nolia belongs to the "Virgen de la Natividad" (Virgin of the Nativity) communal bank, which is located at 236 Jr. Sinchi Roca in the Callería district in the department of Ucayali. She is 28-years-old and is the mother of 1 young son. Her husband is a veterinarian. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small grocery store in her home.

She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to do her housework and to simultaneously attend to her store until 9:00 p.m., when she rests for the following day.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 4 boxes of oil, 2 boxes of milk, 2 containers of eggs, etc.

Nolia is happy. At first, her business was a little difficult, but little by little, she started to have clients and everything changed as time went by. Now her sales are stable and grow every day. Things are changing for her well-being and that of her family, and she is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all of the support they have given to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nolia pertenece al banco comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 236, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años y es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad, su esposo es Medico Veterinario. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega en su domicilio.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega. Se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. para realizar sus actividades en la casa y simultáneamente atiende en su bodega hasta las 9 p.m., luego descansa par el siguiente día.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 4 cajas de aceite, 2 cajas de leche, verduras, 2 casilleros de huevos, etc.

Nolia está muy feliz. Al principio el negocio era un poquito difícil, pero poco a poco empezó a tener clientes y todo fue cambiando con el paso del tiempo. Ahora su venta está estable y crece cada día. Las cosas van cambiando para su bien y el de su familia y además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (sugar, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Kumry

texts.en:
J. Kumry lives in the B.Gafurov region, and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. sells cloth. She has a wide assortment because she sells the material for making the national dresses.

Mrs. J. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she has successfully repaid her loans and improved her business. Now she is applying for a loan of $1200 for 8 months to import a wider variety of good cloth to sell.

loans.use: To import a wide assortment of cloth for selling

loans.name: Estelvina Irene

texts.es:
Ms. Estelvina is a merchant with vast experience in retail sales of clothing, footwear and cosmetics, and this work has allowed her and her family to live a decent life. She also works on and off as a seamstress. Her husband, a construction worker, also supports the family. They live in Villa Venezuela and have 2 children, an 8- and a 12-year-old, in elementary school. They dream of giving them everything they need and helping pay their expenses. With her business, this entrepreneurial woman has positively contributed to the growth of her family, since it has allowed them to improve the quality of life of each member of the family and help her husband with the household costs. Her solid management of the business and the careful and friendly service she offers her clients has helped her to grow her business and develop a substantial client base. She is requesting a loan to purchase men’s and women’s undergarments that her clients have been asking for. She would like to meet this demand and always keep her clients happy.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Estelvina es una comerciante que posee una vasta experiencia en venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos al por menor, es esta actividad la que le ha permitido vivir de manera digna con su familia. También se dedica esporadicamente a la costura. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien labora como albañil. Esta familia vive en Villa Venezuela, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando en primaria y por lo cual estos padres desean brindarles lo necesario y poderles cubrir sus necesidades. Con su negocio esta mujer emprendedora ha contribuido de forma positiva en el desarrollo de su familia, ya que le ha permitido mejorar el nivel de vida de cada miembro del núcleo familiar y apoyar a su esposo con la carga del hogar. La buena administración de la señora en el negocio y la atención esmerada y agradable que le brinda a sus clientes le ha ayudado para expandirse y ahora cuenta con un buen numero de clientes a quienes les ofrece sus productos. La señora solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior de dama y caballeros, que le han solicitado sus clientes y desea satisfacer esa demanda existente y brindar siempre a sus clientes lo que le demanden.

loans.use:
Purchase men's and women's undergarments for their sale

Comprar ropa interior de dama y caballeros para comercializarla

loans.name: Mwansiti

texts.en:
Mwansiti is 33 years old and is married with 5 children. Mwansiti is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kafui D. is 27 years old and single. She works as a seamstress. She specializes in sewing boubous (traditional West African outfit), as well as clothing for women, young girls, and children. Her workshop is located in Adéta, a small village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this second loan from FECECAV, she would like to buy fabric which she will use to make clothing. She would also like to buy a sewing machine to improve her work in order to meet her customers’ needs and to participate in the development of her community.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Kafui D. est âgée de 27 ans et célibataire. Elle opère dans la couture. Elle est spécialisée dans la confection des boubous, des habits des femmes, des jeunes filles et des enfants. Son atelier de couture est situé à Adéta, un petit village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise .Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, elle aimerait acheter les tissus avec lesquels elle confectionne les habits. Elle désire également acheter une machine à coudre pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa clientèle et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a lovely elderly woman who spends that her days caring for her family and animals. In addition, she works in the countrysiD. to raise cattle and sheep, by which she obtains considerable sums of money to improve the quality of life for the members of her household. She wishes to further improve her occupation and, for this reason, she asks for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

TERESA, es una adorable ancianita que se dedica el día entero a cuidar D. su familia y D. sus animalitos, además D. desempeñarse en las labores del campo se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino y D. estos obtiene sumas considerables D. dinero con los que ha podido mejorar la calidad D. vida D. los miembros D. su hogar, desea mejorar aún más su ocupación y a esa razón atienD. su solicitud.

loans.use: Buying a greater number of animals

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ilva is 30 years old and is a shopkeeper. In her home she has a small store where she sells basic products of consumption to people in her neighborhood Laureles Sur. She started this business 5 years ago with her own capital and it has continued to grow thanks to the loans of AFODENIC.

Ilva’s dream is to see the store converted into a prosperous business that will give her financial stability. Ilva is married and has 4 children of the ages of 4, 6, 8, and 12. With the loan she would make a concrete wall so as to make it stronger and more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Ilva tiene 30 años de edad, es una pequeña comerciante, en su casa de habitación tiene una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo básico para sus vecinos del barrio Laureles Sur. Hace 5 años empezó este negocio con capital propio y ha ido creciendo gracias a los préstamos otorgados por AFODENIC.

El sueño de Ilva es ver su pulpería convertida en un negocio próspero y autosostenible. Ilva es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 4, 6, 8 y 12 años de edad. Con el crédito hará un muro minifalda de concreto para así hacerla más fuerte y más segura.

loans.use: Construction of a wall in her home

loans.name: Vuong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vuong Thi X., 53 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. She owns a small general shop at the supermarket. Besides, she also raises pigs and chickens at home. Therefore, her family economy is very stable. She has 2 children, one of whom is grown-up and has a job. Her husband also helps her in getting the merchandises as well as in raising the animals. This time, she wants to borrow 925 USD to invest in raising the animals and her general store. Her current average income is 200 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

 Chị Vương Thị Xuân năm nay 53 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Hiện tại gia đình chị có một cửa hàng kinh doanh tạp hoá tại chợ. Ngoài kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá gia đình chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà nên thu nhập rất ổn định.Gia đình chị có 2 con, một con đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định. Chồng chị hàng ngày ngoài việc đi lấy hàng về cho chị bán còn giúp đỡ chị trong công việc chăn nuôi nên công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng có nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá Thu nậhp 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: general store and raising animals

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad K. is 56 years old and the father of 6 children. He lives in in a small village located in the north of Lebanon's Bekaa Valley. Muhammad owns and operates a generator that supplies electricity to houses in the neighborhood.

While most houses and businesses in this region are connected to the electric grid, Lebanon typically sees at least 3 hours per day of outages and many rely on local generators for alternative power.

Muhammad has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years and has asked for a loan of US$ 1200. It has been a lifelong wish of Muhammad to see his son get married, and finally the day has arrived. The money from this loan will be used to help pay for his son's upcoming wedding ceremony and complete construction on the home of this groom-to-be.

loans.use: To help with the costs of a son's wedding

loans.name: Seng Sam-At's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-At S. (the first from the right with his wife and group members) was selected to be a group leader by the other members for a loan from Maxima. In the group, there are two families including his family. The entire group members are living on an island near the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Sam-At S. (age 51) and his wife, Mrs. Sok Chin, were married in 1980 and have three children - one son and two daughters. Both of their daughters are married and live outside the family home while the youngest son weaves silk at home. Sam-At has been a mason for a company for ten years and Mrs. Sok is a silk weaver. Sam-At is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase silk materials for his wife's weaving business and to purchase pig feed.

2-Mrs. Savet (the second from the left with her husband), 27 years old, and her husband, Mr. SmoeU. Meng, 27 years old, were married in 2001 and have three daughters. Savet has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned form her neighbor. Her husband has been a silk weaver since 2001 as well. Savet is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 8 hijos, estudió el tercer grado D. primaria y vive en el Jr. La Paz s/n, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chuchito, departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” D. Juli. Al inicio, con el préstamo D. S/. 300, compró bordados en bayeta. A los 13 años D. edad empezó a estudiar el primer grado D. primaria porque sus padres no la apoyaban. Cuando pasaron unos tres años más tuvo su esposo y su hijo. No contó con el apoyo suficiente D. su esposo, lo que la obligo a  dedicarse al bordando y a la venta del mismo en Puno, En la actualidad sigue con su negocio D. bordado y a veces cuando no le alcanza el tiempo compra D. la gente del campo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprara 3 ganados ovinos para engorD. a S/. 360.00 y 2 ganados porcinos.

Su deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales mientras ella siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old, married, and a mother of 8 children. She studied until third graD. and lives on La Paz Street in the district of Juli, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is a member of the Niño San Salvador Communal Bank in Juli. At first, with her loan of 300 soles ($100), she bought embroidered cloth. At 13 years old, she began to study first graD., because her parents did not support her. When three more years went by, she got married and had a son. She didn’t get enough support from her husband, so she decided to start embroidering and sell the embroidery in Puno. Currently she continues with the embroidery business and sometimes when she doesn’t have enough time, she buys them from people in the country (rural area). With this loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be repaid over 4 months, she will buy 3 sheep to fatten for 360 soles ($117) and 2 pigs. Her wish is that her children become professionals while she is still working.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 sheep to fatten and two pigs

loans.name: Rosa Hortencia

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. She is 51 years old and married with five children. Rosa makes homemade ice cream with the help of her children; she sells it from home and in regional markets. She also buys cheese and grains from the markets and resells them to stores in the city of Ayacucho. 

Rosa is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy ingredients like milk and food coloring. She has been a FINCA client for 14 years, and says that her business is much stronger today thanks to FINCA’s help. She has more clients and dominates more of the local ice cream market. Her goal for the future is to start another business.

loans.use: Buy milk and food coloring to make ice cream

loans.name: Mia

texts.es: Mia tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y está en espera de su próximo bebe. Es natural de la ciudad de Lima, se dedica a la venta de ropa en la ciudad de Puno desde hace un año, pero también viaja constantemente a Puerto Maldonado donde tiene una tienda sucursal. Ella tiene como experiencia 2 años en la venta de ropa, en los cuales ha trabajado muy duro para poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica, la cual ahora espera consolidar en beneficio de su bebé, el cual viene en camino. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es viajar constantemente en su estado, pero tiene que hacerlo, ya que no puede descuidar el negocio. Mia se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa que traerá desde Lima para vender en las ciudades de Puno y Puerto Maldonado.
texts.en:
Mia is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and is expecting her first child. She is originally from Lima and has sold clothing in Puno for the last year. She also travels frequently to Puerto Maldonado, where she has another shop. Mia has two years of experience selling clothes, and in that time she has worked very hard to ensure a stable income. She hopes to further consolidate her income for the benefit of her child. The hardest part about Mia's job is that she has to travel constantly. But, she understands that this is necessary, since she cannot neglect her business.

This is Mia's second loan from Kiva's partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual in her payments. With this loan she will purchase more clothing in Lima to sell in Puno and Puerto Maldonado.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of merchandise sold

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
For Liza J., being a helpful and loving wife is what life is all about. Residing in Usocan, the Municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, she and her husband operate a fish vending business, which generates income to meet the family's daily living expenses. Liza and her husband work very hard, and they want nothing more than to raise their child well and to provide the child with a good education.

On a daily basis, Liza’s husband goes to the port early in the morning to buy batches of fish from the big fishermen. Liza, meanwhile, will sell the fish by packaging the fish in foams, pails, and plastic basins, and by walking around with a scale to weigh the fish for her customers.

Even so, it is extremely difficult for Liza to sell fish on the move; further, she understands that there are more potential customers at a set location (i.e., a market) and thus another way to sell more fish than she is currently selling. As a result, Liza is in need of capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to rent a space in the wet market where she can sell their fish. In turn, she expects to generate an increase in profits, which would be used by her husband to buy more than the usual batches of fish he is currently buying from the fish wholesalers.

loans.use: To improve her business by renting space at the fish market

loans.name: Shiimaa

texts.en:
Shiimaa T. is a 63-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and son. Together with her husband and son, she runs several types of micro businesses which include sewing, selling goods from a general store, making and selling summer hats and making winter hats. Her husband and son make the hats and the son sells them at Narantuul, Mongolia's largest outdoor market. 

They make 30-50 hats per day at a cost of MNT 950 each (US $1.00 is equal to MNT 1,550.00) and sell them to a retailer for MNT 3500. The retailer sells them each for MNT 5000. Shiimaa works at her own stall to sell several types of clothes and her family's hats. Shiimaa's son aspires to have his own stall at Narantuul one day.

Shiimaa has been taking loans from XacBank since 2002, and would like to take out her 13th loan. Her family's business capital is MNT 2.0 million. She has bought a car for her family business needs and expanded her house where the hat production takes place. She would like to take out a loan to buy cotton and wool materials for making hats.

loans.use: To buy cotton and wool material for making hats

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Marcos V. es comerciante y empresario, tiene 45 años de edad es residente del Barrio Buenos Aires, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 12 años en los cuales a tenido mucho exito, logrando asi buena estabilidad economica para toda su familia.
tiene 6 empleados que le ayudan a la elaboracion y venta de los articulos.
el necesita un prestamo para la compra de materiales como ser tablas, lijas, pinturas, mazonite.
el sueño de el es tener una tienda comercial en donde el venda su producto.
texts.en:
Mister Marcos V. is a merchant and businessman, 45 years old, a resident of Buenos Aires, and has been doing his line of work for 12 years, during which he has had much success, achieving good economic stability for his family.

He has 6 employees that help with the production and sale of goods. He needs a loan to buy materials such as boards, sandpaper, paint and hardboard.

His dream is to have a commercial store where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make furniture

loans.name: Nasira Tariq Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasira and I am a citizen of a city called Lahore, which is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. My husband's name is T. H. and he runs a tea stall in the food market. He has a good number of customers. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years.

I am a mother of six girls. My first two daughters weave carpets. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting educated. I help my daughters in their carpet weaving business. We complete a carpet in 1 month and than we sell it to the carpet shop and earn a good income.

I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I’m applying again for a loan to buy supplies (tea, sugar and milk) for my husband’s tea stall.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy school bags to sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy vehicles' spare parts to sell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Asia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for tea stall

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura has been a clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Tujielimishe group loan (Group code 2055). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $30. She works at her business daily.

She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zuhura is 30 years old, married, and has two children, aged 12 and 5. She also cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business.

loans.name: Damdinragchaa

texts.en:
Damdinragchaa D. lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family moved from Arhanghay province to Ulaanbaatar, like many other migrating families who are in search of a better life. His two sons are both university students in Ulaanbaatar.

Dambinragchaa makes various horse saddles for herders who use horses for transportation. Dambinragchaa is a skilled saddle maker with dozens of years of experience under his belt. After the move to the capital city, he started making various saddles and rented a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, to sell his saddles. His income from the saddle-making business is the main source of income for his family.

He hopes to be able to support his two sons' university education and pay their tuitions on time until they graduate. Damdinragchaa is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for his saddle-making business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his saddle-making business

loans.name: Suraiya Karamat Masih Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a citizen of a mid-sized city named Vehari, Pakistan. She is a very hard-working lady. She sews clothes day and night and earns money. She saves her income for a rainy day. Her husband prepares embroidered dresses on orders which he collects from the clothes shops. He completes 1 dress in 15 days. Suraiya baji is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) so that her husband fill the orders of his customers.

Suraiya baji is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her embroidery business. Abida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shazia khursheed baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidered clothes

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
N. Lê Thị (440971364) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two infant children. 

N. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to buy piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, razón por la cual, pone mucho esfuerzo con el trabajo que realiza.

Orfita, es una mujer joven, le gusta trabajar y se siente mal cuando no tiene nada que hacer, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas/pollos, con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, se inicio con S/. 200.00 y viene dedicándose a este negocio poco tiempo, tiene la esperanza que le ira muy bien. Con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito salchipapero y luego; poco a poco fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de salchipapa/pollos, ubicada afuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 5:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Orfith, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Orfith belongs to the La Marginal II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 27, and she has a dependent son who is in school. He is the reason she puts so much effort in the work she does. Orfita is a young woman who likes to work; she feels bad when she does not have something to do. On her own initiative she decided to sell “salchipapas” (a typical Peruvian dish) with chicken in order to contribute to the household income. She started with 200 PEN, and she has been in this business for a short time. She hopes that it will go very well. With help from her significant other they bought a cart called a salchipapero (apparatus fitted with gas fryers and various compartments to conserve hot fried foods). Then, little by little, they are buying utensils and materials to offer better service to her customers. She currently continues selling salchipapa with chicken outside of her house where there is plenty of movement. She is doing very well in her sales. She starts selling at 5:00 on the afternoon. That is when many customers want to taste an appetizer. She waits on them with kindness and her characteristic charisma. With the loan for 1,000 PEN she wants to buy chickens, sacks of potatoes, packages of oil, and some kitchen utensils to replace the ones she currently has. That way she will offer her customers better service and attention. Orfith is very sure that her business will prosper more than it is now. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her salchipollos (typical Peruvian dish)

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 35-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working as a blacksmith for ten years. Yasser requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Yasser is noted for his punctuality and efficiency. His clients can be anybody from inside or outside his region. Yasser didn’t face difficulties when he first started his business. He decided on this work to meet his family’s needs. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah A. is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She sells eggs and ice blocks. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more eggs and a deep freezer. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory

loans.name: Laure Damienne

texts.fr: Laure Damienne est née vers 1969. Laure Damienne est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. Laure Damienne est couturière de formation. La famille vit à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin.  Laure Damienne vend des articles de mercerie dans sa boutique en face de continental Bank Bénin de Cocotomey. C’est au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin, que Laure Damienne achète ses articles. Laure Damienne demande ce prêt d’ALIDé pour accroître son capital et satisfaire la demande sans cesse grandissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Laure Damienne is born around 1969. She is married and the mother of two children. Laure Damienne is a trained seamstress. The family lives in Cocotomey, close to Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Laure Damienne sells sewing supplies in her shop in front of the Continental Bank Benin of Cocotomey. Laure Damienne buys her goods in Nigeria, a neighboring state of Benin and is requesting this loan from ALIDE in order to increase her capital and to meet the ever growing request of her clientele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Efigenia Z. reside en el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León y se ha destacado por ser una dama que se esfuerza para reconstruir su vivienda porque ha sido dañada fuertemente al pasar del tiempo y por los fenómenos físicos.

Es por esta razón que la señora Efigenia solicita un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda esperando que dicho crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera hacer realidad su sueño de tener un techo digno donde vivir y llevar el bienestar a su familia,
texts.en:
Sra. Efigenia Z. lives in the town of Telica in the district of León. She has struggled to rebuild her house after it was heavily damaged due to the passage of time and physical phenomena.

For this reason, Sra. Efigenia is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to repair her home. She hopes that her loan will be approved. This will fulfill her dream of having a decent roof over her family and providing for their welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits specializing banana in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gemma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Señor De Mayo Chimba Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy antiguo y muy responsables en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SEÑOR D. MAYO CHIMBA ", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas,  como presidenta esta  la señora  Deysi G. ,ella es lider D. su grupo, venD. comida, vive en casa familiar tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como  taxista libre, su niño menor tiene la enfermedad D. sindrome D. Down. Como tesorera esta la socia Erika Sulma M.  quien es  socia nueva, pero el grupon la conoce como una persona responsable y  sociable. Esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, Tiene su internet en su domicilio como tambien venD. cosmeticos , el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital para su internet . Como secretaria esta la socia Jhoana C. L.  quien es una socia joven, , venD. cosmeticos por catalogos y entrega ropa a credito por su barrio, como tambien trabaja en una imprenta.
texts.en:
This is a very old group that is very responsible with its payments. The members live in the same neighborhood where they know each other well. The group is called "Señor D. Mayo Chimba," where the communal bank is in its 2nd cycle. The Board of Directors is maD. up of members who are very responsible with their money collection and are very united.

As president, Deysi G. is the leader of the group. She sells food and lives in a house with her three children. Her husband works as a taxidriver, and her youngest son has Downs Syndrome.

As treasurer, Erika is a new member, but the group knows her as a responsible and friendly individual. She is married and has four children. She has internet at home and also sells cosmetics. She will use the loan to increase capital for her internet.

As secretary, Jhoana is a young member. She sells cosmetics through catalogues and sells clothing on credit in her neighborhood. She also works in a printing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor A. Rodríguez A., tiene 43 años la edad, casado y tiene 2 hijos uno de 16 años y otro de 5 años que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar fertilizante para la siembra y mantenimiento del café. Hace muchos años que el se dedica a la agricultura pero tiene deseos de crecer. Es el primer préstamo que realiza con FUDECOSUR.Su finca es de 3 hectáreas en la cual tiene sembrado café. El no tenía problemas con su finca, pero el quiere crecer y tener una finca provechosa y productiva, la cual desea heredar a sus hijos en un futuro. Él desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, para ello está trabajando duro para poder brindarles todo lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación y se preparen para la vida.
texts.en:
Victor A. Rodríguez A. is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children (ages 16 and 5) who are his top priority. He wants to buy fertilizers that will be used in planting and maintaining his coffee crop. Victor has been farming for many years and has the desire to expand.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has 3 hectares of farmland that are designated for growing coffee. Victor has not had any problems with his farm, but he wants it to grow so that it will continue to be fruitful and productive and can be passed along to his children in the future. He wants his children to continue studying and become professionals, so he is working hard to provide them everything they need to have a good education and be prepared for life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his coffee crop

loans.name: Sabadell Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sabadell” esta representado por la señora Felicidad y conformada por 14 socias que se con conocen desD. hace tiempo por que viven en la misma zona y saben como trabajar en equipo. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la comercialización D. productos como edredones, sabanas, ropa, madera, pollos, cosméticos, recipientes desechables, atención en fotocopiadora, transporte público D. pasajeros  y a la fabricación D. muebles D. madera. La competencia que les rodea es alta pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus ganas D. salir adelante luchan para sacar a flote sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento pes para la adquisición D. mercadería, herramientas para sus carpinterías, para cortar madera, también para repuesto D. sus vehículos. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The "Sabadell" group is maD. up of 14 members from the same neighborhood who have known each other for a long time and know how to work in a group. They are represented by Felicidad. The majority of the members sell products like comforters, sheets, clothing, lumber, chickens, cosmetics, disposable containers, run a photo copying service, public transportation of passengers, and the manufacture of wood furniture. They are surrounded by a high degree of competition but, thanks to their experience and willingness to get ahead, they make the effort to have their businesses succeed since this is what produces support for their families. The financing will be used to purchase merchandise, carpentry tools to saw lumber, and replacement parts for their vehicles. They have credit management experience since they have had financing from similar institutions but this is the first time they wave worked with an institution that offers them trust and economic support. For this reason they wish to continue to grow with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es una serena mujer de 31 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Anteriormente se dedicaba únicamente a sus  cultivos de café y plátanos; de los cuales, cada quince días realizaba sus cosechas de plátanos vendiéndolos desde su misma chacra, en esta rutina le propusieron que se dedique a la compra y venta de plátanos. Desde entonces en compañía de su esposo, compra los plátanos de las chacras una vez por semana y después los envían hacia los mercados de la ciudad, pero el resto de los días continúa trabajando en sus chacras. Rufina ama las tareas agrícolas, ya que gracias a ellas viene manteniendo cómodamente a sus hijos.
Ahora tiene propuesto incrementar sus cultivos de plátanos y de ese modo enviar a los mercados sus propios productos, sin la necesidad de comprar de otras personas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante este tiempo, ser parte de un banco comunal ha sido una muy bonita experiencia para Rufina, pues los integrantes de su grupo son responsables en sus cuotas y no han tenido problemas de mora. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y plantitas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Rufina is a calm 31-year-old, who lives with her partner, the father of their three children, in their own home. She used to farm just coffee and bananas. Every two weeks she could harvest bananas and would sell them directly from her farmlands. It was suggested to her that she could become a banana merchant so, together with her husband, they began to buy bananas from neighboring farms once a week and would send them to tthe markets in the city to sell. The rest of the days she continues working her own lands. Rufina loves farming chores because she can support her children comfortably thanks to them. Her current plan is to increase the size of her banana plantations so that she can send her product to market without having to buy from third parties. This is her third loan with MFP. Rufina has enjoyed being part of a communal bank all this time very much because her group members are responsible with their repayments and haven't had any problems with lateness. The funds she is requesting now will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and banana seedlings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and banana plants.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana Julia de 39 años de edad,  madre soltera con tres hijos, mujer emprendedora a pesar de la situación que ha vivido ella lo ha superado, de profesión costurera y tiene otros ingreso que es el alquiler de un cuartos, tiene como objetivo seguir mejorando los cuartos para ofrecerles mayor comodidad y cobrar mayor cantidad por ellos, la señora elabora camisas, faldas y vestidos y los pone en venta además de los encargos que llegan, los créditos anteriores que ha solicitado lo ha invertido en la construcción de otros cuartos. La costura trabajo de dedicación ya que los pedidos tienen que ser entregados a tiempo y forma. Con el préstamo que solicita en este ciclo será invertido en la compra de telas variables, botones, hules y otros artículos de costuras. Los factores que cubre con los benéficos que ella alcanzara son seguridad y comodidad para su familia como para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 39 years old and is a single mother of three. She is an enterprising woman who has achieved success in spite of the difficult situations she has experienced. She is a seamstress, and has other income from renting rooms. Her objective is to continue improving the rooms so as to make them more comfortable and so she can charge more for them. Ana Julia makes shirts, skirts and dresses and offers them for sale in addition to the orders that come in. Her previous loans were invested in the construction of rooms. This dressmaker works with dedication and makes sure that the orders that she has are delivered in full and on time. With the loan that she requests in this cycle, she will invest in the purchase of a variety of fabrics, buttons, thread and other items used in dressmaking. The benefits that she strives for with this loan are the increased security and comfort of her family and her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics, buttons, thread and other products used in dressmaking

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita E. is from the town of Rizal, Lapaz Tarlac. She is 63 years old. Teresita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing dress making services to local community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase used sewing machine. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a used sewing machine

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn K. is 48 years old. She lives in Pris Leu village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and rice middleman. With her farming, she has a problem because she doesn't have enough money to buy rice seeds, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy them for her current business.

Mrs. Morn K. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, while the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque farms for a living. He plants rice crops to earn an income for his family. He got married to his wife Chona in 2003 and they now have a one-year old child. He wants to start saving now for his child’s future education. He also wants to improve his family’s living condition. Roque needs additional capital for his farm. He applied for a loan worth 7,000 Philippine pesos. If granted, he will use the loan to buy farm supplies needed at his farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth B. S. es una joven de 22 años de edad la cual vive con su pequeño hijo en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Hace poco Elizabeth consiguió trabajo en un hotel pero comenta que este  se encuentra  muy lejos de su casa y que se le dificulta la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público. 

Por lo cual Elizabeth ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja así también podrá  ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢654.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Elizabeth forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Elizabeth destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth B. S. is a young woman of 22 years. She lives with her small son in the hamlet of Caño Negro situated in the canton of Los Chiles in Alajuela province. The hamlet is located in mountainous terrain and is very near the northern border of Costa Rica. Farming and agriculture are the area’s main economic activities, with staple grains, sugar cane and oranges as the principal crops. Recently, Elizabeth managed to secure a job in a hotel, but reports that getting to and from work is difficult as a result of the hotel being of considerable distance from her house, local roads being in poor condition, and few public buses. To solve the issue of transport and to be able to save on time and money, Elizabeth has decided to buy a moped. Therefore, she needs a loan of ¢654 (six hundred and fifty four Costa Rican Colons) to buy the moped and to provide her own means of transport. Elizabeth is part of the Communal Credit lending company Emcrecoba, one of the 100 organisations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Elizabeth’s first loan. Elizabeth expresses thanks to these types of organisations and credit facilitators, as they make it possible for her to focus on more productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moped

loans.name: Yojana Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo barrio las colinas la señora Yojana Lisbeth Ríos M. realiza la venta de sus productos (ropa Variada) en su tramo ubicado en el mercado municipal de esa localidad. Ella quiere el crédito para comprar ropa variada y así aumentar su inventario de mercadería y de esta manera agrandar su s ingresos familiares y mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Ella nos dice que los crédito que ha recibido de CEPRODEL la ha beneficiado ya que con ellos compro el tramo que hoy utiliza para vender sus productos y también lo acondiciono.
texts.en:
In the city of Somotillo in the neighborhood of Las Colinas, señora Yojana Lisbeth Ríos sells her products (various clothing items) at her location in the city market in the area. She wants this credit to be able to buy clothing and to increase her inventory so she can earn more income for her family and improve their living conditions. She tells us that the loans she has received from Ceprodel have benefitted her, and with them, she bought her location in the market that she uses to sell her products. She has also used her loans to fix up this location.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and shirts for her business

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El Sr. René es una persona joven que se dedica al servicio de transporte con su taxi,  es muy conocido en su trabajo por que conoce muy bien varias zonas de la ciudad y de esta manera él puede ofrecer un buen servicio con su taxi. Su esposa, Elena, es enfermera y juntos tiene dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Ellos viven en la zona de alto Pampahasi (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.
La zona abarca 16 barrios en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Cuenta con 11 establecimientos educativos, uno de ellos privado, dos de convenio y el resto fiscales. Tiene tres mercados, de los cuales el principal es el 10 de Noviembre, ubicado en Pampahasi Central)
 la cual se encuentra a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Rene trabaja en esta actividad hace mas de cinco años. Solicita el credito para poder realizar la compra de una nueva caja de cambios para su taxi ya que a estado presentando algunos problemas recientes. El desea poder reparar su taxi lo antes posible para poder seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
René is a young taxi driver. He is very well known in his work because he knows the city’s various neighborhoods very well and can offer very good taxi service. His wife, Elena, is a nurse and they have two, school-aged children. They live in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood. (The Pampahasi area, located on the east side of the city, is considered to be a residential and tourist area. It has grown dramatically in the last nine years, which has meant improved living conditions for its approximately 30.000 residents). From the entrance to the area, a point called Segundo Cruce, abutting Villa San Antonio, one can see imposing buildings that are up to four storeys tall, many of them with finished facades, as well as wide, paved streets; added to this are planters and recreational areas. The area encompasses 16 neighborhoods in three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Cancha Venus) and Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA and La Guardia). It has 11 educational establishments: one private, two church run and the rest are public. It has three markets, the main one being 10 de Noviembre, located in Pampahasi Central, which is 20 minutes from city center. René has been in this line of work for more than five years. He is asking for funding to replace the transmission gear box on his taxi because it has had a few problems recently. He hopes to repair his taxi as soon as possible so that he can continue to work as he has done so to date.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 63 años de edad, se dedica a bordar blusas típicas, es el segundo crédito que solicita en ASDIR, su trabajo es muy cotizado ya que es elaborado a mano y es de buena calidad, el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material que le servirá para seguir bordando blusas que le han encargado personas de su comunidad, con la ayuda de su esposo pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina, 63, embroiders traditional blouses. This is her second loan request with ASDIR. Her creations are highly sought-after because they are hand-made and of very good quality. She needs funds to buy materials and supplies she can use to continue emboridering blouses that she has on order. Her husband will help her repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina A. S. was born in Maputo 30 years ago. She studied until 7th grade. She is now living in Namaacha, on the Mozambican border with Swaziland. She moved here because she got a job in a nearby hotel, where she has been working for the last 9 years. She works from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and has three free days every two weeks. The money she makes at the hotel is not enough to take care of her five dependents: three children, aged 6, 9 and 11, a cousin and a niece. 

She is asking for a loan to finish the construction work at her home. She has had two other loans with Kiva, is familiar with the process and likes it. She plans to repay the loan with her salary from the hotel and live on her husband's salary during this period. Once she is done with the construction, she plans on requesting another loan to start breeding chickens.

loans.use: to buy cement, tin, zinc and sand

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 63 años D. edad, casada con Rosendo D. 66 años y juntos tienen dos hijos, Grermer y Edilson D. 29 y 21 años respectivamente, quienes ya son independientes. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace  algún tiempo atrás empezó con el negocio D. alquilar mesas D. billar, ubicado en una pequeña parte D. su domicilio. Paralelo a este negocio, se dedica también a la confección D. prendas D. vestir actividad que realiza esporádicamente. D. esta manera, Gloria atienD. a sus clientes, dándoles la mejor atención a los jóvenes que van a jugar a su local, eso le ha favorecido bastante en las ganancias por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Por tal motivo desea mejorar las instalaciones D. su local, así como D. sus implementos D. juego, como: taco, bolas D. billar y algunas mesas que tiene mucho tiempo D. uso, ya que D. esa  podrá brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser tan puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará tacos y bolas D. billar, además invertirá en la comprar D. tela para emprender el negocio D. confección D. prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old, married to Rosendo (66 years old), and they have two children, Grermer and Edilson, 29 and 21 years old, respectively, who live independently. All of them live in their own homes. Some time ago, she set up a business renting pool tables from a small section of her house. Her other business is that of dressmaker, an activity she engages in sporadically. This way, Gloria attends to her customers, offering good service to the young people who play on her premises. This has paid off in earnings, for which she is proud. For this reason she wishes to improve her facility and playing equipment, such as cue, billiard balls, and some well worn tables. She would thus be able to offer more financial stability to her family. This is her second loan with MFP, and she commits to being punctual once more in her payments. With the money requested, she will buy cues and billiard balls, and invest in fabric to start up her dressmaking business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy billiard balls, cues, and fabric to start a dressmaking business.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
le groupement les linguéres de Aynoumane est un sous groupe un groupement dénommé les linguéres de Fallokh
leur activité principale est la vente de legumes et céréales dans les marchés de la ville et des villages environnant comme le village de Aynoumane.Ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt pour débuter leur activité ,ce second credit entre dans le renforcement de leur commerce pour acheter davantage de produits pour être revendu dans le marché et en tirer des profits pour faire face aux exigence de la vie et des depenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The «Linguéres de Aynoumane» is a subgroup of the «Linguères de Fallokh.» Their principle business is the sale of vegetables and grain in the markets of the city and its surrounding villages such as Aynoumane. Having received a first loan to start their business, they will bolster their business with this second loan, using it to buy more products to sell at market and make a profit in order to meet life's demands and daily expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost sales

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 South Kagoya Eva Group

texts.en: K. Eva is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She runs a clothes business and has been involved in this type of business for over a year. She is using her loan to purchase more stock of used clothing for resale. Eva is a promising businesswoman whose dreams are to educate her children and obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformo mediante el deseo D. las señoras D. formar parte D. un grupo solidario para tr abajar.
Una D. la integrantes D. este grupo es la señora Francisca quien se dedica a la venta D. comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y otros en un pequeño restauran que posee en su domicilio.
Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los comestibles ya que los clientes acuden desD. muy temprano hasta su local.
Por la mañana prepara desayunos con precios especiales asi tambien es el almuerzo y por su buen servicio ella cuenta con numerosa cleintela y por lo tanto con una buena ganancia.
Solicita el credito para invertir en su restauran el cual lo destinara para la compra D. mostradores D. vidrios con focos que podrá mantener los comestibles en buen estado, ademas D. algunas mercaderias que le hacen falta.
Todas las integrantes agradecen por la ayuda crediticia que facilitan las actividades que cada una realiza.
texts.en:
This committee was formed as a result of the women’s wish to be part of a communal group. One of the group members is Francisca who sells food, beverages, snacks, etc. in a small eatery in her home. She rises very early in the morning to prepare her meals because customers start coming by her locale quite early. In the mornings she prepares breakfasts at special prices, she does the same during lunch. Thanks to her good customer service, she has a sizable regular customer base and thus good profits. She is asking for funds to invest in her eatery; she plans to use the funds to buy glass display cases with warming lights installed to keep the food in good condition. She will also buy some merchandise she needs. All the group members are grateful for the loans provided because they make the work that each one does easier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass display case with warmers, snacks, cigarettes, beverages.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 33 años, vive con su esposo  Rodolfo (42), y sus  tres hijos, juntos  habitan  su casa propia, que esta ubicada en una zona muy tranquila de la selva peruana.Desde hace 7 años, se dedica al cultivo de café, junto a su esposo, quien con mucha paciencia le enseño todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias. A ella le gusta tener sus plantaciones limpias y protegidas contra  los cambios climáticos o la proliferación de las plagas, sin embargo, le disgusta que los acopiadores, muchas veces le regateen el precio de sus productos. Esta convencida que sus productos son de calidad por lo que siempre busca  ser bien remunerada, y para más adelante, piensa incrementar su producción de café, además quiere surtir mejor su tienda para dinamizar sus ventas, ya que pretende atender durante todo el día. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles.Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo, asegura que le gusta pertenecer a su grupo comunal, donde ahorra mensualmente y aprende de las experiencias del resto de sus compañeros.Angélica tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  plantas de café y también contratara operarios, para que trabajen su chacra, y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Angélica is 33 years old and lives with her husband Rodolfo, age 42, and their three children. They reside in their own home located in a peaceful area of the Peruvian jungle. For the past seven years she has been growing coffee with her husband, who had the patience to teach her all the necessary farming techniques. She likes having fields that are clean and protected from weather changes and infestation of pests. On the other hand, she does not like dealing with the collectors who haggle over the price of her products. Angélica is convinced that her products are of good quality so she should always be well compensated. To get ahead, she wants to increase her coffee production as well as increase the inventory in her store to boost daily sales. In addition to farming, she also manages a store where she sells food and basic necessities.

This is her second loan with MFP. Angélica is already familiar with the work methodology of her Communal Bank, so she enjoys being part of the group. She saves on a monthly basis and has learned from the experiences of the other members. Angélica plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of coffee plants. She will also hire laborers to work in her fields in hopes of making continued progress.
