Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & hire laborers

loans.name: Alassani

texts.fr: alassani est un jeune homme célibataire qui s'est lancé très tôt dans la vie active, il a appris la couture et après sa formation il a ouvert son propre atelier qu'il a appE.é " COUTURE-BRODERIE". il est très doué dans la broderie raison pour laquelle sa clientèle est élevée. en ce moment la machine à broder est vétuste et en panne il souhaite en acheter un autre raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine à broder et de quelques articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Alassani is a young single man who entered the workforce very early. He learned to sew and after his training, he opened his own shop called "Couture - Broderie” (sewing and embroidery). His excellent embroidery skills have helped him build a large customer base. His embroidery machine is now outdated and broken, and he needs a new one. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy a new embroidery machine and a few sewing supplies.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and various sewing supplies

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima H. is from the village of Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Zosima is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Zosima owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zosima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Zosima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the  family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Carmen Mercedes

texts.es:
Carmen de 35 años, ella tiene una papelería pequeña en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Fortín” y caracterizada por su pobreza y sus caminos de tierra. 

Inicio el negocio desde que la abandono su esposo para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 8, 6 y 2 años. Con sus ahorros compro papelería y readecuo la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 00h00pm todos los días. Una de las dificultades que tienes es dejar solo a sus hijos cuando ella va a ser las comprar de la papelería.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos, laminas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35, has a small stationery shop in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban section of Guayaquil called “Fortín” that is notable for its poverty and unpaved roads. She started the business after she was abandoned by her husband and she was left having to support her three children who are 8, 6 and 2 years of age. She used her savings to buy paper goods and she refurbished the front of her house. Now, she is open from 7am until midnight every day. One of the difficulties she faces is having to leave her children unattended when she goes out to buy her stock. She wants to use the loan to buy stationery items like: notebooks and notebook paper. In the future she’d like her business to be even larger and better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebook paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Ruth Higidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Higidia; tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 3 hijos  trabaja como comerciante minorista ella compra y vende pollos, La socia  trabaja desde hace 15 años con este negocio ella es muy conocida y ya tiene su clientela frecuente. La socia toma los pedidos de sus clientes cada semana y se dirige a su mercado mayorista hace el pedido y le envían la cantidad que requiere. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un capital base de trabajo.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the community bank "Las Perlas" (The Pearls). This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Bank member Higidia is 45 years old and is married. She has three children. She works in retail sales. She buys and sells chickens. She has worked in this business for 15 years. She is very well known and has regular customers. She takes the orders of her customers every week and goes to the wholesale market, where she places the order and sends her customers the quantity needed. She is applying for the loan to have a base of working capital. She appreciates the loans offered through this means, and at the same time she promises to make her loan payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell poultry

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora María Martha tiene 35 años, ella es casada,  y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 11 años respectivamente. Maria se tiene su pulpería, cabe señalar tiene cinco años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en el municipio. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes y granos básicos. El préstamo mejorara sus ganancias. Su sueño es tener un minisúper para generar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
María Martha is 35 years old, and she is married. She has two children, ages 7 and 11. María has a grocery store. It is worth noting that she has had this business for five years. She also has established customers in the municipality. Most of her sales are for cash, but she also makes sales on credit. This business was born from the need to increase the family income in order to improve financially. She wishes to use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, detergents, and basic grains. The loan will improve her earnings. Her dream is to have a mini-supermarket in order to generate more income for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita F. is from the city of Labo, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Leonita is widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Leonita operates a transportation service. Leonita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2004, Leonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 21st loan taken out by Leonita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units office covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Neyci Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Para la señora Neyci este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esta muy a gusto ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio. Ella tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unió libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad. Su marido es chofer profesional.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 19h00, lleva con su negocio ya 7 años, en la actualidad y con la ayuda de los créditos la tiene un poco mas surtida, ahora también vende medicinas y productos de bazar lo que le da mejores ganancias. Los productos los compra e Manta y Portoviejo y en algunos casos los recibe en su local.
 
Este crédito es para seguir surtiendo aun más su tienda y así tener de todo ya que sus clientes le piden muchas cosas y no quiere defraudarlos.  Su sueño es tener lo mejor posible su tienda ya que es su mas grande devoción.
texts.en:
The Los Corrales community bank meets every two weeks in a town called Los Corrales which is a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture.  The inhabitants of this town carry out a number of different business activities such as handicrafts and general commerce.

This is Neyci's third loan cycle with the community bank and she very happy because thanks to the loans she has been able to improve her business.  She is 47 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has 3 grown-up children.  Her husband is a professional driver.

Neyci has a small convenience store.  She works every day from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  She has been running her business for 7 years.  Currently, and with the help of the loans she has had, she has it a little better stocked.  She also now sells medicines and a range of other goods which provide her with better profits.  She buys her products in Manta and Portoviejo and in some cases she receives them at her shop.

This loan will be used to continue stocking her store even more so that it has as many products as possible available since her customers ask her for a lot of things and she doesn't want to let them down.  Her dream is to improve her store as much as possible since it is her big passion.

loans.use: To buy provisions, medicines and other goods for her store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: This is 35 year-old Emmanuel.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 3. He has 4 additional dependents, who live with him because he educates them.  In 2006, Emmanuel established his medical drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be self reliant.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,010,000 every month from this business.  He serves the entire Tokpoi town and has over twenty customers per day because of his encouraging words and strong business skills.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Emmanuel now requires a new loan in order to buy paracetamol, ampiclox, and ampicillin and ibunol capsules. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 201,000. In the future, Emmanuel plans to expand his shop and to open another outlet and would love to build a house for his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is use to buy medical drugs

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad,  está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Julia está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, le permitió  incrementar  el capital  de su negocio, ella se dedicaba a la venta de semillas, actualmente se dedica al engorde de ganados, principalmente toros. 
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le servirá para incrementar su capital.
Su sueño  es crecer en su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es el ahorro que genera ganancia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank “Bartolina Sisa”, located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She completed her high school education.
Julia has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for 5 years; the first loan she requested was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles; this loan allowed her to increase her working capital. She used to sell seeds but she now fattens cattle, mainly bulls.
Mrs. Julia will request a new loan for S/. 2000 Nuevos Soles which she will use to increase her capital. Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes about the community bank is that the savings generate profits.

loans.use: Capital to nuy more cattle

loans.name: Patrick Mburu

texts.en:
Patrick, 28 years old, has practiced potato farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years, since the climatic conditions have been very favorable for potatoes. He sells his produce to brokers who later sell at the main market.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and pay labor costs.

In the future, Patrick hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Imelda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair an engine. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to repair a vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Imelda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of  her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Onduso

texts.en:
Onduso is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where he has been farming for over 8 years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and bananas which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his kiosk which he operates in the same location. 

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children.

Onduso is 27 years old and married with children ages 2 and 4.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is married with two children. One of her children attends school, while the other is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three months, Maurine has operated a business selling clothes. She goes door to door selling clothing to her neighbors. Maurine’s major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Maurine decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase a bundle of clothing and handbags to resell. In the future, Maurine hopes to open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothes and handbags

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar Danilo B. M. él es trabajador activo de la empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como Operador de Pala Mecánica tiene cuatro  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Sr. Oscar Danilo B. M. is an active worker at the company CEMEX, where he operates a power shovel. He has been working for this company for four years. He is now married and has a son of school age. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL. He has taken out each one for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, crushed rock, etc, to enlarge and expand his home. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him greatly, since he has used them to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: Buy construction materials --  sand, cement, stones, crushed rock, blocks etc.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed belongs to Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 35 years. She is 52 years old, married to S. M., and has three sons.
  
Her husband has a business of selling animals. He purchases them young, raises them and sells them to customers at a profit.
  
Khursheed herself is a housewife. She fulfills her household responsibilities very well. In her spare time, she also takes care of the animals by giving them food and water.
 
Due to poor financial conditions, Khursheed couldn’t educate her sons, so two of them started work early in life. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and does a loading business through it, while the second one makes shoes on order. Her youngest son stays at home; he is just 10 years old.
 
Khursheed is part of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sell them at a good profit.
   
Khursheed is hopeful that this investment will be productive for her husband and make him better profits in the future.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats for the animal sales business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her brother. She has 20 years of experience working as a farmer. She has been running her own farm since 2000. She cultivates all type of fruits according to the season. After the death of her parents, she started to cooperate with her brother to handle the heavy life expenses. This will be her second Kiva loan.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase supplies needed for her agriculturA. work. She estimates that with the coming harvest, her profits will be increased.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her agricultural work

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is a 39-year-old man who has experience in shoe sales business for more than 10 years. He lives with his wife and children in an apartment, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has a son and daughter, aged 10 and 12, who attend secondary school. Moreover, the family is welcoming a new baby this year. 

Ganbold started selling shoes in 2000, with working capital of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. He could not afford to rent a stall at the beginning. However, he managed to own one after two years of hard work. Selling imported shoes from China helped Ganbold to expand the business and increase his working capital. The business has since developed such that his current working capital is 14,000,000 MNT and he moved from the outdoor market to an indoor market called Sunday Plaza.

Ganbold is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import more merchandise since he is running two stalls at Sunday Plaza. 
Ganbold achieved true success over the past few years as a result of full dedication and hard work to his business. He wishes to ride in a nice car and improve the living conditions in his apartment where his family can enjoy better living.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for spring

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Vit Y. is a 41-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband is a cashew vendor who buys the cashews from his neighbors and other villagers at a reasonable price, and then sells them for a profit. He can usually earn around $1.25 of profit each day.

In order to earn extra profit and to make her husband’s business more successful, Vit Y. will be using her loan for her husband to buy more cashews for resale. This couple is blessed with five children; one is still enrolled in school and the other four are married and living in their own houses. Vit Y. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy additional cashews for resale.

loans.name: Sedjlo Group

texts.fr:
SEDJLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vendent ensemble dans la même localité. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un crédit.
La présidente du groupe, Eugenie Akouavi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 12 Juin 1974 dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Eugenie Akouavi est mariée à Epiphane et est mère d'un enfant qui  n'est pas encore scolarisé. Eugenie Akouavi s'est installée depuis sept ans à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Eugenie Akouavi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Eugenie Akouavi a une buvette où elle vend diverses boissons depuis environs trois ans. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Eugenie Akouavi s'approvisionne. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Eugenie Akouavi sollicite pour une première fois de prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SEDJLO is a group of three people who run their respective businesses in the same locality. In order to bolster their activities and meet customer demand, they decided to seek credit from ALIDé. 

The group's president is Eugenie Akouavi (seen in the photo with her hand raised). She was born June 12, 1974 in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to Epiphane and has a child who does not yet attend school. She has been living in Sèkandji, in the town of SèmeèPodji, for the past seven years with her husband and child. The couple share the various household responsibilities. 

Eugenie Akouavi did not attend school. She runs a bar where she has been selling drinks for three years or so. She gets her stock in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. In order to build up her business and better satisfy a steadily increasing clientele, Eugenie Akouavi is seeking her first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Lolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. 

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 25 years old and she has 2 children who are ages 5 and 3 years old. She owns a store in which she sells different lotions and Vaseline, water, radio cells, candles and foodstuffs such as rice, sorghum, sugar, etc.She works together with her husband; they have done this business for 3 years, and this business has enabled them to meet the needs of their home. Solange needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, rice and sorghum, and she plans to buy more Vaseline as well. She plans to buy a piece of land with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, sugar, sorghum, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 2 and 13, two of whom attend school, has been farming for 10 years in Nkubu, a town in eastern Kenya. She employs one farmhand and sells her farm produce of potatoes, vegetables, peas, beans and carrots locally. Lillian faces the challenge of insufficient funds to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, and this has led to the low quality of her products.

Lillian has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the cow will provide her family with a guaranteed supply of milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will also help her to better provide for the basic needs of her family. Lillian aspires to acquire two more dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Maria Gabriela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 7 años de experiencia en su negocio, siempre ha sido una joven emprendedora que le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Inicio por su Mama quien le enseño esta actividad para que Maria en un futuro pudiera salir adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra  de pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, ropa interior y otros.
texts.en:
María Gabriela sells general merchandise.  She has over 7 years experience in this business.  She’s always been an enterprising young woman who has liked to work to support her family.  

She started thanks to her mother who taught her this line of work so that María would be able to get ahead in the future.  The reason for the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, underwear and others.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, underwear and others.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 44-year-old housewife, who started her own business seven years ago at home selling beauty products and cosmetics.

Sameera started small, selling limited types of beauty products until she began to make some profit that allowed her to buy other brands and kinds of cosmetics; she even added accessories to the products she sells.

Now Sameera has applied for this loan to add new types of cosmetics material and perfumes and to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.use: To add new types of cosmetics material and perfumes and to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI II  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de SANANKORO dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 45  ans,  5 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide gombo.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
GNOUMADGUE, la troisième debout à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 40.000 à 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi II Group is made up of married women from the village of Sanankoro in the Selingue prefecture, in the district of Sikasso (the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali.  They live in traditional families, are on average 45 years old, have five children, and grow groundnuts and okra.

In the hopes of making their agricultural ventures more profitable, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their second loan of the year.

Gnoumadgue, third from the right, intends to use her loan to purchase groundnut seed, small farming tools, and agricultural inputs from the main market in Selefougou.  After the winter season, the harvest will be stored for a certain amount of time so that the price can increase before it is sold in the main market in Selefougou, Selingue and in the surrounding markets, individually, and often in bulk, for cash, to a clientele who generally come from the big cities.

After disseminating their agricultural products, the group members each intend to earn a 40,000 to 90,000 FCFA profit which will be used to repay the interest on their loan and to help with the daily expenses of their households.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds, and small tools.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Eulogio y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 52 años edad, soy madre soltera,  tengo dos hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la agricultura”. 

Eulogia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a sus hijos, ella trabaja cultivando café, cacao, yuca, maíz, achote y plátanos. Desde muy joven se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mejoramiento de los terrenos de cultivos.
texts.en:
Quillabamba is the capital of La Convención province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convención valleys.  The main business activities here are coca, coffee, cacao and fruit production.

In the town of Quillabamba, we visit the "Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” community bank and meet Eulogia who tells us:

“I was born in the town of Quillabamba.  I am 52 years old and single.  I have two children and live in the town in which I was born.  My main business activity is farming".

Eulogia is a tenacious and entrepreneurial woman who, in spite of life's adversities, is managing to get her children ahead in life.  She works farming coffee, cacao, cassava, corn, annatto and bananas.  She has been in this business since she was very young and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to improve her farmland.

loans.use: to improve her farmland

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MARIAM première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi I group are married, 45 years old with 6 children on average, and living in plural families in the city of Banco, the seat of the Dioïla rural commune, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with include rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Mariam, the first person on the left in the row of standing women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 50,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Maria es comerciante desde hace once años, puso una pulperia, en el cual ha venido introduciendo mas productos de variedad, para obtener mejores ventas. al iniciar lo hizo con dinero ahorrado. 
Es madre de tres hijos, el cual ha tenido que apoyarlos en sus estudios, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre. Es dificil, pero uno tiene que aprender a salir adelante por su familia.
Maria lleva varios prestamos en Afodenic, el cual ha sido para ella, de gran sastifaccion, ya que ha logrado, el equilibrio en sus ventas, captacion de sus clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo invertira en la compra de productos para seguir aumentando las ventas, en la compra de granos basicos, productos de la coca cola, golosinas, pollo, carne, productos lacteos entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria has been a merchant for 11 years, having established a general store in which she continues to introduce a great variety of products, hoping for better sales. At the outset, she did this with money she had saved.

Maria is the mother of 3 children and she has had to pay for their studies, since she can't count on assistance from their father. It is difficult but one has to learn how to forge ahead for the family.

Maria has received various loans with Afodenic, a great satisfaction for her, since she has achieved equilibrium in sales and has acquired steady customers.

Today, with this new loan, Maria will invest in new products to continue augmenting sales – items such as basic grains, Coca Cola products, sweets, chicken, meat, and dairy products among others.

loans.use: invest in products that increase sales, buying basic grains, dairy products, meat, and chicken -- items most in demand by customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
Silvia, se dedica a la administración de una tienda, al mismo tiempo es empleada, ella vive con su madre, no tiene hijos y trabaja de 8:00am a 4:00pm, mientras ella trabaja su madre atiende a los clientes, su colaboración es únicamente después de las 4:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como azúcar, pan, huevos, aceite, esta compra será un gran apoyo para aumentar la mercadería y así ofrecer a los clientes lo mayor posible para satisfacer sus necesidades.
La aspiración de Silvia es algún día comprarse su propia casa, formando su propia familia, y continuando con el negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia devotes herself to running a store and at the same time is an employee. She lives with her mother, has no children, and works from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. Her mother tends to the customers while she is working, her participation being solely after 4 p.m. 

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as sugar, bread, eggs and oil. This purchase will be a great support for adding to the merchandise and thus for offering her customers as much as possible to satisfy their needs. 

Silvia's aspiration is to one day purchase her own home, create a family and maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bread, eggs, and oil for the business.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married and her husband is a school teacher with a decent salary. Montaha has a grocery store located in an active area where she lives. she wants to purchase large amounts of groceries for sale such as: rice, sugar, flower...etc, but she does not have enough extra money so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Montaha takes the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to buy  groceries so she will have in the store a better collection of inventory for sale. Montaha will increase her income and provide better life conditions to the family. Montaha is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Don Donald sigue su labor como guarda de seguridad, pues son muchos años en este trabajo, su esposa trabaja ya que sus cuatro hijos cursan sus estudios.
Atraves de ahorros y financiamiento en Afodenic, ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, siendo de gran beneficio para sus hijos un techo seguro. Con el credito anterior logro terminar repello de paredes y hoy con esta nueva solicitud podra instalar el cielo razo en la parte del porche y en la parte de a fuera del porton hacer rampa para que se le haga mas facil la salida del vehiculo que tienen.
Contento por que ha sido posible a corto plazo las mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en: Don Donald continues working as a security guard which he has done for many years. His wife also works as they have 4 children at school. Through savings and financing by Afodenic, he has managed to make improvements to his house as a secure roof has been of great benefit to his children. With the previous loan, he managed to finish plastering the walls. Now with the new loan he will be able to install a flat roof over part of the porch and a car ramp outside his main gate to make it easier to drive out the vehicle they have. He is happy because it has been possible to make the improvements to his house in such as short period of time.

loans.use: to install a flat roof over part of the porch and a car ramp outside the main gate.

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui vend des tissus.Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et revend ses articles à crédit. Elle exerce ce métier depuis près de dix ans et entretient sa famille avec le produit de ce commerce.Elle sollicite auprés de l'UIMEC un pret de 200000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant 10 douzaine de tissu basin.
texts.en:
Ndeye is a married woman who sells fabrics. She gets her supplies in the capital, and resells her items on credit. She's been running this business for nearly ten years, which enables her to provide for her family.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMEC, in order to bolster her working capital and buy ten dozen of Basin fabrics.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen of Basin fabric

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of  the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Caroline has operated a shoe-selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the ladies of her community. She faces a major challenge in transporting her goods. She aspires to open a boutique in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stocks of shoes for both women and men. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers a variety of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of shoes for both women and men.

loans.name: Bockarie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Like their counterparts in other regions, they are requesting a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

The leader of this group of teachers is Bockarie. He is 45 years old and is a native of Fobu. He is married and has three children: one in primary school, one in secondary school, and one in college. 

Bockarie has been a professional teacher for 26 years now. He will use this loan to pay school and college fees for his children and purchase household equipment and house construction materials.

loans.use: To pay educational fees for his children and purchase household and construction materials

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Isidoro emprendedor, trabajador junto a su esposa tiene los planes de mejorar  la infraestructura de su vivienda. Logro con el préstamo anterior  realizar las divisiones de los cuartos y la cocina siendo de gran beneficio para la familia por que tiene mayor privacidad.  
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, piedras cantera, estribu, camisa, tablones de maderas, hierro entre otros materiales para la construcción del muro del lado este perimetralmente. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo del mejoramiento de su nivel de vida si como la protección que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Isidoro is a hard-working entrepreneur.  Together with his wife, he has plans to improve the infrastructure of his home.  With his previous loan, he managed to install dividing walls between his rooms and his kitchen.  This was a great benefit to his family as they now have more privacy.

With this loan, Isidoro will buy building materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stone, supports, planks of wood, iron and other materials to build a wall on the east-side perimeter of his property.  He is grateful to the MFI for the support they are giving him to develop and improve his standard of living.  This work will also give him further protection.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Rawson is the facilitator of the Muungano group. Rawson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rawson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Rawson takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Rawson had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rawson was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Rawson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Muungano group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Rawson with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Miriam Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la      mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

La señora Miriam es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio, tiene 40  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 14 y 9 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días ya es en esos días que llegan los pescadores de alta mar y es allí que aprovecha de hacer la mayoría de sus ventas. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y los cosméticos. Ella lleva tres años dedicada a este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.

Su sueño es arreglar su casa ya que aún le faltan algunos acabados.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by local and foreign tourists alike.  Most of the area residents fish and do other chores related to the sea.

Miriam is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she’s able to finance her business with the loans.  She’s 40 years old, married and has three children who are 18, 14 and 9 years of age; the two younger ones attend secondary and elementary school.  All the children still live at home and her husband’s a fisherman.

She is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources sells Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) door to door.  She works three days a week.  She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks which is when fishermen return from the high seas and that’s when she makes most of her sales.  What she sells the most are perfumes and cosmetics.  She’s been in this business three years.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.  Her dream is to finish her house because it still needs some final details.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edwin Mariano

texts.es:
Edwin Mariano tiene 30 años es casado, vive con la esposa y con el  hijo de 5 año. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Edwin Mariano  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  comprar un terreno para seguir invirtiendo.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Mariano is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and five-year-old son in the neighborhood of San Temistocles in the canton of Ventanas.

The Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of San Temistocles, which is in the canton of Ventanas. This group consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Edwin Mariano is a farmer who has been growing corn for two years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products at the market in the same place. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. This will be a great help with increasing his income for the consumer needs of his family and for investment. His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can continue investing.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Mend

texts.en: Mr. Mend is requesting a loan to purchase domestic animals and their feed to sell. He wanted to expand his sales volume for the good earnings. It is beneficial for substantially improving his business in the future. At first, he needs to purchase more domestic animals that he buys from his suppliers. He said that he will be opening a branch in another district within this year if he is successful.

loans.use: To purchase domestic animals and feed

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married business man who has been running a tailoring business for fifteen years. He lives in Malindi, Kenya. He learnt of Milango from his colleagues and joined in order to access credit.

Abdalla is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a sewing machine.

The challenge Abdalla faces is the high inflation and the fact that some customers do not pay on time. He looks forward to opening larger business and stocking more materials and clothes.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven emprendedor que motivado por la necesidad de brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de mercancías para generar ingresos con los cuales pueda mejorar la condición económica en su hogar y tener a sus padres con una mejor calidad de vida. En su negocio ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ventas y cada vez ir creciendo más. Gracias a que tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes, Carlos busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de uso personal para responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá superar la dificultad de capital que tiene y seguir progresando con su negocio. Además, tendrá la oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda brindarles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y mejores condiciones económicas. Su sueño es llegar algún día a tener su propio almacén, por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días para lograr conseguirlo.

loans.use: Comprar productos de uso personal para responder a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

loans.name: Malumbo Group

texts.en:
Baraka,who is in early 40's is married with one schooling child. He has been selling second hand clothes for six years now. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and he's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Baraka' 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock his shop with stylish second hand clothes to meet customers demand. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now proceeding well. 

He used his profit to take care of his family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. He will use this loan to increase on the volume of latest outfit to be sold during Christmas festivals. He dreams of expanding his business into a whole selling store.

Baraka will share this loan with his loan group malumbo which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the volume of latest outfit to be sold during christmas festivals

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
Maria Antonia lives in the city of Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. She is married, her husband is a worker in a bottle factory, and they have one small child. They have just started their life together and they recently acquired a small house. Her husband\'s salary is not enough to coveyr the household costs, not even the mortgage payments. This is why she started, some time ago, her new business: the sale of hamburgers from her own home.

With a great deal of effort they have been able to make it, but Maria Antonia needs a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase ingredients to make her product. She plans on repaying the full sum of the loan in a term of 3 months. You can, with your generosity, support her and her family. Do not doubt it any longer - they are grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Antonia vive en la localidad de Cadereyta, Nuevo León, ella esta casada y su esposo es obrero de una embotelladora y tienen un hijo pequeño. Ellos acaban de iniciar una vida juntos y acaban de adquirir una pequeña casa. El sueldo de su esposo no alcanza a cubrir los gastos de la casa, ni los pagos de la casa, es por eso que ella hace tiempo decidió comenzar un nuevo proyecto, la venta de hamburguesas en su propio domicilio.

Con mucho esfuerzo ellos han logrado salir adelante, pero María Antonia necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $100 para poder comprar insumos para preparar su producto, ella planea regresar el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 3 meses. Tú con tu generosidad puedes apoyarla a ella y su familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Loise would like to buy four steers to sell back to the Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um B. is a mother of 4 children and lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store and usually makes around $8/day in revenue, while her husband helps in financing the household from working at a local, private company. 3 of her children are students and the rest are too young to attend school. In order to maximize her inventory and due to great demand of her clients, B. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory. In the future, she would like to make her store wider for business expansion.

loans.use: To increase grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba is 39 years old and works for the state. By her sister's advice she decided to start her own business in addition to her job. She travels to pick up the goods that her sister sells for her. The assortment of goods includes women's clothing and foot wear. Habiba has been an active Mikroinvest client since 2005. Her business has grown to twice it's original size. She purchases the goods not only from the local wholesale stores, but directly from the city of Alma Ata's wholesale dealers. Because of this she makes more profits. Currently Habiba has no permanent trading place, that is why she is applying for a loan to expand her business and use the profits towards rent. The picture shows Habiba's sister.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva volunteer.

Хабиба работает на государственной службе. Дополнительно к этому она, посоветовавшись с сестрой, решила начать заниматься бизнесом. Хабиба ездит за товаром, а сестра торгует. Хабибе 39 лет. Ассортимент товаров составляет женская одежда и обувь. В Микроинвест Хабиба кредитуется с 2005 года. За это время обороты ее бизнеса возросли вдвое. Кроме местных оптовых рынков она стала приобретать товар для реализации у оптовиков привозящих товар из Алма-Аты. Это приносит дополнительную прибыль. В данный момент у нее нет постоянного места для торговли, и поэтому Хабиба хочет получить займ для расширения бизнеса, чтобы прибыль, полученная от бизнеса, позволила в будущем арендовать торговое место. На фото Вы видите сестру Хабибы.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok T., age 27, is a grocer who makes $1.20 per day in profit. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who makes $3.60 per day in revenue. They have three young children. She would like to borrow $500 to buy more grocery products to diversify her inventory and purchase a motorbike to replace her old one which is frequently repaired.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase additional grocery products and a motorbike.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Torrez is 28 years old, married, and has four children -- two in high school, one in primary school and one living away from home. She makes a living recycling items such as used drink containers in her town of Villa Cerrito, Paraguay

Vilma moved away from her parents’ home when she was very young and began working at a small stand selling snacks and other convenience items. After doing that for a while, she realized she could make more money recycling, and was one of the first people in her area to go into this line of work. Now she spends her days collecting, sorting and selling recyclable materials such as metal, plastics, aluminum and cardboard, and then carrying them to recycling companies in a horse-drawn cart. In addition to recycling, Vilma also sells fruits and vegetables from this same cart.

Her dream is to be able to save enough money to stop recycling and open a small grocery store, because that would allow her to spend more time at home with her six-year-old son. To do this, she will need to expand her recycling business so that she can save enough money to begin work on her store. She has come to us for a loan to purchase the materials she needs to expand her recycling business and begin building her store.

loans.use: Operating capital to expand her business and open a new store

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in 1969, Mrs. Akossiwa Y. is married and the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a retired school teacher, who cannot provide on his own for all the needs of the family. And so, the bulk of the family budget is earned by Mrs. Y.. With her small banana field, it is still difficult for her to cover all the household expenses and not all of her children are able to go to school. Hard working and honest, she has already benefited from a previous loan of $450, which she repayed. Currently, she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to expand her field and to purchase fertilizers. With this, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and will be able to send her other children to school.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1969, Madame Y. Akossiwa est mariée avec sept (7) enfants en charge. Son mari instituteur retraité, n’arrive pas à contribuer aux besoins de la famille, c’est ainsi que la charge familiale est supportée par Madame Y. Akossiwa. Avec son petit champ d’ananas, elle arrive difficilement à joindre les deux bouts et ses enfants ne sont pas tous scolarisés. Travailleuse et honnête, elle a une fois bénéficié de crédit de $450 qu’elle a bien remboursés. Présentement, elle sollicite $1000 pour agrandir son champ et acheter des fertilisants. Ce faisant elle améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille et pourra scolariser les autres enfants.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.en:
“Virgen D. Fátima” is a rural community bank in FINCA Peru’s Wari project, which provides credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations, such as being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 6,000 – 17,000 ft above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Virgen D. Fátima” is located in the small community of La Merced in the province of Churcampa, at over 9,000 ft above sea level. Currently the bank has completed 2 loan cycles after just one year of existence. Currently there are 20 female borrowers.

The members of the bank, during their one year in FINCA Peru, besides having learned to be responsible and punctual, have learned to respect each other and to help another member of the group when they face some kind of difficulty. At each bi-weekly reunion a different member of the group prepares a small meal that she will sell for 1 sol (about 35 cents U.S!), and the profit she will add to her savings in the bank.

The group was able to save over 4,900 soles (about 1,600 US$) in the first 2 loan cycles and will continue to save in the future. For all members, the main use of the savings is for investing in their business or for the education of their children. Another dream they have for the use of their savings is to be able to make renovations to their houses, like constructing another floor or changing the roof to a more sustainable material.

Most members of the community bank run the same business: they have fields with corn, wheat and peas. And a little bit lower down at the Mantaro river basin, where it’s a little warmer, they grow fruits like oranges and mango. There is one special fruit they cultivate: the fruit of the tuna-cactus. As all of these product are seasonal, they also have mountain goats and minor animals like chickens and guinea-pigs. Most of the products they sell weekly at the local market of Churcampa or a little further away in Huanta. Two also run grocery stores in the community.

The loans range from 200 soles, 500 soles up to 600 soles and the total of the loans reach 5,100 soles among the 20 members. The amounts of 500 and 600 soles are exceptions.

Although many dedicate their time to the same business, every member has a different testimony, as is the case of Perpetua Murga A.. Perpetua was the woman that formed the bank in its first cycle and was elected the first president. With her 600 soles loan she will buy new supplies for her grocery store. And with her 450 soles of savings she will hire someone to make holes in the ground to put new tara and tuna-cactus plants

Marcelina M. V. will invest her 200 soles buying plants of the tuna-cactus and of tara. Both need time to grow before they get productive (tuna 1 year and tara 3 years). Meanwhile she will depend on her mountain-goats: the sells them for the meat, but also she makes cheese from goat-milk.

loans.use: Buy new inventory for grocery store

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S. is a 45-year-old grocer. She and her husband, Mr. Bin Sophal, live with her four independent children. Two of them are working at the garment factory with a basic salary of about $45 per month.

She would like to request a loan of $600.00 to repair her old and broken house.

loans.use: To repair their old and broken house

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Elba R. is native of the municipality of Condega where she has had a home based tailoring business for the last 35 years. As a single mother, she is responsible for supporting her daughter and to provide her with the education she deserves. Mrs. R. has the role of father and mother.

She began her business with a lot of effort and as time passed by Ms. R. has improved her business as she has gained new customers from the municipal area.

Five years ago in order to improve her economic condition, Ms. R. obtained loans from CEPRODEL , which allowed her to develop her business, since with these loans she purchased fabrics and the necessary household goods to make the dresses and shirts for her clients. Currently, Ms. R. is once again in need of a loan, in order to buy fabric and other supplies. She is confident that a loan will be approved so she can continue to operate her business and to provide her daughter with the education she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Elba R. es una dama originaria del municipio de Condega en el que posee un negocio de sastrería en su propia casa desde hace 35 años. Por ser madre soltera, tiene la responsabilidad directa de mantener a su hija y brindarle los estudios que ella se merece haciendo el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Su negocio lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo y a medida que han transcurrido los años lo ha venido mejorando porque ha obtenido nuevos clientes que la visitan en su local de habitación.

Para mejorar su condición económica, desde hace 5 años ella ha venido trabajando con CEPRODEL obteniendo créditos que le han permitido mejorar su negocio ya que con estos créditos obtiene la tela y enseres necesarios para realizar los vestidos y camisas a sus filetes. Actualmente su necesidad es una vez mas obtener la tela y es por eso que muy confiadamente espera que el crédito se le otorgue para continuar con su negocio y brindarle el estudio a su hija que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To Purchase Fabrics

loans.name: Afi Martine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Martine S. was born on March 29, 1973 in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of four children. She sells fruit juice, ice water, and smoothies made from milk, sorghum and ice cubes. She has been in this business since 1997 in the district of Agoè in the north of Lomé. At present, she has found a niche in the Société Togolaise de Plaques. This sales point is well suited to her business and ensures her a goodly number of sales every day. Her first loan in the amount of US$ 375, which she reimbursed promptly, allowed her to acquire a freezer.

In view of the size of her customer base, she would like to have a second freezer in order to produce a sufficient quantity of ice; she also wants to buy a bag of sorghum. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 625.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Afi Martine est née le 29 mars 1973 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de jus de fruits, d’eau glacée et de bouillie préparée à base de lait, sorgho et de glaçon. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1997 dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Présentement elle a trouvé un emplacement au sein de la Société Togolaise de Plaques. Cet endroit approprié à son activité lui permet de réaliser un chiffre d’affaires journalier important. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 150.000 FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé lui a permis d’acquérir un congélateur.

Compte tenu de l’importance de sa clientèle, elle désire acquérir un second congélateur pour produire en quantité suffisante le glaçon et acheter un sac de sorgho. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de 250.000 FCFA.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congélateur

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a beautiful 43-year-old woman who looks half her age! She lives with her husband and four children in the community of Los Alcarrizzos and runs a small business selling home accessories and supplies, as well as a small range of daily foods.

She is asking for this loan so that she can have enough money to increase her inventory and expand the amount of merchandise she is able to offer her customers. She says that the more she is able to offer, the more customers she will attract—if they can get all of their shopping done with her, they will only need to come to her!

She hopes that with the extra income she can generate from her business and this loan she can begin saving money to help send her youngest children to the local university in Santo Domingo. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand, and that she will always have the ability to work on her own to improve her family’s life.

On behalf of Luis and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase inventory and expand the variety of merchandise she is able to offer.

loans.name: Modiéré

texts.fr:
Modiéré Sidibé is married, 32 years old, and the mother of four. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her children in the district of Heremakono Centre de Bougouni. When she was young, she began to earn money, notably in catering, which she learned from her sister. She makes sales at the Bougouni bus station, where it is very busy. Her customers are generally travelers and truck drivers.

She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for six years and is on her eighth loan, of which five were individual loans. All previous loans were repaid correctly. This loan will be used to buy 800 kg of rice and some condiments for a period of one month. She gets her supplies of rice and condiments from Bamako, She makes several kinds of dishes: fatty rice, rice with tomato sauce or peanut sauce, fish or meat soups, fritters, stews, etc... She expects to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA. With this profit, she expects to pay the loan interest and to help cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Modiéré Sidibé est mariée,âgée de 32 ans et mère de 4 enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier heremakono centre de Bougouni . Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la Restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa soeur. Elle vend à l’autogare de Bougouni ou il ya une grande fréquentation. Ses clients sont généralement les voyageurs et les routiers.

Elle travaille avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 ans et est à son.huitième prêts dont cinq individuels. Tous les prêts précedents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce pret servira à l’achat de à 800 kg Riz et des Condiments pour une période d’un mois .Elle s’approvisionne en Riz et Condiments à Bamako Elle prépare plusieurs sortes de plats: (riz au gras, riz avec sauces tomate et arachide, les Soupes de viande et de poisson, les fritures, les ragouts etc...... Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA .Avec ce bénéfice elle compte payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fuel to retail in her community.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice F. is 34 years old. She is married with three kids. Her kids are in school. She lives with her family in Obuasi, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Eunice is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, so she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products, such as weave-ons, pomade, shampoo, and activators, to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called St. Paul's Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more hair products for her salon

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji, the wife of A. R., lives in an area of Lahore, Pakistan named Ismail Nagar. Concentrating on household work, she has resided in her seven room brick house for the last 35 years, raising eight children: seven sons and one daughter. Her eldest son operates his own clinic, while the next eldest works in a factory. Four other sons make artificial jewelry sets that they sell in the market, while her youngest son is in 6th standard and her daughter is in 9th standard. Parveen baji's husband is unemployed. 

Parveen baji fully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan) and is now requesting a loan to buy material (beads, wires, tools) for her sons’ jewelry-making business. 

She is joined in her loan group by four other members:  Farhat baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell; Nargis baji wishes to buy livestock (goats) for her meat business; Razia baji wants to purchase material (beams, rope) for her shuttering business, while Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To make artifical jewelry sets

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is a wife of K. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived there for the last 25 years and is the mother of eight children, six sons and two daughters. Her daughters and her four youngest sons are enrolled in a local school. Her older sons help their father in his building and construction-supply business. He has been in this line of work for the last 35 years. Bushra baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy construction supplies (such as cement and sand) to help expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Asma baji wants a loan to buy baking supplies (bread, butter and eggs) to resell. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her shop. Martha baji wants a loan to buy crystal and handmade decorative pieces to resell. Mahnaz baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for her workshop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies for her business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for several small businesses

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Doña Justina tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. cinco hijos mayores D. edad,  estudió el tercer grado D. primaria y vive en el sector Santa Maria Cucho del Centro Poblado D. Uros Chulluni, distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” D. Puno. Al inicio, con el préstamo D. S/. 300 pudo comprar más verduras, papa, carne, etc. para poder seguir preparando viandas (comida). Este negocio lo inició a los 22 años D. edad y aún continua con el. Recientemente y paralelo al otro negocio abrió una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.

“Gracias a los créditos del Banco Comunal puD. construir mi casita” nos dijo muy alegre Doña Justina.

Su deseo es ampliar el negocio y así incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justina is 64 years old, is married and mother of five adult children, she studied up until the third graD. and lives in the area of Santa Maria Cucho of Centro Poblado Uros Chulluni, district, province and department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. At the start, with a loan of 300 soles (US $100) she bought more vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc. to continue developing tubers (food). This business was started when she was 22 years old and she still continues with it. Recently, parallel to her other business, she opened a small grocery store. With this loan of 500 soles(US $175), which will be paid off in 4 months, she will buy rice, noodles, sugar, milk, oil, etc. "Thanks to the loans from the Communal Bank I could build my house" a very happy Doña Justina told us. Her desire is to expand the business and thereby increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 54 años, es separada y vive sola. Ella es agricultora, lo cual aprendió desde muy joven e inició su producción hace 40 años. Siendo la agricultura una actividad que le agrada realizar por el contacto que tiene con la naturaleza y por lo libre de presión para  desarrollar su trabajo. Señala también que  las frutas, en especial las naranjas y todo cítrico, es muy solicitado en su zona, ya que la gran mayoría están dedicados a cultivar estos productos y los comerciantes visitan la zona para poder comprar producciones a grandes cantidades. Lo difícil de ser agricultor es estar expuesto al sol todo el día por tener que cuidar tus terrenos de producción y abonarlos. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP y no tuvo problemas de mora en sus pagos anteriormente. Antonia  invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abonos para sus terrenos.
texts.en:
