Antonia is 54 years old, separated, and lives alone. She is a farmer, which she learned at a very young age and began her production 40 years ago. Being a farmer is an activity that pleases her because of the contact with nature and the freedom from pressure to develop her work. She also notes that fruit, especially oranges and all citrus, is at a premium in her area since the vast majority of people are dedicated to cultivating these products and the merchants visiting the area buy large quantities. The difficult part of being a farmer is being exposed to the sun all day because she has to care for her lands and fertilize them. This is her second loan with MFP and she had no problems with her earlier payments. Antonia will invest in the purchase of fertilizers for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Shakilla

texts.en:
Shakilla lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with two children and her husband works for a private company. She works for the government and has lived in rental housing for long time. A few months ago she decided to build a house. She bought  land and started construction. She now needs additional funds to continue working on her house.

She requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans with a term of 12 months to complete construction and start working on starting a new life in her new house. She wants to say "I appreciate this process of lending money in Afghanistan. Everyone can use it in different ways".

She would like to thank lenders around the world for their support in providing loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Rose sells food supplies at Bantama, which she has done for a while now. Her husband is a fisherman. Rose uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family.

Rose will use the loan to purchase more food supplies and groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family size.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies and groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en:
Mekhriban A. comes from a humble family who worked very hard to get her ahead in life.  She is 41 years old, married and has three sons. 

For 6 years, Mekhriban has dedicated herself to raising and selling sheep - a job that brings economic stability to her family.  It is for her family that she works and struggles day in and day out.  Her sons help her with the business. 

She’s asking for a loan of $1200 to invest in her business and buy more sheep.  A successful business will allow her to save enough money to pay for her sons' education.  

Mekhriban is committed to responsibly repaying the loan within 15 months.  With your help, Mekhriban can accomplish her dream very soon.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Ela Rosa

texts.es: Ela Rosa A. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas este es su principal negocio el cual le genera ingresos para sustentar su familia, las tortillas las vende en su colonia a diferentes mercaditos, pulperias y casas, ella tiene muy buena demanda, cuando ella deja de vender sus tortillas vende su otro producto que es ropa para cama , vajillas, toallas, esta actividad la hace por las tardes ya que las ventas de tortillas es de muy de mañana. con estos dos negocios ella saca el dinero para poder mantener su familia, ella solicita este prestamo para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Ela Rosa A.’s primary business is making and selling tortillas, which provides income to support her family. She sells the tortillas in her village at various small markets, grocery stores and homes. She has substantial demand for her tortillas. When she is not selling tortillas, she sells bedding, dishes, and towels. Tortillas are sold in the early morning and the other products are sold in the afternoon. With these two businesses, she makes money, which allows her to support her family. She is asking for the loan in order to buy supplies and merchandise that will improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cornmeal, slaked lime (calcium hydroxide), salt, water, bedding, and dishes

loans.name: Waziran M. Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Waziran baji is 52 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She is married to a man whose name is M. R., and he has a dairy business. He has a buffalo and Waziran baji also helps him in getting milk from her and selling it to the milk shops. She has three sons. Her eldest son works in a factory on monthly wage. The others are not employed and don’t do anything. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s dairy business.

She is the group leader for another four women from her locality. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty parlor. Almay baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Sayla Group

texts.en:
Sayla is the group leader of Sayla group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger.

Sayla wants to take a loan for his business, a general store, to expand his business and to attract more clients. Nelab wants to take a loan for a tailoring business. Azuta wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a bottle-selling shop. Omima wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery.

They requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 8 months. They all are very happy about this process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: for the progress of their businesses

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia H. lives with her family in the peaceful village of San Jose Norte I, Mallig, Isabela. Ofelia runs a small business raising pigs in her backyard -- her only source of income. Most of the people in her village also raise pigs in order to provide for their needs. Ofelia works hard to stay ontop of her business and meet the needs of her family. But she doesn’t have enough capital to make her business larger, or run better and more efficiently.

She has applied for a loan to buy additional piglets, along with feed and vitamins to ensure that they are healthy and fetch a good price. Her goals are to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to college so they can have a bright future. Ofelia believes that through her sacrifices and strong faith to God, she can attain all of her goals in life.

loans.use: buy more piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Vergenia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vergenia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mangoes to the community. Vergenia has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Vergenia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergenia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for mango production. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Vergenia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for mango production

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the village of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 23 years old. Marilou married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business venture in the food sector fishing and fish vending. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and fish selling. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair fishing net and invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to supplement family needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive co-operatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair fishing net and invest in expanding business

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: N. Rose is an honest and hardworking married lady who has a poultry farm and sells clothes in Mubende Town council. She is 38 years old and a mother of two children. One of her children is in University while the other is in Primary 7. She also cares for two dependants. She has been running both businesses for five years and, at the moment, with the help of loans to increase her capital, she is able to make 200,000 per month. The good customer care displayed to her clients has kept them with her and in future, she hopes to turn her shop into a wholesale dealer shop to have more sales and more profit. Rose needs a loan to buy more chicken feed and more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.en:
O. Rahmonkul is 56 years old, married, and has three children. He has secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Rahmonkul buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells in the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Rahmonkul wants to buy young cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Fatimoh

texts.en: Fatimoh S. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs in wholesale and retail. She is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more products to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives and works in a semi-urban area where she deals in secondhand clothes. She incurs extra transport costs to and from the Owino market, where she buys those clothes. Alice sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all kinds of people. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years.

Alice is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children, ages 16 to 28 years. Three of her children are in school. She owns a three-room house where she lives with nine people. Alice doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Alice has been with MCDT for five years; she is now on her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Alice wants to see her business expand and to own rooms to rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing

loans.name: Bertha Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Mariela es soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Mariela vende ropa y calzados a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Mariela trabaja en una institución como personal administrativo.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Mariela son salir adelante junto a su hija y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros” (Lord of Miracles). She is 22 years old, single, and has a daughter. Mariela sells clothing and footwear upon request. Her products are offered to friends and relatives. She also works at an institution as a personnel administrator.

Mariela needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy clothing. She dreams of getting ahead along with her daughter and of owning her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Abdel Jalil

texts.en: Abdel Jalil is a 57-year-old married man with 3 children. He works hard in collaboration with his wife to earn income to satisfy the needs of the household. He has been working in the construction sector since 1995. Today, Abdel Jalil is requesting to borrow US$ 600 to buy a new specialized machine for his business.

loans.use: buy a new specialized machine

loans.name: Musidal Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Musidal II group. These are small scale businesspeople in the town of Kabala, in the Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of Le 800,000 for each to help them develop their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed J.. Mohamed was born in Kabala town, thirty-eight years ago. He is married with two children. Mohamed sells cattle and timbers. He has been in this business for over ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge es una padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector El Tabacal, distrito de Túcume, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura, anteriormente trabajaba como obrero agrícola de manera eventual pero esta actividad no le daba los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia; empezó a arrendar un terreno cercano a su casa y desde entonces se ha dedicado a la agricultura de manera constante.

Actualmente se encuentra cosechando su sembrio de frijol pallar, el ha solicitado ayuda a algunos vecinos para terminar exitosamente esta acción pero no tiene dinero para pagarles, es por este motivo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la paga de jornales dentro del trabajo de cosecha que viene realizando.

El es un padre muy responsable que trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos, actualmente dos de ellos estudian y los otros dos lo apoyan en las actividades agrícolas. Su más grande anhelo es poder adquirir un terreno propio en el cual seguir sembrando.

Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 42 year old father who lives with his wife and four children in the neighborhood of El Tabacal in Túcume District, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been engaged in agriculture for 15 years. Jorge previously worked as a casual farm laborer, but this job did not provide enough income to support his family. He decided to rent a field near his home and has been devoted to farming on a regular basis.

Jorge is currently harvesting his crop of lima beans. He has requested assistance from some of his neighbors to help finish harvesting his crops, but he does not have the money to pay them. For this reason, he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles so that he can pay wages for the harvest work being done.

Jorge is a father who is very responsible in raising his children. Two of his children currently attend school while the other two help with the farming chores. His greatest wish is to acquire his own land so that he can continue farming.

This is the second time Jorge has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor needed to harvest his crop of lima beans

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: MAREME S. est une femme de 55 ans elle est mariée et a 6 enfants en charge dont les deux fréquentent l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ESCALE depuis 7 ans, elle a capitalisé une très bonne expérience par rapport à son activité pour l'avoir exercée pendant plus de 5 ans. Elle développe une activité de vente de produits de beauté et des tissus teintés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et de santé de la famille et à assurer aussi la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mareme S. is a 55 year old woman, married, and responsible for six children, two of whom attend school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the city of Escale for the past seven years. She has been selling beauty products and dyed textiles for the past five years, and has gained good experience in this activity. Profits from the sales allows her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and ensure that her children are able to receive an education.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her cash-flow operations

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito C. is from the village of Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old. Juanito is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Juanito operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Juanito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is thirty-two years old. He is married and has four children all of whom are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Takoradi, a coastal town where fishing is the main occupation of the majority.

Emmanuel is an electronics repairman. He repairs all kinds of faulty electronic gadgets such as radios, televisions, etc. He has his shop by the roadside in his community.

Emmanuel has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy many spare parts to service his clients’ jobs.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn P. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Arlyn owns and operates a business selling vegetables and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2005, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna E., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Emelito E., a tricycle driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for three years.

Edna has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy additional stock for her variety store business.   Her business lets her earn a net profit of 12,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy soft drinks and other grocery items.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that their lives will continue to develop. She also prays that their children will have a better future.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and other grocery items

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua O. A. is 27 years old, married and has two children who are in school. His business is located at Oile market, off the highway in Kisumu. He sells secondhand books to college students, high school pupils and parents of primary school-going children.

Joshua has been in this business for the last six years and says that his major challenges are inadequate capital, harassment by the local government, and too many people doing the sA. thing as him so customers are spoilt by the choice. However, he is determined to expand his business by opening a bookshop, attracting a larger market and becoming the major bookseller in Kisumu. He is using his loan to buy more books, especially for the pupils who are starting high school. He is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To buy books

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios J. makes a living from planting and harvesting rice to sell. She is 47 years old, married and has three grown-up children. They are from the town of Southern Pob., Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Remedios has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia M. Q., tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijos que es son mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 7 y 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca para leche . La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para consumo propio y para venderla  en la comunidad y así maximizar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella cuenta con una propiedad de pasto para la alimentación y desarrollo de los animales.Doña Elvia trabaja desde hace muchos años con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elvia M. Q., 32, is married and has two children, who are her greatest priority; they are 7 and 4 years old. She wants funding to buy a dairy cow. The idea is to have cattle so that the milk produced can be used both for her own consumption and to sell in the community thereby maximizing her profits. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms she got. She has a pasturage area suited to the feeding and development of the animals. Elvia has worked with cattle for many years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Vanessa

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector Fundo Santo Tomas de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio. María cría patos, pavos, gallinas y cerdos para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Ella nos comenta que este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economia de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero eventual y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio tiene mucho exito, ya que María pone mucho empeño y dedicación al trabajo que realiza, los animales que cría tienen buena calidad y los negociantes pagan un buen precio por ellos. Maria ha estado invirtiendo las ganancias en hacer mejoras en su vivienda, ya que las continuas lluvias que se han presentado en la zona han hecho que la estructura de esta se debilite.

María desea terminar de hacer la mejoras en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos que piensa utilizar en la compra de de material para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una joven bastante responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María, 23, lives with her husband and son in the Fundo Santo Tomas neighborhood of the city of Lambayeque, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years she has raised small farm animals at home. She raises turkeys, ducks, chickens and pigs that she sells to various merchants that visit the area regularly. She tells us that this business is of great use to the family’s economy because her husband is employed sporadically as a laborer and his income isn’t sufficient to meet all family expenses. The business is very successful because María puts much effort and dedication into it; her animals are of good quality and the merchants pay good prices for them. María has been investing her profits in home improvements because the non-stop rains that the area has had have weakened the structure. María would like to finish the improvements to her home but lacks sufficient capital to do so. Therefore, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1500 new sol loan to buy building materials and supplies for this purpose. She is quite a responsible young woman who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a trustworthy woman. Her greatest desire is to provide her son with a quality education that will guarantee him a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 31-year old teacher. His wife is a housewife and he is the family’s breadwinner. Together they have one child and they live in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ronald wants to indulge more in business activities and is set to start a piggery farm and poultry farm because he would like in three years to be self-employed in his businesses. This is his second loan from HOFOKAM. He intends to use the loan funds to buy pigs for his piggery farm and to put some money into construction of his residential house, which is not yet complete.

Note:  Ronald is pictured with the son.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pay for construction of his house.

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne B. est présidente du groupe Tujimbere et vendeuse de jus de banane dans la marche de Rugombo.  Elle a 30 ans et elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.  Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois garçons et deux filles qui ont successivement 15 ans, 12 ans, 8 ans, 4 ans, et 18 mois.  Deux seulement sont à l’école.  Elle est en bonne sante et elle constate qu’elle n’a aucun problème dans la vie.

Etant commerçante de jus de bananes, elle a choisi de prendre le crédit de Turame parce qu’elle était dans l’incapacité de continuer son metier sans soutien financier.  Elle vient de terminer son 1e cycle de crédit de 100,000 Fbu.  Son cycle actuel est de 180,000 qui sera orienté dans l’achat de bananes.  A la question de savoir pourquoi elle a choisi Turame, elle a répondu que Turame donne un crédit sans demander des garanties matérielles comme le font les autres institutions de micro-finance.  Elle ne peut pas alors quitter Turame sans qu’elle soit financièrement indépendante. 

Pour ce qui est de son activité, elle se lève a deux heures du matin pour préparer le jus de banane qui par après est transporté dans sa petite kiosk a jus.  Elle ne rentre pas chez elle avant qu’elle n’ait termine de vendre le jus.  Normalement, elle n’a pas de difficulté de tout vendre dans une journée.  

Elle espère mener une vie heureuse soit matériellement que physiquement.  Pour ses enfants, elle va les soutenir pour étudier afin qu’ils deviennent eux aussi capable de vivre en confort.  Elle souhaite aussi ouvrir une boutique alimentaire après son second cycle de crédit avec Turame.  En conclusion, elle encourage les autres à solliciter le crédit de Turame car Turame n’exige rien avant la réception de crédit.
texts.en:
Jeanne B. is the president of the Tujimbere group and sells banana juice in the Rugombo market. She is 30 and was able to attend school through 6th grade. She is married and the mother of five children, three sons and two daughters who are 15, 12, 8, 4 and 18 months. Only two are enrolled in school. She is in good health and affirms that she has no problems in life. As a banana juice saleswoman, she chose to take out a loan from Turame because she was incapable of continuing her work with financial support. She has just finished repaying her first loan of 100,000 Fbu. Her present loan request is for 180,000 which will be used to buy bananas. Asked why she chose Turame, she replied that Turame gives loans without requiring collateral the way other microfinance institutions do. She can't therefore leave Turame until she is financially independent. As for her business, she gets up at two a.m. to prepare the banana juice which she then brings to her little juice stand. She only goes home when she has finished selling her juice. Normally, she never has difficulty selling all of it every day. She hopes to have a happy life, both physically and materially. As for her children, she wants to be able to send them to school so that they also become able to live comfortably. She hopes to open a general store after her second loan with Turame is paid off. In conclusion, she encourages others to request loans through Turame, since Turame does not require anything before it gives out loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying bananas to make banana juice for resale

loans.name: Aleyda Matilde

texts.es: Aleyda Matilde tiene 44 años tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y brinda el servicio de billares. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación es en su vivienda porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma comarca, ella se encuentra muy contenta con medio de ingreso Ella posee una gran cantidad de clientes a los cuales los atiende de manera muy amable y cálida, por esto y por sus buenos precios es que los clientes regresan a su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es especialmente para capital de trabajo y así comprar productos necesarios para su local.
texts.en:
Aleyda Matilde is 44 and takes care of her three children. 9 years ago she started selling soft drinks and she has a location with billiard tables The business is located in her house since most of her customers are from the same area. She is very happy with the way she earns money. Aleyda has many customers who she sees to in a friendly and warm manner. Because of this and because of her good prices, her customers come back. The financing that she is asking for is especially for working capital and to buy the necessary items for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Kanou est un regroupement de quatre femmes de la ville de Yangasso préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et une moyenne de 6  enfants par femme. 
Elles mènent différentes activités commerciales: vente de produits divers, de fruits et légumes, d’habits, de condiments etc.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le groupe est à son 6ème  cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Les femmes du groupe  achètent leurs marchandises à San et à Koutiala.  Elles vendent au marché de Yangasso et dans les foires environnantes et dans les villages environnants de la ville de San.
Djeneba S., le chef du groupe, est très connue à Yangasso à travers son activité d’achats et de ventes de fruits et légumes. 
Elle s’approvisionne hebdomadairement au  grand marché de Koutiala ville. 
Avec son nouveau  prêt, elle compte acheter, 20 sacs de pomme de terre, 1 sac d’avocat,  50kg de pois de terre, 6 cartons de banane plantain. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12500FCFA tandis  que les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice  mensuel de 11500FCFA profit qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités et aussi venir en aide aux conjoints.
texts.en:
'Kanou' is a group of four women from the town of Yangasso, San prefecture (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met because of being related and/or neighbors. They have an average age of 32 and on average, six children each. They have various businesses selling different things: fruit and vegetables, clothing, condiments, etc. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their sixth solidarity loan (group loan). They buy their merchandise in San and Koutiala. They make their sales at the market of Yangasso and in the surrounding weekly markets, and the villages surrounding the town of San. Djeneba S., the group leader, is well known in Yangasso for buying and selling fruit and vegetables. She stocks up weekly at the big open-air market of Koutiala town. With her new loan she intends to buy 20 sacks of potatoes, one sack of avocados, 50 kg of Bambara peas, and 6 cases of plantains. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 12,500 F CFA whereas the other members expect to make a monthly profit of 11,500 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and reinvest in their businesses and also to help their husbands support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Zoila Yanina

texts.es:
ZoiL. D. 26 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo D. Guayaquil, elL. tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se le llama “bazar”),  venD. todo tipo D. papelería como cuadernos, hojas y otros artículos D. tienda. 

Empezó hace cinco años atrás con una vitrina y poca papelería, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido agrandar su negocio, trabaja con una hermana desD. las 09h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para agrandar su tienda elL. quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y ropa para vender otras cosas, en el futuro quiere tener sucursales en todo el Guasmo D. Guayaquil.
texts.en:
ZoiL., 26, lives in an urban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil. She has a stationery shop (in Ecuador it’s called a “bazaar”) where she sells all types of paper goods like: notebooks, sheets of paper and other merchandise. She started five years ago with a single display case and few inventory items. Gradually, with effort and dedication she has managed to enlarge her business. One of her sisters helps her and she’s open from 9am until 10pm every day. In order to enlarge her store she wants to use the funds to buy notebooks and clothes in order to have a more varied stock inventory available to sell. In the future, she wants to have branch stores throughout El Guasmo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks and clothes.

loans.name: Lisbeth Xiomara

texts.es:
Lisbeth es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Lisbeth tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, sus productos son a pedido de sus clientes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo, cuenta con maquinas necesarias. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas variadas.
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Los sueños de Lisbeth son tener una empresa en la cual dirija y sus ventas sean al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lisbeth lives with her husband and three children, two of whom attend school. She has a shop in her home where she makes clothing to order. She does this daily with her husband’s assistance and she has all the necessary machines. She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of fabrics. Lisbeth is an associate of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank and what she enjoys most is the incentive to save. She hopes to one day have and run a large company where she will have greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 61 years old, separated from her husband and has one child who is 21 and in school. She makes a living selling various types of items, such as peanuts and cooking oil, and is held in high regard by her customers because these items are very high quality. Marie has applied for this loan to buy a greater range of goods to sell to her customers. She believes her clients will appreciate having more choice, and this will take her closer to her dream of opening a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia D. is from the village of South Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Lydia is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies and also running a mini store in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Meland

texts.fr:
Meland B. N. est un jeune homme de 26ans, célibataire sans enfant qui s’est lancé en 2004 dans le commerce  des pains pour palier au chômage après son cursus universitaire.

Il est dans la vente  des pains et friandises au coin de sa ruelle ou il a des bénéfice journaliers de 12000f et ses ventes sont considérables .
Avec cet argent il va acheter : 5cartons des  biscuits variés, 5 lots de sachets de chips,10 sachets des différents types de bonbons, 5paquets de  jus en carton , 2cartons de fromage en quartiers, 1paquets de sucreries,beurres,margarines, pates alimentaires.
Sa stratégie est de vendre à un prix  hors concurrence et  épargne petit à petit pour atteindre son objectif, devenir grossiste en commerce général.

Il va un jour fonder une famille et va se battre à réunir toutes les conditions nécessaires pour une vie meilleure.
Il est aussi encourager par son entourage qui veut qu'il soit un homme d'affaire connu
texts.en:
Meland B. N. is a 26-year old young man, single and without children. He began selling bread to cope with unemployment after he completed university.

He sells bread and treats on the side of his street, where he makes a daily profit of 12,000 francs, and sells a good amount of his products. With his loan he will buy: 5 cartons bags of chips, 10 bags of candy, butter, margarine, and pasta. His strategy for growing his business is to sell his products at low prices and save little by litte in order to one day become a wholeseller of general products.

He wants one day to begin a family and will fight to gather all the resources he needs to live a better life. He is also encouraged by his friends, who want him to become a well-known businessman.

loans.use: Achat des cartons de fromage, beurre ,margarine, pates alimentaires, sucreries

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

La señora Cruz María tiene 54 años, esta casada hace  38 años y todavía lo recuerda con mucha emoción,  de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos que según ella son la razón de su vida , aunque tuvo un gran dolor ya que uno de sus hijos falleció. Ella trabaja en un jardín de infantes de la localidad ya que le encantan los niños.

Desde hace poco tiempo con uno de los créditos otorgados por la Fundación Espoir comenzó con un negocio de venta de ropa por catálogos y productos de Esica (productos de cosméticos y perfumería). Negocio al cual dedica unas tres a cuatro horas al día, dice que aprovecha  vendiéndoles  a sus compañeras de trabajo,  estos productos los entrega  bajo pedido.
   
Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear e comprar una parte en ropa y otra en los productos de Esica ya que quiere incrementar sus ventas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya cuatro ciclos y espera continuar durante muchos mas.
 
Sus metas son comprar un carro y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. Cruz Maria is 54 years old and she has been married for 38 years. She holds thoughts of her marriage in her heart with tenderness. It is from this relationship that her four children were born, and they are her reason for living, although she suffered a devastation when one of them passed away. She works in a daycare in the community and she enjoys her work, for the love of children. From a past loan granted to her by the Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) she started selling clothing on order and cosmetics and perfumes of the Esica brand name. She works at her business three or four hours a day, though she takes the opportunity to sell to her colleagues as well. There products are ordered. This new loan will be invested in part to purchase clothing and in part to purchase Esica brand products to increase her sales. She has been a member of the community bank for four loan cycles and she hopes to continue on with them. Her goal is to purchase a car and carry out some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Minardo

texts.en:
Minardo B. is from the village of Calamagui. He is 51 years old. Minardo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Minardo owns & operates a motorcycle transport service. Minardo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Minardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Minardo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Minardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nopal

texts.en:
Mrs. Nopal M. is 49 years old and her husband, Mr. Salas Ly, is 55 years old.  THey have been married since 1980 and have five children:  one son and four daughters. They live along National Road number five about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Nopal sells water pans, knives, cutting boards, ladles and spoons at the market. Her husband sells silk fabric, which he buys in Phnom Penh and transports to sell in other districts far from home. 

Nopal is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry silk fabric for resale. Because he does not have his own transportation, he currently spends a lot of money on  travel expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport goods

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child who is currently in school.  Aisha has been running a salon for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a cosmetic shop.        

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by empowering her business.

loans.use: To purchase braids.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y con 6 hijos, tiene grado D. instrucción D. educación primaria completa.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado vacuno, actualmente tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. autos la cual es compartida con su hijo.
Luisa solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y tener más capital. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Brisas D. Rio Blanco" ["Breezes of the White River"] Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 52 years old, widowed, and has 6 children.  She completed primary school.

Luisa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  The first loan she requested was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase capital for her cattle fattening business.  Currently, she has a business that she shares with her son, buying and selling cars.

Luisa is requesting a new loan of 3,000 nuevos soles.  This money will allow her to increase her business' capital.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business and to have more capital.  She enjoys the punctuality of her communal bank.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 36 years old. She is married to a TV presenter. She has four children who are between eight and twelve years old. All her children attend school. Laurence sells clothes and she has been in this business for six years. She needs this loan to buy more clothes and clothing materials. With the profits she expects to establish a small textile boutique. 

She says that her business has allowed her to accomplish many of her dreams for both her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios B. is from the village of Cabantian, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Remedios is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Remedios runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and junk foods. This will be the sixth loan taken by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He is the only income source for his family. He started to work as a car mechanic ten years ago. After seeing a need for this service in his town, he decided to open his own garage in 2006. He obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a punctual client with prompt payments. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to get diverse tools for his garage so he can guarantee his customers a much better service.

loans.use: To get diverse tools for his garage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to complete the necessities for his business and family

loans.name: Pamela Abigail

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Pamela Abigail R.  le está haciendo falta la barda frontal  de la casa pero en este momento ella  no cuenta con el dinero para realizar la construcción de esta,  por lo cual está solicitando este crédito  para brindarle a su familia una mayor seguridad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene como cajera en Industrias de Alimento Linares.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposo el señor Alfredo Gregorio Rásales quien fue quien nos atendió ya que la señora Pamela se encontraba en su trabajo y le fue indispensable atendernos el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pamela Abigail R.’s house lacks a front wall but she currently lacks funds to build one so is asking for this loan to provide her family with more security.

She plans to pay the loan with income she gets working as a Cashier at Industrias de Alimento Linares.

loans.use: To build a front wall.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and lives in the town of Bunawan. She is married and has seven children. Shirley is engaged in farming and, in particular, plants rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. She says that it is easier to sell to the market. Shirley also owns and manages a sari-sari store located outside her house. The store helps in providing for their daily needs.
Shirley joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose Ajwang

texts.en:
Rose Ajwang O. is a  55-year-old widower from Migori town. She has four children who are all grown up and in college.

Rose has a cereals business that she has been doing for the past four years. She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully completing the previous loans. 

Rose wants to add maize and beans to her stock using the loan that she has applied for. Her monthly income is KES 17,500.

Her desire is to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to add to her stock

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik B. is from the village of Hacik in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is the proud father of four children – three daughters (24, 28 and 29 years old) and a 16-year-old son. Gagik and his wife have been working on the family farm for over 20 years. He is content with his work and has gained the respect of his fellow villagers. Two of his daughters are married and Gagik helps them with produce grown on the family farm. 

He would like a loan to purchase animal feed. According to Gagik’s plan this investment will increase the family income by 10 percent. As his daughters have completed their education, Gagik also wishes for his son to attend college.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.en:
M. Habibulo is 48 years old. He is married and with his wife they are blessed with 3 children. Habibulo makes a living planting vegetables and wheat. In addition to this farming, he also raises cattle to provide extra income for his family. 

Since Habibulo lacks financial resources, he is hoping to borrow 9000 Somoni so he can purchase additional farm inputs to cultivate his farm and plant vegetables. Some of this loan will be used to pay for laborers who will help him plant the crops. Some will help pay for food to sustain him and his laborers during their work. Habibulo wants to sustain his farming business and hopefully grow it so he can eventually have a hectare of farmland to cultivate and provide for the future of his family.  
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding material to carry out his work

loans.name: Zamir

texts.ru: Zamir H. 25 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron reginone vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Zamir ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin. Etoy rabote on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy toje yavlyayetsya masterom po pochinkie mashin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti i instrumenti dlya pochinki mashin.
texts.en: Zamir H. is 25 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Absheron region with his parents.  Zamir is single and childless.  He has been working as a mechanic for three years.  He started this business with his uncle who is also a mechanic.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy spare parts and tools to repair cars.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is a 43-year-old farmer from Vani District, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Elena, 12-year-old son and 11-year-old daughter. 

Zaza is retailer of vegetables. He has his own minibus, which is used in his business. He purchases potatoes and onions from wholesalers in Vani once a week and sells them in the local market. This business gives to the family approximately 500 Laris per month. Along with the abovementioned, Zaza’s family has four milk cows and two calves. They produce cheese and sell on average 60 kg of cheese per month at the local market. 

With the requested loan, Zaza will purchase 1.2 tons of potatoes in South Georgia and sell it in his village. Due to the lower price and transportation costs, his cost per kilo of potatoes will be reduced by 0.50 Laris. It will increase his profit. 

Zaza and Elena plan to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the rest will be used in the family.

loans.use: to purchase 1.2 tons of potatoes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 53 سنة يعمل في حدادة وصيانة السيارات له في عمله 15سنة هو متزوج ووالد لخمسة اولاد يتميز بالدقة في العمل والخبرة الواسعة في هذا المجال يريد ان يطور نفسه وعمله وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده يسعى الى زيادة المدخول وتحسين الوضع المادي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة وعدة جديدة للمصلحة يسعى الى تطوير العمل دائما ولكن تواجهه بعض الصعوبات المادية ونقص في رأس المال له خبرة كبيرة وزبائن من محيطه وهذا ما يتطلب منه ان يطور العدة لزيادة الطلب
texts.en: Mohamad is a 53-year-old husband and father of five who strives to better himself and advance his family. For the past 15 years, he has been working in automobile maintenance and body work, a job to which he brings great experience and thoroughness. Nevertheless, in order to be able to bring in more customers from his local community, he wanted to ask Al Majmoua for a loan to purchase some new parts and equipment for the shop.

loans.use: to purchase new parts and equipment for his automobile maintenance shop.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora realiza la venta de queso y su esposo es albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad de quesos para así satisfacer a su clientela. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Teodora cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Esta será la cuarta vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Sra. Teodora operates a retail cheese business and her husband is a construction worker.  She will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of different cheeses to stock her business.  She lives in a house she owns in the Alto Irpavi neighborhood of La Paz.  She is married and has five children.  Teodora is grateful for the loans that she has received in the past because they have allowed her to support her business.  This loan will be her fourth one from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of cheese for her food business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 24 years old and has a 5-year old child. She has had a sari sari store business for 5 years.

Rona sells items like coffee, spices and soft drinks to the people in her community. She usually earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as eggs, sugar, vinegar and other daily use products.

In the future, Rona hopes to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, sugar, vinegar and other daily use products.

loans.name: Nkirmpa

texts.en:
Nkirmpa, 42 years old, is married and the father of three children. He has been farming for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Nkirmpa learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to prepare for wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

Nkirmpa's hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare for his wheat farming

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela del Carmen de 59 años  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora la cual inicio en Adim en el grupo solidario Esperanza y ahora tiene un crédito individual.  En 1981 comenzó con la venta de leña y carbón y hace 7 años que realiza tortillas las cuales vende en el mercado de Masaya. Ella a diario vende aproximada de 400 córdobas e invertirá el crédito en trigo, leña, maíz etc. para aumentar la producción
Adela  con este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus hijos el menor de ellos de  20 años está estudiando Ingeniería Agrónoma.
texts.en:
Adela del Carmen is 59 years old.  She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who started working with ADIM as a member of the "Esperanza" (Hope) community bank.  She now works with individual loans.  She started out in 1981 selling firewood and charcoal.  She has been making tortillas for the past seven years.  She sells her tortillas in Masaya market.  She sells approximately 400 cordobas worth every day and will invest this loan in buying wheat, firewood, corn, etc. so that she can increase her production.

Through this business, Adela has managed to get her children ahead in life.  Her youngest child is 20 years old and he is studying agricultural engineering.

loans.use: to buy wheat, firewood, corn, etc.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Abibatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abibatu was born in Makeni city, about 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are still not of school-going age. Abibatu sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and has been doing business for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Abibatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Abibatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy gallons of palm oil for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Don Franklin trabaja como cadete de taxi, desde hace once años, siendo propio su vehiculo, es casado, padre de tres hijos estudiantes, su esposa labora para en una empresa privada.
Ambos se apoyan para el bienestar comun de la familia, ademas del taxi, tiene la entrada de la barberia. Lo que se ayuda mucho. Y es atraves de Afodenic que ha mejorado al comprar herramientas para su trabajo.
Con este nuevo prestamo dara mantenimiento a su vehiculo en la parte de enfrente de la caroza que esta levantada, comprara dos focos, dos pide vias,un bigote, radiador completo. Lo que espera seguir trabajando en mejores condiciones
texts.en:
Don Franklin has worked as a taxi driver for eleven years, using his own vehicle. He is married and the father of three school-aged children. His wife works for a private company. They each do their part to support the common welfare of the family. In addition to the taxi he has income from the barber shop, which helps a lot. And, through Afodenic he has made improvements, buying tools for his work. 

With this new loan he will provide repairs to his vehicle to the area in front of the vehicle's cabin, which is raised up. He will purchase two bulbs, two turn signals, an air dam and an entire radiator. What he hopes for is to continue working under improved conditions.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle to improve his taxi services, which is his family's sustenance.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 37 and married with six children between the ages of four and seventeen years old. He has been farming in his hometown of Litein South Rift, Kenya, for the last 10 years and currently employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea, milk and maize which all go to the local market.

Simion has made a loan request of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the additional income will help him build a modern dairy unit for his dairy cows and pay school fees for the children. This is Simion's third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the financial support and sees animal disease as the main challenge in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years, and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles, etc. In the future, Jocelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Yunice

texts.en:
Yunice is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling breads in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Yunice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to able her purchase more breads for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: she want more income to able her purchase more breads for sale.

loans.name: Orlando Del Rosario

texts.es: Orlando Del Rosario comenzó vendiendo solamente granos básicos, que el mismo cosechaba luego compro una refrigeradora y empezó a vender refrescos, hielo entre  otros productos fue así que él decide empezar con la actividad de la pulpería. A pesar de tener 57 años siempre ha sido una persona ágil para brindarles a sus clientes un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, pan, bolsas, golosinas, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Orlando del Rosario began his business selling only basic grains which he harvested.  Later he bought a refrigerator and began selling softdrinks and ice, as well as other products, and he finally decided to open a grocery store.  Although he is 57 years old he has always been an agile person who provides good customer service.  He plans to use the loan to buy basic grains, softdrinks, bread, bags, sweets, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, softdrinks, bread, bags, sweets, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 37-year-old man from Mariakani. He is married. John runs a welding workshop, which has been in operation for the last three years. He was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first loan.

John plans to use the loan to purchase more spare parts for his business. The profits that will be generated from the business will be directed into the repayment of the loan and gradual expansion of his business. John’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man with 2 children aged twelve and ten. He runs a business making iron boxes and charcoal banners. The business is situated in a busy, highway market. He attracts passersby and residents. Despite the poor economy he desires to work hard and provide for his family and educate his children. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy scrap metal to make more items to sell. He described himself as goal oriented.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Eudoxie Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Magloire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eudoxie Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Eudoxie Marie a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis cinq ans Eudoxie Marie vend des charbons de bois et du riz, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son quartier. Eudoxie Marie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième  fois que Eudoxie Marie et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON  sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: MAHOUGNON is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Eudoxie Marie, (hand raised in the photo), is 47 years old and married to a freight agent named Magloire. The couple has 2 children, both of them are in their care and go to school. Eudoxie Marie lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. Eudoxie Marie left school at the secondary level. For the past five years, she has been selling charcoal and rice, a business that allows here to earn a decent living in her neighborhood. She buys her products at a market in Benin. This is the third time that Eudoxie Marie and the other members of MAHOUGNON have asked for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and charcoal.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana cuenta desde hace 10 meses con un local donde vende productos químicos, naturales y veterinarios. Los productos que ofrece tienen muy buena acogida en el barrio donde habita y en sus aledaños;  la ubicación de su negocio es una gran fortaleza pues se encuentra ubicada en la vía principal, por donde transitan normalmente un gran número de personas de esta zona. Su negocio debe permanecer siempre surtido con muchas líneas de productos, porque maneja una rotación que así lo exiAl analizar el estado de resultados del negocio de Eliana, se puede observar un buen nivel de ventas, que le permiten cubrir los costos operacionales, gastos familiares y reinvertir en el negocio; su balance muestra un rubro de gran tamaño, que es el de inventario, debido a la diversidad de productos que ofrece, por eso para ella es una gran ventaja  mantener un Stop aceptable en cada uno de ellos.   En su sueño de crecimiento Eliana, necesita invertir en mayores cantidades los productos que más rotan y que ofrecen descuentos especiales que le permitan ganar un poco más. Esta es la razón de estar aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará de contado y de oportunidad, propolio zarzaparrilla miel de abeja, escoba, purgante, aceite relajante jabón,  ceras y escancias; con su credikiva planea hacerlo para financiar su cartera de crédito, porque dispone de muy poco efectivo disponible para hacer compras.
