Su éxito radica en fomentar mayores utilidades con un crédito a bajo costo y lograr una respuesta siempre oportuna a sus clientes a los que cuida para poder surgir como ella lo pretende.
texts.en:
Eliana opened a store ten months ago where she sells natural and chemical veterinary products.  The products she sells are widely sought-after in the neighborhood where she lives and in surrounding areas.  Her store’s location is very strong since it’s on the main road where many local residents normally pass by.  Her store must always be well stocked with many product lines because she manages a stock turn over that demands it.  

Upon analyzing the state of Eliana’s  business results, one can observe a good sales level that allows her to meet occupational costs, family expenses and to reinvest in the business.  Her balance shows a line of work that’s large, which is the inventory, due to the large variety of products she offers.  For her, then, it’s most advantageous to keep in stock acceptable levels of each.  In Eliana’s dream of growth, she needs to invest in larger amounts of the items that sell the most and which are on special markdown that will allow her to earn a bit more profit.  

This is the reason behind her first loan application with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to pay cash and special rates for Propoleo [syrup made from honey], sarsaparilla, honey, ‘escoba’ [medicinal plant], emetics, relaxation oil, soap, wax and essences.  She plans to use her Kiva loan to finance her credit portfolio since she has very little cash available to make her purchases.  Her success resides in pushing higher profits with a low-cost loan to attain opportune response from customers who she cares for so that she can attain the growth she aims for.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 10 years old.

Edralin is engaged in farming. She tills land in Trinidad, Bohol where she grows rice crops to sell. Edralin works hard to feed her family three times a day.

Edralin is in need of fertilizer and other farm inputs. She requested this loan to purchase the farm supplies she needs. She said she is thankful that financial services like this are now accessible to farmers like her.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the four years, she has operated a meat goat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft of livestock in her business. Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a cow to sell for meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to sell for meat.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es: El Banco Mujeres Responsable,  está formado por mujeres emprendedores que han luchado por cumplir sus sueños de tener un medio que le genere ingresos para la familia. Este banco lo conforman 10 integrantes de la misma localidad que son personas que se conocen y tienen objetivos y metas en la vida. Cada uno de los integrantes brindan un servicio diferente pero siempre con el objetivo de brindarles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Nora que es la presidenta del grupo y su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la elaboración de artesanía lo cual tiene años de experiencia, este negocio lo aprendió de forma empírica, ya que la mama le enseño y ahora ella se lo transmite a sus hijos que todavía se encuentran a su cargo y trabajan con ella para salir adelante, el crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como cerámica, pintura y otros productos para la elaboración de las artesanías.  Actualmente todos los integrantes  están solicitando financiamiento para poder abastecerse de materia de prima.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Responsables' (Responsible Women) community bank is a group of entrepreneurial women who have worked hard to achieve their dreams of having a way of making income for their families.  This bank has ten members who are all from the same town.  They all know each other and all have goals and aims in life.  Each one of the members provides a different service but they all share the aim of providing their customers with a good service. 

Nora is the group's president and her business is making handicrafts.  She has years of experience in this line of work.  She learned the business from direct experience as her mom taught her.  Now she, in turn, is passing on the knowledge to her children who are in her care and work with her in order to get ahead in life.  Nora is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as pottery, paint and other products for making handicrafts.  All the members of the group are requesting the loan to stock up with raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as pottery, paint and other products, for making handicrafts

loans.name: Nhoeng

texts.en:
A 38-year-old mother of four dependent children who are still in school, Nhoeung is a farmer in a village in the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is common. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a taxi driver. She can manage to earn seven U.S. dollars per day from her current business but can save less than five U.S. dollars daily. 

Nhoeng is in her first cycle with VisionFund and is requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to produce more rice which will allow her to improve her lifestyle and also to keep her children in school so they can continue to higher education.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Frusila

texts.es:
Frusila de 49 años es divorciada y tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos hoy ya mayores forjándoles un buen porvenir lleno de principios y valores. Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe. Resaltando la buena sazón que posee decidió de manera independiente iniciarse en la venta de comida en una feria distrital de su localidad. Lleva 10 años trabajando solo los fines de semana puesto que es un día en que las personas del campo concurren a la ciudad para realizar sus compras semanales y darse algún gustito adicional.
Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que es experta en la preparación de algunos platos típicos de su región como “la puca picante”, “caldo de mote”, entre otros. No obstante el estar parada y en constante movimiento es algo fatigante al finalizar el día, pero con la satisfacción de haber brindado la mejor variedad gastronómica, sus comensales quienes en agradecimiento por la buena atención concurren constantemente a su puesto.
Para seguir trabajando de manera fluida tiene planeado adquirir ingredientes e insumos al por mayor como son el arroz, sacos de papa nativa y otros al por mayor con la finalidad de obtener descuentos y elevar sus ganancias finales.
Tiene el deseo a futuro con su trabajo iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de concreto y ladrillos, pues posee un terreno en una esquina de su barrio y considera que por ser una esquina tendría buena concurrencia para un pequeño negocio de comidas. Este es su primer préstamo, se siente algo tranquila puesto que puede ahora trabajar de manera mas fluida e invertir con mucho entusiasmo. Agradece desde ya a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la buena acogida.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado en la compra de sacos de arroz, papas nativas y otros para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Frusila, 49, is divorced.  She's proud to have gotten her children ahead, who are now adults, giving them a good future full of principles and values.  She has a house made of adobe.  

Highlighting the good seasoning she has, she decided on her own to get started selling food in a district street fair in her town.  For 10 years she has been working alone on the weekend because it's a day when country people go to the city to do their weekly shopping and give themselves a little extra pleasure.

She's very comfortable in her job because she's an expert in preparing some traditional dishes of her region, including "puca picante" [potatoes with a beet-peanut sauce], "caldo de mote" [a corn soup], and others.  Even so, standing up and constantly moving is somewhat tiring at the end of the day, but with the satisfaction of having given the best variety of food.  Her guests constantly come to her stall in gratitude for her good service.

To continue working smoothly she plans to acquire ingredients and supplies such as rice, sacks of native potatoes, and other products wholesale so she can get discounts and raise her final profits.

In the future she wants to start building her house of concrete and brick because she has land on a corner in her neighborhood and thinks that, because it's on the corner, there would be enough people for a small food business.

She feels at peace because now she can work more smoothly and invest with great enthusiasm.  She's grateful to her communal bank colleagues for their warm welcome.

This is her first loan.  With the 500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll supplement her capital for buying bags of rice, native potatoes, and other supplies to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, native potatoes, and other products

loans.name: Anela Lina

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Angela no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras y calurosas calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tacu Tacu para compartir con si familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Angela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, dulces, golosinas, gaseosas y otros, de esta manera Angela tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y desea verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Angela, 33, lives in the city of Pucallpa with her two children who she loves and are the main reason for living.

She is a very nice, hard working and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to getting her family ahead as she is a single parent. 

Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and because she had to work when she was very young, she was unable to study Business Administration like she had wanted to. 

In her free time she likes to stroll through the cozy hot streets in the city and sometimes she will cook a delicious Tacu Tacu [Peruvian steak, rice and beans dish] to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angela has a small grocery store. She works every day for approximately twelve hours. She believes it is going well for her because she has good prices and great customer service. 

Anglea is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she is able to buy a larger quantity and variety of merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, vegetables, candy, sodas etc. 

Angela will have her business better stocked and will be able to attend to more customers. 

This way she can keep working and striving to reach her big dream of offering a good education to her children who she wants to see working as professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tukurakurane Munteme Group

texts.en: Kenneth is a very hardworking member of  Tukurakurane Menteme Group. He is a married father of 6 children and lives in Hoima Uganda. He has always admired to have a stable source of income so as to raise incomes to support his family and as a result he ventured into farming growing mainly cassava. He is seeking for credit to finish his residential house.

loans.use: to finish his residential house by buying doors and windows for closing it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her African craft business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce wants to buy 8 sacks of sugar, 6 sacks of flour, 10 boxes of soap and 200kg of cooking fat

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: A. Kamil has a big family of six members. In 1993 he decided to open his small business in Bilasuvar: animal breeding.  To approach the aim he intends to borrow US$ 1200  through Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: Going to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is a 45 years old widower, in charge of two daughters who attend a public school; they all live at his mother’s house.

Some years ago, Marcial moved to Argentina, looking for better work opportunities; he was a construction worker and, after saving enough money, he returned to Paraguay to start his own business.

He owns a grocery store at home, that he used to run with his late wife. After her passing, Marcial was left in charge of their daughters and the business. With great sacrifice, he saw his business grow and, today, it is one of the most popular grocery stores in the area.

Marcial wants to obtain a $600 loan, which he’ll invest in the purchase of more groceries to stock his store, such as canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcial tiene 45 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 2 hijas que estudian en una escuela pública; ellos viven todos juntos en la casa de la madre de Marcial.

Años atrás, Marcial viajó a Argentina en miras de mayores oportunidades laborales, trabajó como ayudante de construcción y luego de ahorrar dinero suficiente, volvió a Paraguay para montar su propio negocio.

El posee una despensa en su casa, que atendía en principio con su esposa. Tras el fallecimiento de ella, Marcial quedó a cargo de sus hijas y del negocio. Con mucho sacrificio pudo ver crecer el negocio y hoy día, es una de las despensas más populares de la zona.

Marcial desea solicitar un crédito de $600, que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para vender, tal como productos enlatados, lácteos, golosinas y gaseosas.

loans.use: Purchase of canned and dairy products, candies and sodas.

loans.name: Oyah

texts.id:
Oyah (60) is a widow who lives with her only daughter and 2 grandchildren. To help her daughter who sells clothes, she started a kiosk that sells snacks, soft drinks and other daily household needs. She earns about $8.5 per day from her kiosk, which is enough to buy food, but insufficient to afford her grand-children's education. Oyah wants to obtain $100 loan to increase her kiosk's offering. She expects $10 additional income. She expects to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Oyah (60) adalah seorang janda yang tinggal bersama 1 anak perempuan dan 2 cucunya, untuk membantu anaknya yang juga berjualan pakaian, dia membuka warung makanan, minuman dan barang-barang rumah tangga lainnya. dalam sehari oyah mendapatkan penghasilan dari warungnya itu $8.5, sudah cukup untuk makan, namun dia juga ingin cucu-cucunya dapat pendidikan yang layak sehingga dia berniat meminjam uang sebesar $100 untuk menambah barang-barang yang ada di warungnya, dengan menghasilannya itu ditambah dengan penghasilan anaknya $ 10 akan membayar pinjamannya dalam waktu 12 bulan.

loans.use: To increase income

loans.name: Emilin

texts.en: 'LAPO has not failed me', says Mrs. Emilin O. U. who loves to share her view with others about LAPO. According to her, she learned her trade for a week and then opened on her own in 1997. She is a member of LAPO and secretary of her union. She is 50 years old, married and has 8 children, she lives in Benin City. She needs $400 to buy more plantain and oil for the production of plantain chips.

loans.use: To buy more plantain chips for sale

loans.name: Fafau

texts.en: This is Fafau's second loan. She would use it to buy supplies for her barbecue business. This barbecue business has helped her meet many of her family's financial commitments. She would use the loan to sustain the business, but she hopes to obtain future loans from SPBD to expand the business by introducing other food products. But her focus now is on firmly establishing the core business in barbecue. She is very grateful for the assistance from SPBD and lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro left his hometown, Gutierrez Zamora, Mexico, some 20 years ago, in search of new work opportunities. When he arrived in Nuevo Leon, he found his first job, in food sales, working as a waiter for a year. His enthusiasm for the job led him to excel at it and he was promoted to cook, grilling the meat for tacos and, over time, learning how to make different kinds of tacos. Because his earnings weren't enough to support his wife and two children, he decided to start his own business and, little by little, he came to be the neighborhood "taquero" (taco maker).

Alejandro is applying for a US$200 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that he will use to buy ingredients for making his products along with a couple of tables and chairs. With your help, Alejandro can improve his business and help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandro salió de su natal tierra Gutiérrez Zamora, México aproximadamente hace 20 años, en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo. Al llegar a esta frontera encontró su primer trabajo en la venta de comidas, laborando como mesero durante un año. El gusto por su trabajo lo hizo superarse en ese negocio y lo pasaron al asador de las carnes, con el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a preparar los diferentes tipos de tacos. Debido a que con lo que ganaba no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos y su esposa fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio y poco a poco es como ah podido posicionarse como taquero en su comunidad.

Alejandro está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Alejandro podrá comprar material para elaborar sus productos así como comprar un par de sillas y mesas. Con tu ayuda Alejandro podrá sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Zaujat's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Zaujat Z., 29, is married with two children, ages 1 and 2. In 2007, Zaujat started selling clothes, and she works everyday from 7am to 6pm at her business.

Previously, Zaujat had received a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling wood, selling items in a shop, and tailoring.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
To harvest his land and grow more

Cosechar sus tierras y sembrar mas

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida is 46 years old and lives in the village of Memorial Sandino in the capital. She works as a very responsible person in a pharmacy. She helps needy children as young as 5 years old.

She has 4 young boys who help her with daily home expenses. One of her biggest dreams is to have a better home, one that will offer the basic needs that all human beings need in order to have a healthy and nice life.

The loan Zoraida requests is to invest in the purchase of building materials which will be used to remodel a bedroom and living room in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoraida tiene 46 años de edad habita en el Bo. Memorial Sandino de nuestra capital, trabaja como responsable de farmacia en un Centro de apoyo a niños de escasos recursos desde hace cinco años. Tiene 4 hijos varones de los cuales dos trabajan y ayudan en gran medida a su mamá en los gastos de la casa. Uno de los grandes anhelos de la Sra. es tener una vivienda más digna, que cuente con las comodidades básicas que todo ser humano necesita para vivir en un ambiente sano y agradable. El préstamo doña Zoraida lo esta solicitando para invertir el dinero en compra de materiales de construcción que utilizará para la remodelación de un cuarto y de la sala de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to build a room for their home

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man with seven children, six of which are in school. He has a full time job in a tailoring factory, making uniforms for schools and businesses. He earns $47 per week. He buys a carton of 1000 empty sacks for $411 which his wide sells individually for a net profit of $58 per carton.

loans.use: David is seeking a loan to purchase one carton of sacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of furniture and medical costs

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is 63 years old, she did not have the opportunity to study for being a woman and had to do the chores at home. She is married to Francisco A. Calderón, they have 5 children who all work in the city and are independent. They visit their parents on the anniversary of the District or special festivities. Doña Genoveva is a member of “Banco Comunal San Pedro D. Unicachi”. Since she was very young, she has been selling potatoes, “chuño” (a kind of Peruvian potato), broad beans, and “tarwi” at the market of Yunguyo. She also sells sheep, and young pigs. She lives in her own house; it has electricity, water, and latrine and is located in the Santa Bárbara Sector, District of Ollaraya, Province of Yunguyo. She and her husband spend every day farming, collecting broad beans, “chuño”, and potatoes.

With the requested loan of S/.200, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy “chuño” and a small sheep to be sold when the first instalment of her loan is due. It is her dream that her children work and their business grow, and that she may work as long as God permits.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Genoveva tiene 63 años D. edad, no estudió sólo por que fue mujer, tuvo que dedicarse a los quehaceres D. la casa. Es casada con Francisco A. Calderón, con quien tuvo cinco hijos, quienes trabajan en la ciudad y son independientes; ellos llegan para el aniversario del Distrito o fiestas grandes. Doña Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi”, se dedica a la venta D. papa, chuño, habas y tarwi en la feria D. Yunguyo desD. muy joven. También venD. ovejas y chanchitos. La casa donD. vive es propia cuenta con luz, agua y letrina y está ubicada en el Sector Santa Bárbara, Distrito D. Ollaraya, Provincia D. Yunguyo. Con la ayuda D. su esposo pasan los días en los trabajos D. la chacra, recogiendo los productos como habas, chuño y papa.

Con este crédito D. S/. 200.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará chuño y una oveja pequeña, la cual será vendida, cuando se acerque la fecha del pago D. su primera cuota. El sueño que ella tiene es que sus hijos trabajen y crezcan en su negocio. Y que ella trabajara hasta donD. Dios le permita.

loans.use: Purchase a kind of Peruvian potato (chuño) and a sheep.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị N. joined the TYM Fund in 2003. Before participating in the fund, her family had financial difficulties because they had to care for their young children. Now she only cares for one child who is in high school. In the past few years, her family has borrowed money to raise pigs and chicken. Their income from raising livestock is 2,000,000 VND per month. Currently, she has 9 pigs and 200 chicken which she is prepared to sell.

She has been successful with raising livestock which is how she has been able to provide for her child in high school. Additionally, she carefully monitors her finances to save when possible. Her eldest also has a job now and a steady income of 2,000,000 VND per month.

For this loan, she wishes to borrow 6,000,000 VND to invest in her animal rearing business. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị N. tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2003. Khi trưa tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình khó khăn do nuôi các con ăn học, hiện nay chị đang nuôi một con học đại học. Trong các năm qua gia đình chị vay vốn về chị dùng để chăn nuôi lợn, gà thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị là: 2.000.000đ/ tháng . Hiện nay trong chuồng nhà chị đang có 9 con lợn chuẩn bị xuất và 200 con gà thịt, chăn nuôi hiệu quả nên chị đã có đủ điều kiện để nuôi con học đại học, ngoài ra chị vẫn tích lũy được tiền để tiết kiệm, Con lớn của chị hiện tại cũng đã có công ăn việc làm và cho thu nhập ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising Pigs and Chicken

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz G. has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is a widower with one son. He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, and other items.

With a starting capital of 100 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 4 years ago, in order to support his son and parents. To this date, he is the only support of his son and parents. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells.

With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 9 months. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Lidia Maruja

texts.es:
primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=25261&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Minka. Lidia es soltera y tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres, Lidia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus abuelos ubicado en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas variadas, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, para lo cual cuenta con personal que le ayuda a atender, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de una avenida y de la feria del distrito.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, gaseosas y cervezas. Los sueños de Lidia son ampliar su negocio, surtir con otros productos y tener un bar en otro local.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=25261&_tpos=... Lidia is a member of the Minka communal bank. Lidia is single, 30 years old, and lives with her parents. Lidia has a store in her grandparents’ house, which is located in the Jesús Nazareno district. She sells groceries and various drinks. She works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. In order to do this, she counts on personnel to tend to the store. Her store is located close to a main street and the district market. Lidia needs a 2000 soles loan to purchase sugar, noodles, soft drinks and beers. Lidia dreams of expanding her store, providing other products and owning a bar in another local.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lidia needs a 2000 soles loan to purchase sugar, noodle, soft drinks and beers

loans.name: Cabrera

texts.es:
El señor O. B. Cabrera tiene la edad de 42 años su estado civil es soltero, no tiene hijos, solo un hermano el cual le ayuda en este negocio, uno de sus propósitos no se relacionan solamente con su negocio sino que son también personales y es mantener activo su negocio ya que este le ha generado ingresos, otros de sus propósitos  es suministrarle mejoras a su vivienda como seria: la instalación de piso, agua potable entre otras cosas ya que para el estas son una de las necesidades que ocupan mayor relevancia para el en lo personal por lo que sus propósitos son salir adelante y lograr lo que se ha propuesto para si mismo satisfacer sus necesidades.

El se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de bisutería en la que vende los productos de: golosinas, agua, tajaditas, galletas y jugo su ubicación es en León el tiempo que Don Estaciono tiene de poseer el negocio es de  20 años el inicio de este negocio se dio por una pequeña canasta la que contenía cigarrillos y caramelos y obtuvo afluencia de clientes y al ver que no cubría la demanda decide invertir mas en su negocio es por eso el motivo del financiamiento para  incrementar en su producto por lo que es necesario la compra de estos productos ya que Don Estaciono realiza las compras en las diferentes distribuidoras de león por lo que le resultas mas favorable y agradece trabajar con  fundación León 2000    y otras organizaciones que le facilitaron este tipo de crédito.
texts.en:
O. B. Cabrera is 42 years old and single. He doesn't have any children, just a brother who helps him in this business. One of his goals is a personal matter, as well as a business matter: to keep his business active since it is generating income. Another of his purposes is to make improvements to his home, such as floor installation, potable water, and other items, since for him, these are some of the needs that are of the greatest relevance for him personally. His goals are to get ahead and achieve what he has proposed to meet his needs. He sells costume jewelry and also sells sweets, water, cookies, and juice. He is located in León. Don Estaciono has had the business for 20 years. It began as a small stand that had cigarettes and caramels and grew due to customers. When he saw that demand wasn't met, he decided to invest more in his business. For this reason, he seeks financing to increase his products, and to buy those products from different distributors in León. This results in a more favorable pricing. Don Estaciono is grateful to work with Fundación León 2000 and other organizations that facilitate these types of loans.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Mrs. Hoy V. is 50 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables in her village in Koktlokroam Commune, Siem Reap Province. She began her work in 2000 and is the mother of five children; two of her sons are fishermen, two are still young, and the other one is married and lives away home. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Lach, 48, is a fisherman who catches fish by using traps, nets, and a boat on Tunle Sap Lake. This is the main source of income for covering his family's living expenses. Hoy is applying for a loan for her husband to buy more fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat R. is 64 years old and a resident of Kandal Province. She makes a living selling fresh fish and fish paste in local market. She currently earns an income of approximately of $7 per day. She started the business over twenty years ago. She is married with eight children, seven of whom are single and one of whom is married. 

To help meet the family's needs, two of her daughters are employed as garment workers, earning salaries of $160 per month. Her husband is a local teacher, as well as a fisherman. 

Because she lacks capital to enlarge her business, R. is applying for a loan to purchase fish to make fish paste to sell. 

She and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fish to make fish paste to sell

loans.name: Idalia Maria

texts.es: Doña Idalia tiene 37 años de edad, habita en Hialeah II etapa en la ciudad de Managua su negocio es una tienda de ropa y zapatos, también vende refrescos desde hace ocho años esta en la venta que inicio con ahorro, tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, que estudia y por las tarde le ayuda en la venta. Para aumentar su inventario y ofertar productos variados a su clientela hizo solicitud de crédito en Afodenic lo cual se siente apoyada y beneficiada por sus préstamo con este es el octavo lo cual va ha invertir en la compra de útiles escolares ya que viene el ingreso a clase y se vende mucho. Sus objetivos es implementar nuevos segmentos de mercado en donde sastifaga las necesidades del cliente, sus planes es poder ayudar a su hijo a que cierre el ciclo de sus estudios para que sea un hombre profesional.
texts.en:
Doña Idalia is 37 and lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood of Managua. She has a clothing and shoe store, which also offers soft drinks. She started her business eight years ago with her own savings. She has a 16-year-old son who goes to school, and then helps out in the store in the afternoons. Idalia is requesting a loan from AFODENIC so she can increase her inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers. She feels that the loans support and benefit her. This will be her eighth loan, which she will invest in school supplies. They will sell well since classes start soon. She plans to enter new market segments where she can meet her customers' needs. Her son is finishing up his studies, and Idalia's goal is to help him become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana Osei-B. is 26 years old. She is not yet married but has given birth to one child, a boy who is currently crawling. According to Susana, the man deceived her that he would marry her, and after putting her in the family way, deserted her. She is now living with her mom and younger siblings in an old family house in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

Susana trades in ripped bananas and roasted groundnuts. She buys unripe bananas from wholesalers in the nearby markets, stores them until they're ripe, and then sells them with roasted groundnuts. She sells at a junction in her community. Ripped bananas and roasted groundnuts are a delicacy many people purchase in the afternoons. Susana has been in business for 3 years. It has been her desire to make enough savings to support herself and her son. She wants a loan to procure bananas in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas in bulk

loans.name: Union Cristiana 1 Group

texts.en:
The five members of the Union Cristiana Bank of Hope are ready to start their entrepreneurship adventure through Esperanza International. This is their first loan, and the group is very optimistic about using it to improve their business activities.

Wilkins C. is the group coordinator. He is the father of four boys, two of whom live with him, while the other two live with their mother. Wilkins used to sell fruits and vegetables as a street vendor, but has decided to set up a produce business at home because he would like to spend more time with his children. He wants to take better care of them and be more involved in their education.

Wilkins has set up a small produce stand at his home, with room to store produce and receive clients. He will use this first loan to buy the produce he plans to sell. When interviewed about his business, Wilkins explained that the products in highest demand are plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, yucca, all salad vegetables, papayas, melons, oranges and tangerines. He goes to the market three times a week to restock. He hopes to stabilize his home business and eventually grow it into a mini market.

The Union Cristiana Bank of Hope and Esperanza International thank you for helping Wilkins grow his business and be a more present parent by working from home.

loans.use: purchase merchandise to sell from home

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana está casada hace 30 años con el señor Reinaldo Britez con quien tiene una hija de 12 años de edad llamada Daiana.

Anteriormene, como la parada de una empresa de transporte urbano se encontraba frente a su domicilio, doña Susana le daba de comer a los choferes. Como le iba muy bien decidió ampliar su negocio, y pensó anexarle, a la venta de comida, con una pequeña despensita. Pero para eso le hacia falta capital, por lo cual recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya. La Fundación le otorgó el crédito y pudo abrir su pequeña despensita que todavia tiene en operacion hoy dia.

En la actualidad Susana, gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya, pudo ampliar su negocio, ahora ademas de vender artículos de primera necesidad como lo hacia desde un pricipio tambien comercializa sabanas colchas, fundas para almohadones etc.

Mas adelante piensa en ampliar más su stock en mercaderias ya que su cantidad de clientes se los exige.
texts.en:
Susana has been married for 30 years to Reinaldo Britez with whom she has a 12 year-old daughter named Daiana. Previously, since there was a stop for a bus company right across from her house, Susana sold food to the drivers. Since that was going well for her she decided to expand her business, and thought about adding a food store, with a small storage area. However, she lacked the capital for this and so she went to Fundación Paraguaya. La Fundación gave her the loan and seh was able to open the small store that is still in operation today. Currently, Susana, thanks to Fundación Paraguaya, was able to expand her business; now, in addition to selling basic necessities as she previously did, she also sells sheets, bedspreads, pillowcases, etc. In the future she is planning to expand her selection of merchandise even wider, since her client base now requires it.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yerba, noodles, sugar, rice, sodas, beer, oil, milk etc. to sell

loans.name: Paris Atieno

texts.en:
Paris Atieno O. is a 30-year-old mother of three children, ages 14, 6 and 3. All are in school. She lives in Dunga, a small fishing village just outside of Kisumu. Her husband does not work so she supports her family on her own. She sells fish at Kiboko Bay Junction (where she tells us you can regularly see hippos) and is asking for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to boost her business and purchase more fish. She says that due to tough economic times, she has fewer customers than usual, and paying school fees at times can be tough.

Paris recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina is a franchise dealer of Avon cosmetics, Natasha and Tupperware products in their village. She earns 25% commission on every 100 pesos of products sold. She lives in Barangay Minanga Sur of Iguig Cagayan. Rosefina is 49-years old and married to Edgar B. who works as a simple carpenter in their village. They are blessed with two children. The elder is Rocky, 25-years old and already married, while the younger is Rachelle, 19-years old and presently a college student in Tuguegarao City. Rosefina is thankful that her son sometimes still extends them financial support even though he has his own family to look after.

Rosefina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to expand her direct selling business. The money will be used to purchase more products to sell in order to earn more profit. She is hoping to increase her business income in order provide her daughter with a good education and allow her to finish her college courses. Rosefina dreams of having her own business stall in town to sell different Avon, Natasha, MSE, and Tupperware products

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en:
D. Saidahmad is an ordinary man in the district of Rudaki in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person who since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, his wife and 3 children. Saidahmad needs to purchase calves and goats to reproduce them and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Saidahmad is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: António Júlio

texts.pt:
António Júlio M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 20,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

António de 47 anos nasceu no distrito de Xai-Xai, Província de Gaza, estudou até nona classe. Casado e pai de cinco filhos dos quais quatro são maiores e um menor.
Foi militar e depois passou a desmobilização dez anos mais tarde e neste momento trabalha numa empresa de segurança. Trabalha oito horas por dia.
Sustenta as despesas da família com ajuda da esposa que é negociante. Como o salário é bastante baixo não consegue fazer poupanças já que as despesas de educação dos filhos são bastantes altas.
Com o empréstimo de 20,000.00MT pretende melhorar as condições de habitabilidade da família.
Para o futuro espera concluir com as obras e equipar a sua residência.
texts.en:
António is 47 years old and was born in the district of Xai-Xai in the Province of Gaza. He went to school through the 9th grade. He is married and the father of 5 children, four of which are grown, and the youngest is a minor. He was in the military and was demobilized 10 years later. Right now he works for a security company. He works 8 hours per day. He handles the expenses of the family with the help of his wife who is a businesswoman. As his salary is very low he is unable to save money especially now that the education costs of his children are quite high. With a loan of 20,000MT he intends to improve the living conditions of his family. In the future he hopes to finish his work and furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy construction material for family house

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que la première est vétuste est lui cause d’énormes dépenses. Komi compte sur cette opportunité  pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A. is 29 years old, married and the father of one child. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé, a village located roughly 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Given that his first motorcycle is run down and very costly to maintain, he hopes to purchase a new one with this loan. Komi is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin T. is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes of various colors and sizes. She is requesting  the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Amerina

texts.en:
Amerina D. is a native of the remote island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 43 years old and married to Joselito who is a fisherman and 38 years old. She is a mother to an only son James Michael who is 3 years old. In her village, people are busy in looking for living. You cannot see malls, and other luxurious and tempting establishments.
In 2006, she joined ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with aspirations of bringing hope for her family to start a business of her own. Her previous loans was used by her husband as her business partner as rolling capital in making boats. Until now they are still making boats when there are orders but not now their primary business. Just more than a year ago, she shifted her business into fishing with fish cage. And it brings her good income. Her husband is also her business partner. They found it to be profit -sounded.
Now on her  4th loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for  2 bundles of fish nets, 60 pieces of bamboos, fingerlings, transportation and labor costs.
The fingerlings will be cultured in the fish cage until it will be ready to harvest. They will sell fishes in the market and sometimes will go directly to their fish cage to buy fish. She believes that her business will grow and she dreams of putting-up additional fish cages for bigger income. She also aspires of sending her child to school until he finish college and find job. Also, she dreams of having durable and spacious house someday.

loans.use: To pay for  2 bundles of fish nets, 60 pieces of bamboos, fingerlings, transportation and labor costs.

loans.name: Laura Benancia

texts.es:
La señora LAURA BENANCIA A. O. tiene 69 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
LAURA es Soltera.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Cachanchugo II
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de primaria, porque desde esa edad empezó a dedicarse al campo por ordenes de su padre.
Y por ser la mayor de 10 hermanos tuvo que colaborar en la crianza de sus hermanos.
Laura se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para luego matarlos y venderlos en la plaza de Usquil y también separa unos kilos para los fines de preparar comidad típicas como frito, chuletas , adobo, chicharrón y venderles a sus vecinos y trabajadores del campo
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compró cuyes para criarlos y reproducirlos.
Con este crédito de 800  soles lo invertirá en la compra de lechones para criarlos venderlos y prepara sus platos de comida que venderá.
LAURA  tiene como sueño aumentar su crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Laura is 69 years old and lives in Usquil District, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, in Peru. She is single and belongs to the Cachanchugo II Community Bank. This entrepreneur studied until the 6th grade of primary school, when she began to work in the fields by order of her father. And being the eldest of 10 children, she had to help in raising her brothers and sisters.

Laura raises pigs, slaughters them, and sells the meat in Usquil plaza. In addition, she separates some kilos to prepare typical dishes, such as fried meat, pork chops, sauces, and crackling, to sell to neighbors and workers in the countryside.

With her first loan of $103 she bought guinea pigs to raise and reproduce. With this credit of $275 she will invest in suckling pigs to raise and sell and for preparing the meals she will sell.

Laura's dream is to increase her breeding of hogs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUCKLING PIGS

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise K. is 29 years old, is married with one child two years old, and she takes care of one dependent.

Marie Louise has operated a beauty salon for one year and, in that salon, she employs four employees, working from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. After realizing that her saloon was too small to even welcome five clients at once, Marie Louise is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand its size and to purchase more equipment. This will enable her to welcome more clients at the same time and thereby she hopes to earn more profit than before.

Through the use of this new loan, Marie Louise has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To expand the size of her salon and purchase more equipment

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es: La señora Libertad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 52 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun esta bajo su poder y esta estudiando. Libertad, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, como: juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas y en bebidas gasificadas, refrescos y jugos, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente tiene muy buena acogida, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia, fue quien decidió emprender su propio negocio.En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos en kilos y huevos en javas, aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Se siente muy bien, para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Libertad belongs to the communal bank, “Manos Unidas” (United Hands), in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín. She is divorced, is 52, and is the mother of 3 children. One of her children still depends on her and is in school. Libertad sells refreshments like juanes (a chicken dish made of chicken, rice, olives, and eggs wrapped in a leaf), tamales, arroz chaufa (a rice dish), rice with chicken, sweets and candy, plantain chips, popcorn, soft drinks, and juices. Her business is located in her home, in an area that is fixed up well. She provides a good reception every day. She tells us that she started with 2,000 PEN and started her own business through her own initiative. Currently she is continuing with the same business and it is going very well. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, she will buy supplies for her dishes like: sacks of rice and sugar, chicken by the kilo, eggs in cartons, bottles of oil by the dozen, and kitchen utensils so she can offer high-quality service. She feels very good about being able to continue with her sales of refreshments. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to her fulfillment of her dreams and goals

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy supplies so she can prepare her food

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine B. is from the village of Tugas,Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Catherine is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine owns & operates a business venture in retail. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of goods to the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Catherine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old. She is not married and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mary works hard to provide for herself. She is a seamstress by profession. She buys fabrics from nearby towns and designs and sews dresses for female clients.

She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to Mary she has two apprentices.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to improve the quality of her services.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Kayitesi

texts.en:
Kayitesi is 47 years old, married with 5 children, aged between 8 and 19 years old. Kayitesi is a proven entrepreneur, having started in business for herself many years ago. Her current business is selling fish--a successful business and one that employs 2 people. This is her 6th successful year in this enterprise. She and her two workers put in long hours; work starts at 6 AM and goes to 6 PM every day, except Sunday.

This is Kayitesi's first time requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more fish for sale. Kayitesi hopes that she will be able to buy in larger quantities and secure better pricing which will attract more customers and allow her to earn more profit. Any profit earned will help her and her devoted spouse to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for her children (other than fish!) In addition, she will be able to build a more secure future for them.

loans.use: More fish for sale and additional working capital

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a 46-year-old widow with five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is on the coast in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Mariama sells millet. She buys bags of millet and supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Mariama has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of millet in bulk so she can meet the increasing demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy bags of millet

loans.name: Ervin Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Ervin Francisco Hernández, es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud lleva 8 años de trabajar en esa institucion desempeñandose como responsible de bodega. El sr. Ervin Francisco  va a usar el credito Para Compra de  cemento, piedrín, arena, hierro, zinc y madera para la construcción  de las paredes de la cocina de la casa.
Por que ahora no cuenta con suficiente recursos.
El sr. Ervin Francisco es casado y tiene 2 hijo a su cargo y este todavia esta a su cargo y en edad escolar.
Este el primer credito que el sr. Mario a tenido con CEPRODEL.
Ervin Francisco dijo, que los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado en gran parte ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación la cual me hacia falta construir las paredes de la cocina, por lo que antes estaba cerrada con tablas de madera
texts.en:
Mr Ervin Francisco H.is a hard worker at the Centro de Insumos Para la Salud (Centre for Health Supplies) where he has worked for 8 years with responsibility for the grocery store. Ervin Francisco will use the loan to buy cement, rocks, sand, iron, zinc and wood to construct walls for the kitchen in his house, as he currently doesn't have enough resources. Ervin Francisco is married with two children who are of school age and still in his care. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He says that the financing that CEPRODEL has awarded has helped him a lot as he will be able to improve his house, whose kitchen lacked walls and was previously enclosed by wooden boards.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, rocks, sand, iron, zinc and wood.

loans.name: Srey Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Yi H. is 61 years old and she lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 7-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pen Yang, is a duck breeder who earns a small income to help his family. 

In rice farming, Mrs. Srey Yi H. faces a problem because her field has infertile soil, so she would like to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. Mrs. Srey Yi H. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
G. Zuhra is 60 years old. She is a kindergarten teacher. However, for 17 years Zuhra has been selling clothing. She sells socks for men and children in the central local market. Zuhra spends the income from the business for the well being of her family. Today she requests 5,000 Somoni to purchase new goods to sell. Zuhra promises to pay the loan on time and thanks all for supporting her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada T. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Diosdada owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: Rosa Delia tiene 50 años de edad, por lo que tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. La señora Rosa se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima para su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia, 50, has three children, all of whom work independently. Rosa has a grocery store where she sells, for the most part, snacks, bread, detergent, fuit juices, cookies, among other products. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. She began with a small capital investment and gradually saved up until she had a suitable customer base. She will use the funds to buy stock items for her store. Her eventual goal is to have a store in which she stocks many things.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la zona  Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa de sus padres, aun es soltero.

Es un joven emprendedor, tiene una pequeña oficina donde ofrece servicios de empleo a gente de escasos recursos en su mayoría.
Con el primer y segundo  crédito amobló y amplio su oficina ubicada en la principal zona comercial de la ciudad.
 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mercadería electrónica (especialmente radios y dvd players) ya que desea ampliar  la oferta de servicios en su oficina.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristian lives in El Alto's Ballivián neighborhood; he is single and lives with his parents. He is an enterprising young man. He has a small office where he offers employment services mostly to low-income people. He used his first and second loans to furnish and enlarge his office, which is in the city's main commercial zone. This loan will be used to buy electronic items (especially radios and dvd players) because he wants to diversify the range of services offered in his office. This is his third loan with Impro; the evaluation conducted indicates that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy radios and DVD players.

loans.name: El Maodo Malick

texts.fr: Monsieur Maodo M. est un jeune pâtissier  de 23 ans qui habite dans la localité de yoff Dagoudane. Il est membre de l’institution depuis janvier 2010. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est après  avoir arrêté ses études qu’il s’est lance dans l’activité de pâtissier. Il a une activité diversifiée car il fait aussi de l’aviculture. Il capitalise une expérience  de 2 ans dans la pâtisserie.  Monsieur M. a choisi cette activiste par l’intermédiaire de ‘un de ses amis dont la mère  gérait un service traiteur. Les meilleurs moments qui lui procurent plus de bénéfices  sont les weekends  et les périodes d’événements  heureux.Il sollicite  un crédit de 500 000 frs pour acheter des poussins, de l’aliment, des vaccins et des vitamines. Ce crédit lui permettra d’avoir plus d’autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mr. Maodo M. is a 23-year-old pastry-maker, living in the town of Yoff Dagoudane. He has been a member of the micro-finance institution since January 2010. He is unmarried without children. He embraced the pastry business after interrupting his studies. His activities are diversified as he also raises chickens. He has now accumulated two years’ experience in pastry-making. Mr. M. chose this activity influenced by a friend whose mother managed a deli business. The times of most profit to him are weekends and family festivities. He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy chicks, chicken feed, vaccines and vitamins. This loan will give him more financial autonomy.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio.
Faustina es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Faustina tiene una ferretería en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, los domingos viaja a la feria con los mismos productos.
Faustina necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Faustina sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Imperio Communal Bank. Faustina is 37, married, and has three children. Faustina sells hardware in a rented location. She works at this business everyday. On Sundays she travels to the fair with these products. Faustina needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy tools. Faustina dreams of expanding her business and having her own place.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Belen.
Vilma es casada, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Vilma junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, viaja a las ferias en donde compra los animales y los vende en la feria de Ayacucho.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado.
Vilma sueña con ampliar su negocio y que su hijo salga adelante.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Belen Communal Bank. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Vilma and her husband buy and sell cattle. She travels to various fairs where she buys the animals and then sells them at the fair in Ayacucho.

Vilma needs a loan of 1050 PEN to invest in the purchase of cattle. She dreams of expanding her business so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Mark Otieno

texts.en:
Mark Otieno O. is 38 years old, a husband and father of seven children. He owns a nursery school in Nyalenda, which he started in 2008 after quitting farming. He started the school to help many children within the vicinity learn basic skills and to generate his income from it.

He would like to get a loan of 30,000 KES to be able to renovate the classes so that they look appealing and the children feel comfortable there. The renovation will also attract more children which will ensure him sufficient income as he plans to be financially stable so that he can educate his children.

loans.use: to renovate the school

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est un regroupement de cinq femmes de la ville de Tominian  (quatrième région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et une moyenne de 4  enfants. 
Elles mènent différentes activités commerciales: vente d’articles divers, d’habits et de condiments. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur  2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Les femmes du groupe Danaya s’approvisionnent en marchandises à San et  à Bobo.  Elles vendent au marché de Tominian  et dans les villages environnants de la ville de Tominian.
Dans le groupe figure une femme du nom de Mariam B. qui fait la navette entre Tominian et le Burkina dans le cadre de son activité. En effet elle fait l’achat et la vente des tissus en soie et des draps de lit. 
Avec son prêt elle compte acheter, 5 balles de tissus en soie et 6 douzaines  de draps de lit.
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 42000FCFA tandis que les autres du groupe espèrent sur un profit mensuel de 39000 FCFA   
En dehors des remboursements de prêt elles utilisent une partie de leur revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses de leur famille.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of five women from Tominian (the fourth largest administrative region of Mali) who met through family and neighbours. They are all around 42 years-old, married with four children on average. They are involved in various business activities: selling various products, clothes and condiments. In order to upscale their business, the members have decided to seek a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso. The women in the Danaya group source their goods from San and Bobo, and sell them at the Tominian market and in the surrounding villages. A group member called Mariam B. takes the ferry between Tominian and Burkina in order to trade her goods. She buys and sells silk and bed linen. She hopes to use her loan to purchase 5 rolls of silk and 6 dozen bedsheets, and aims to generate monthly loans of 42,000 FCFA and the other women aim to generate 39,000 FCFA. Apart from repaying the loans they will use part of their revenue to see to their family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. E. Saravia Maria Ysabel, vive en el caserio de sacta perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su nieto. Trabaja como obrera de campo en agrícola la venta desde hace 6 meses. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda. Su sueño es poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su nieto. La Sra. E. agardece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
E. Saravia Maria Ysable lives in the district of Santiago and is responsible for her grandson. For the last 6 months, Maria has been doing agricultural work. She has her own home, but it is in need of some basic repairs. She is requesting a loan so that she can make these necessary repairs. Her dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for her grandson. Maria appreciates the support that we can offer her through this micro loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs on the home she shares with her grandson.

loans.name: Yene

texts.es:
Yene es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso y los prestamos que obtiene son de mucha ayuda para su negocio. Yene viaja a su pueblo Cancha Cancha en donde compra cereales de los agricultores y luego los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde los comercializa a los mercados, el transporte lo realiza con carro alquilado por lo que sueña comprar un carro que le facilite su trabajo. Yene vive en casa alquilada y su objetivo es construir su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
Yene solicita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y haba.
texts.en:
Yene is in a common law marriage and has two children in school. She is a member of the Glorioso communal bank and the loans she obtains are a big help to her business. Yene travels to her town Cancha Cancha where she buys grains from farmers and later she transports them to the city of Ayacucho where she sells them to markets. She does the transport with a rented car and that is why she dreams of buying a car that will facilitate her work. Yene lives in a rented house and her objective is to build a house for her children. Yene is asking for a loan of 1250 soles. The money will be used to buy wheat, barley and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley and beans.

loans.name: Koffi Ofo

texts.fr: M. est un homme marié et père de 3 enfants. pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il s'est lancé en 2000 dans le commerce de détail de produits générique. il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique. Son stock de marchandise est en baisse, il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'il a bien remboursé; il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits génériques afin de pouvoir gonfler son stock. avec le revenu de son commerce il contribue aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is married and the father of threee children. In 2000, he went into the retailing of generic products. He runs his business in his own shop and his stock of merchandise is low. He has already obtained a loan from WAGES that he repaid in full. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various generic products so he can build up his stock. He contributes to the expenses of the household with the income from his business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of generic products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Brigitte  Angela

texts.fr:
femme de 45  ans celibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 12ans à 18ans tous scolarisés.après avoir perçu sa première bourse scolaire à l'université elle se lanca dans la  vente des boîtes de peintures et de sanitaires  au marché en 1990. 
En 1995 avec ses benefices elle ouvre une quincaillerie avec un capital de 500000frs.
avec ce prêt elle aimerait renforcer son activité en achetant carreaux, ampoules de tous genre, pinceaux,des robinets, prises et contacts pour l'electricite et autres materiaux  de construction.
Malgré la hausse des prix sur le marché elle à pour strategie d'épargner toutes les semaine, d'améliorer son étallage et de vendre a des  prix hors concurrence afin de mieux garder sa clientèlle. 
elle aimerait que son activité prospère de jour au jour ainsi que construire une maison pour ses enfants afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et instruire ses enfants, les encoureger et les aider dans leur scolarité.
Dans son quartier elle est encouragee car elle se bat à nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
This 45 year old single woman is the mother of 2 children, aged between 12 and 18 years old, and both in school. After having using her first school loan to go to university, she started in the sale of cans of paints and toilets at the market in 1990. In 1995, with her profits, she opened a hardware store with a starting capital of 500,000 frs. With this loan, she would like to strengthen her business by buying tiles, light bulbs of all varieties, paintbrushes, sinks, electrical plugs and outlets and other construction materials. Despite a rise in market prices, she tries to save money every week, to improve her window dressing and to sell at prices below the competitive price in order to better maintain her clientèle. She would like her business to prosper from day to day, as well as build a house for her children in order to improve her family's living conditions and instruct, encourage and help her children get educated. In her neighborhood, she is encouraged because she must work hard to feed her family.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint, brushes, pikes, tiles, saws, lightbulbs, electrical plugs and outlets

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
