Violeta V. is from the village of Research Minante, Cauyan City. She is 38 years old. Violeta is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and resale. Violeta is just starting this business.

In 2007, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: GOTITAS D. AMOR

Hilda lleva años participando en la Alcancía Comunal “GOTITAS D. AMOR”, conformado por nueve integrantes, estas personas forman parte del programa Prosperidad a raíz D.  la promoción del sistema en una zona alejada D. Huarochiri y el nombre  “Gotitas D. Amor” fue idea D. una socia inspirada en una novela.
Hilda, casada con 2 hijos, cuenta con una pequeña  bodega en donD.  comercializa abarrotes y verduras, lleva 8 años dedicada en este negocio, empezó con este negocio por iniciativa propia, la razón era que no quería dejar a sus niños solos en casa porque eran pequeños, además apoya a su esposo con los gastos y la atención D. los niños y así mejorar su calidad D. vida.  Con los ingresos que ella obtiene aporta para la alimentación diaria y el pago D. los servicios básicos. Hilda tiene como meta para el futuro construir su casa y ampliar su bodega y tener una sección D. útiles para librería.

Mientras tanto con el crédito que EDAPROSPO le accedió, lo invertirá como capital D. trabajo, para adquirir más mercaderías.
texts.en:
DROPLETS OF LOVE

For years Hilda has participated in the Communal Bank “Gotitas D. Amor” (Droplets of Love), which consists of nine members. These individuals are part of the “Prosperity” program that is being promoted in the remote area of Huarochiri. The name “Droplets of Love” was the idea of a member who was inspired by a novel.

Hilda is married and has two children. She has a small store where she sells groceries and vegetables. Hilda has managed this business for eight years and started it as a result of her own initiative because she did not want to leave her children alone at home because of their young age. In addition she planned to help her husband with the expenses, look after her children, and improve their quality of life. The income she generates helps to feed her family every day and pay for basic services. Hilda’s goals for the future are to build a house and expand her store by adding a section for selling books.

Meanwhile, with the loan she agreed to receive from EDAPROSPO, Hilda will use the funds as operating capital to acquire more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Elena is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her service

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneezi, a resident of Arifwala, located in Punjab and famous for its dairy industry, is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, only three children are able to get an education. She is married to M. B., a school teacher earning a meager income. Kaneezi owns a three-room brick house in a housing colony named Al-Badar where she lives with her family. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and works as a cobbler.

A seamstress, Kaneez works very hard to support her family financially as she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has been doing this work for over five years and has established a good reputation amongst her customers for providing good quality services.

Kaneez is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law’s shoe making business. With the loan, he will buy required items such as nails, leather and shoe polishers, items that will enable him to make more shoes and earn additional pprofit. He has been engaged in this business for over 15 years, and Kaneez is confident that his business will grow with the help of this investment.

A regular loan user of Asasah, this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly paid her installments and attended all meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kaneez.

loans.use: To buy items for shoe-making business

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en:
Mweni B. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, who are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members.    Mweni sells handbags and African attire.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works 6 days a week, selling clothing door-to-door.   Mweni has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more handbags and rolls of African attire.  She aspires to add more African attire, such as Kitengi, to her product line.
Her main business challenge is transportation.

Mweni also generates additional income through rentals.  She lives in a home that she owns and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and  feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more African attire and handbags

loans.name: Pouy

texts.en:
Pouy S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. 

S. is a cook, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. S. has to spend USD 60 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 70 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 61 years old and married to Nzuve who is 66 years old. Both are blessed with four children who are now grown up.  She has been in the livestock farming business for nine years which has made her name with her customers selling farm products and .

The fact that her children have grownup contributes room for her business growth since  she now has no dependents .She was introduced to Kadet by a friend and this is her first loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies. She intends to use the anticipated profits to expand her business by practicing large scale farming in the future to boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children. 

Joseph has had a boutique for the last ten years, and he would like a loan to purchase second-hand clothes for resale. 

In the future, he hopes to change to first-hand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Los Mosqueteros Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Mosqueteros” es conformado por 17 emprendedores pertenecientes a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Sus principales negocios son de confección, venta de provisiones, ropa, carteras, producción y venta de joyas artesanales y comida rápida.
María Angélica es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, en 1º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa de casa, como por ejemplo: cortinas, sábanas, cobertores, plumones, manteles, etc., a domicilio y por  encargos, desde hace 3 años.
Con este préstamo, y gracias a sus ahorros, este mes comenzará un nuevo negocio, además del que ya tiene. Se iniciará con la venta de frutas y verduras, naturales y congeladas en su casa. 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artículos para el hogar,  establecida en el centro de la ciudad. Su motivación son sus 3 hijos: su hija de 20 años, quien estudia fonoaudiología en la universidad; su hijo de 16, quien le ayudará con la venta de verduras y su pequeña de 10 años. 
Para  María Angélica, Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo, no solo económico, sino también en la capacitación para administrar bien su negocio.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
“Los Mosqueteros” (The Musketeers) community bank has 17 entrepreneurial members who live in the city of Viña del Mar.  Their main business activities are dressmaking, selling provisions, clothes, purses, making and selling hand-crafted jewelry and selling fast food.

María Angélica is the president of this group.  In the photo she is on the far left in the back row.  Her business is selling household linen such as, for example: drapes, sheets, bedspreads, quilts, tablecloths, etc.  She sells her goods door to door and to order.  She has been in this business for 3 years.   

Thanks to this loan and some savings she has, María Angélica will set up a new business this month in addition to the one she already has.  She will start selling fresh and frozen fruit and vegetables from her home.

María Angélica's dream is to own a store where she can sell household items in the city center.  Her motivation comes from her 3 children: her 20 year-old daughter who is studying speech and language pathology at university, her 16 year-old son, who will help her with her vegetable sales and her 10 year-old daughter.

For María Angélica, Fondo Esperanza has been a great support, not only economically but also through their training sessions which teach members how to run their businesses.  

Viña del Mar is a city and municipality on the central Chilean coast.  It is known as 'The Garden City' owing to the gardens and courtyards that some of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Kashenyi Twetungure Group B-Kihihi

texts.en:
42-year-old N. Edward has been in the retail business for the past 6 years in Nsanyi-Kihihi. The reason he says he started this business is because he saw a ready market for many of the retail commodities he has been trading. Weekly, this happily married father of 6 says this business generates for him 80,000 shillings. 

Edward belongs to Kashenyi Twetungure group-Kihihi. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: To buy retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: Mirtha, de 24 años, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, que vive en compañía de sus padres Rodrigo y Lida; a quienes quiere mucho. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como única hija y sustento de sus padres, ella apoya en el cuidado, cultivo y mantenimiento de los terrenos agrícolas. Desde hace 4 años, comenzó a administrar sus cafetales, los que gracias a sus cuidados y constantes renovaciones, están generando buenos granos, tanto así que en las últimas cosechas, los negocia a un mayor precio en la ciudad de Villa Rica. Pero los sueños de ella son culminar sus estudios superiores. Por eso trabaja también en el embolsando de estas plantitas de café, para los viveros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener muchos beneficios en compañía de sus socios. Mirtha, como a todos los agricultores de su localidad, se está preparando para la cosecha de café de este año, por ello con el crédito que recibirá, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos y estar lista para la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 24, is a hard-working young woman who lives with her beloved parents, Rodrigo and Lida. They live together in harmony in their own house, which is located in the community of Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle). As the only daughter and source of support for her parents, Mirtha helps with the care, cultivation, and maintenance of their farmland. Four years ago, she starting managing their coffee fields, which thanks to her care and constant adjustments, are producing well. Over the last few years, they have been able to negotiate a better price for their crops in the city of Villa Rica. However, Mirtha's dream is to finish her higher education. For this reason, she also works bagging coffee seedlings for nurseries.

She belongs to the "Prestatarios de la Unión" ["Borrowers of the Union"] communal bank and this is her first loan through MFP. She is sure she will gain many benefits from working with her fellow group members. Mirtha, like all of the farmers in her area, is preparing for this year's coffee harvest. She will use her loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer, as well as natural fertilizers to spread among her crops, in order to be ready for the harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and other natural fertilizers

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan and known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has lived in the area of Peerkot with her family in a 3-room brick house for the past 20 years. 
She is a working lady and makes paranday (an ornament used to tie hair back). She receives a good number of orders from her neighborhood clients and earns a regular income every month, which is used to pay utility bills and other household expenses.  Kaniz is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons earn a daily wage, while her daughters are still in school. 
Her husband has a business selling fish. His business does well, particularly in the winter season. 
Kaniz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fish in larger quantities to increase his sales.  Kaniz is confident that her husband can earn good profits from his business after the loan investment.  

Kaniz is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fish for selling

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: R. is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 32 years old and married to a water distributor. She has four children and all of them go to school. R. took out a loan to stock more greens to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza S., who lives in the village of Arpy in the Shirak region of Armenia, is married and has three children – a 36-year-old daughter and two sons, aged 35 and 30. Roza, with a high school education and 27 years of experience as a farmer, is requesting a loan to purchase seed and a cow. With this investment in her business, she expects the family income to increase by 20 percent.

Proud of being a farmer and working the land, Roza will be providing security for her children and their family’s future by growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and livestock

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en: Arevik G. lives with her husband and two children in Kurtan, a village in the Lori region. The family’s main source of income comes from agriculture and horticulture – growing apple trees, walnut trees and pear trees. Arevik stocked up with cattle food for the winter, but since spring is coming late to the region and the cattle can’t yet live on the fields, Arevik has applied for a loan to purchase more cattle food.

loans.use: to purchase cattle food

loans.name: San Gonzalito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Gonzalito llamado así, porque las personas que integran este grupo son muy devotas a este santo, este grupo esta ubicado en una de la colonia de Pinotepa Nacional. Esta integrado por 10 personas que se dedican a diferentes actividades para llevar el sustento a sus familias.
Lorena Edith Pérez Vásquez es la representante de este grupo, vive en unión libre con Heriberto quien trabaja como obrero, tiene una hija de 5 años que estudia el preescolar. Lorena solicito el préstamo para poder iniciar un pequeño negocio piensa invertir en una tienda de abarrotes, ella quiere iniciar este negocio debido a la necesidad que esta pasando actualmente, tiene varios gastos en su casa y con lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza, su pequeña hija la pide dinero para sus útiles escolares y a veces tiene que reducir algunos gastos para comprar lo que su pequeña le pide. Ella desea que le vaya bien en este negocio que piensa emprender aunque existe competencia, pero ella cofia en Dios. 
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Judith (venta de comida).
Edith (Venta de calzado y perfumes).
Lucia (Venta de refrescos).
María (Venta de pollo).
Lucina (Venta de abarrotes).
Alma (Venta de calzado).
Marcos (Venta de pollo).
Francisca (Venta de maíz).
María Ana (Venta de lencería).
Lorena (Venta de abarrotes).
texts.en:
This group is called San Gonzalito because its members are devout followers of this saint.  The group is located in Pinotepa Nacional and has ten members who all carry out different business activities in order to support their families.

Lorena Edith Pérez Vásquez is the group's representative.  She lives with her partner Heriberto who works as a laborer.  She has a 5 year-old daughter who is in pre-school.  Lorena is requesting a loan so that she can set up a small business.  She is planning to establish a grocery store.  She would like to set up this business because of her current needs.  She has a number of household expenses and her husband's wages are not sufficient to cover them.  Her young daughter needs school supplies and sometimes Lorena has to reduce some expenses in order to buy what her young daughter requests.  Lorena would like to do well in her business.  She is starting the business in spite of the fact that there is competition because she trusts in God.

The other members of this group are:

Judith (meal sales)
Edith (footwear and perfume sales)
Lucia (soft drink sales)
María (chicken sales)
Lucina (grocery sales)
Alma (footwear sales)
Marcos (chicken sales)
Francisca (corn sales)
María Ana (underwear sales)
Lorena (grocery sales)

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, soap, sugar, toilet paper and cookies to sell

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 29 years old and is married with two children, aged 3 and 5. He runs a butcher shop and employs two people to help him. He has three years of experience, and his business is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Pierre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is 36 years old and married to Feriyal, 35 years old, a housewife. They have two beautiful daughters and a son. They live in a rented house in AL Wihdat. 

To be able to raise his young kids, Karam opened a sewing and carpentry workshop five years ago to make different kinds of sofas and Arabian seating. He also sews different models of curtains.  

This is his fifth loan to expand the workshop; he used his previous loans to buy raw materials, and now he wants to use this loan to buy new sewing and capentry machines that could help him speed up his productivity.

loans.use: To buy new sewing and carpentry machines.

loans.name: Takunda Agrodealers Association Group

texts.en:
Samuel is a 51-year-old married man living in the town of Masvingo. He has five children ranging in age from 13 to 21 years old, all of them are attending school. He also cares for two additional dependents.

Samuel has been running a grocery and furniture outlet for fifteen years.  This is his primary source of income. He says that lately the main challenge he faces is the lack of working capital. Farming also provides him an additional source of income.

Samuel has requested a loan of $400 to increase his stock of furniture and groceries. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help him improve his family’s living standards and enable him to educate his children.

Samuel envisions opening more outlets in the future and increasing his number of workers employed within the next 5 years, should the economy remain stable.

loans.use: increase his stock of furniture and groceries

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Este padre emprendedor se llama Francisco, su actividad es la venta de hielo actividad que inicio hace mas de 3 años, a pesar de que ha tenido problemas ya que algunas veces la energía no es muy estable y sus productos se dañan. Pero tiene un termo en donde puede guardar una parte de sus productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de termos, bolsas, además tiene que proporcionarle mantenimiento a su frezer.
texts.en: This entrepreneurial father is called Francisco, and his business is the sale of ice.  He started this business more than three years ago.  He has had problems because sometimes the energy supply is not very stable and his products get damaged, but he has a vacuum thermos where he can save some of his products. The reason for this loan is for the purchase of thermoses and bags, he also has to conduct maintenance on his freezer.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum thermoses and bags, he also has to conduct maintenance on his freezer.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Because fish is reasonably priced, it is the kind of food that most Cambodian people like to buy to cook for their families. 

To make a living, Mrs. Pech sells fish in and around her community, Baray district. She can make a daily income of about $2 (U.S. dollars) from her fresh fish-selling business. Her husband helps support the family by working in agriculture. He also works in construction whenever his job planting rice crops falls to part-time.

Presently, Mrs. Pech owns a bicycle, which she uses to transport her fish to sell. Mrs. Pech faces a problem with traveling long distances, so she decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a used motorbike in order to make it easier for her to pick up her fish to sell to communities further away.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for picking up fish to sell to communities long distances away.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality from other clothes sellers in the area. Janet dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu after witnessing other members benefiting from the program.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Los Garcias Group

texts.es:
El grupo los García lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mayra del Carmen de 27 años quien vende ropa desde hace 10 años. Este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su marido y con los préstamos lo ha ido mejorando.
Ella con el crédito compara mercadería en ropa como camisas, pantalones, chores…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Juan Rafael de 32 años quien desde hace 15 años se dedica a la artesanía de canastos y  Manuel de 48 años quien es maestro y vende ropa, camisas y pantalones.
texts.en:
The 'Los García' group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 27 year-old Mayra del Carmen who has been selling clothes for ten years.  She started her business with her husband's help and, with loans, she has gradually improved the business.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

The other members of the group are 32 year-old Juan Rafael, who has been crafting baskets for 15 years, and 48 year-old Manuel who is a teacher and also sells clothes, shirts and pants.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 21 years old and single. She runs a salon. Her business has been in operation for three years.

She has been a KADET client and this is her third loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more combs, shampoos and a variety of hair products for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more combs, shampoos and a variety of hair products

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 23 años es una mujer joven, alegre y muy trabajadora. Es conviviente y vive junto a su pareja en casa de su suegra. Ella es madre de dos niños de tres y de un año y medio, ellos son su motivo de seguir adelante.Rocío trabaja en su bodega, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ella compra al por mayor para poder venderlo al menudeo y así obtener ganancias, actividad que realiza en su casa. Lleva tres años en este negocio y trabaja sola ya que su pareja trabaja en un aserradero y así generan ambos los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. En este trabajo le está yendo regular a Rocío, ya que esta manteniendo su bodega pero le falta aun muchas cosas para poder tenerla surtida.Lo que le gusta de su bodega es que siempre hay movimiento y lo que no le gusta es que hay personas que vienen en afán de pedir crédito y son los que se tardan en pagar y debilitan al negocio, espera mas adelante poder tener una bodega surtida como la que siempre tubo y asi tener mas ingresos.Este es el sexto préstamo entre Rocío y la institución MFP, se siente tranquila en su grupo ya que consideran son buenos todos y agradece mucho la oportunidad que le da MFP para poder hacer inversión y generar ganancias para su hogar.Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles ella comprar abarrotes y pasamanería para su negocio y así poder crecer junto a su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocío, age 23, is a happy and very hard-working young woman.  She is in a common-law-marriage, and she lives with her life partner in her mother-in-law’s house.  She has two children, ages three and one and a half.  They are her motivation for getting ahead.

She works in her grocery store.  She has a small grocery store.  She buys wholesale in order to be able to sell for retail and get income that way.  She works at home.  She has been in this business for three years.  She works alone because he life partner works at a saw mill.  That way they both generate the income needed for their household. 

This work is going so-so for Rocío.  She is maintaining her grocery store; she still needs a lot of things in order for it to be stocked.  What she likes about her grocery store is that there is always action.  What she does not like is that there are people who come with the desire to ask for credit.  They are the ones who are late in paying, and they weaken her business.  Later she hopes to be able to have a store that is stocked like she always had.  That way she will have more income.

This is the sixth loan that Rocío has had with the MFP institution.  Her mind is at ease in the group because they are all considered to be good.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that MFP gives her in order to be able to invest and generate income for her household.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy groceries and ornamental trim for clothing for her business.  That way she will be able to grow together with her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and ornamental trim for clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Aloe Vera products and gourmet coffee to sell

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
Kembang Kertas group is made up of suburban residents who mostly have a trading business and raise livestock. One is raising pigs. With the number of members at 10, the group got a loan of Rp.15,000,000. 

Ni Nengah, the head of the group, will  use her share of the loan to buy three local pigs. Pigs will be maintained for two months, then sold again. Profits from the sale will be set aside and the capital will be used to buy more pig. Ni Nengah hopes this effort will be smooth so that she can realize her dream to make her kitchen more spacious.

loans.use: To buy three local pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a single woman with no children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for herself and transport. 

She has been operating a clothes selling business for the past year.  In addition, she also sells groceries. Her potential clients are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge in transportation. She dreams of establishing a bigger shop in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Emma wants to purchase clothes to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Dayhana Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dayhana Maribel; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad; la socia trabaja en  la empresa de telecomunicaciones privada claro y la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de sus lentes ella invertirá en su salud puesto que desea comprar sus lentes a medida y el crédito que obtendrá del banco comunal lo invertirá en la compra de lentes para uso propio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lentes a medida para uso propio.
 La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Dayhana Maribel, 35, is a member of the “Atipay” communal bank which is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.  She is single and has a 2-year-old son.  She works for the Claro private telecommunications firm.  On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy herself prescription eyeglasses.  She will invest in her health because she wants to buy her prescription eyeglasses and will use the loans she’ll get from the communal bank to buy the glasses for her own use.  She is asking for the loan to buy prescription eyeglasses for her own use.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy prescription glasses for herself.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 49 years of age, married and has four children. Carlito’s wife is a housekeeper. Carlito is a farmer planting three hectares of rice in the Philippines. He is almost 23 years in this type of business. Carlito’s goal in life is to uplift his family's  standard of living.

Carlito’s one way to uplift his family's standard of living is to strive and work hard and love his work, which is farming. Carlito's income from the business goes for the education of his children. He knows that he has no other treasure to give his children other than education.

Carlito is requesting a loan of P50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor and land preparation. He hopes to access the loan and he will use it wisely for the better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor and land preparation.

loans.name: Maasooma

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and a mother for three children.

Maasooma has been a tailor since 2009. She makes, repairs or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she has become well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for $1200 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: In order to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es: Fátima mujer emprendedora, trabajadora tiene su propio negocio, vive con sus padres, con el préstamo anterior ha sido de gran beneficio ya que aumento sus ventas y mejoro las condiciones de su negocio. Tiene como planes ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco, así como ofrecerle a sus clientes mayores comodidades en el local. El préstamo que solicitad será utilizado para la compra de mercadería en general como: blusas para damas, caballero, niños, perfumes, pantalones, crema para manos, cuerpo, toallas de baño, medias para damas, cosméticos, bisuterías de fantasía ( pulseras, aretes, anillos, etc), siendo que pronto se presentara la época en donde se vende más sus productos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante al desarrollo de su negoció y al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida. Como anteriormente se menciono vive con sus padres siendo los ingresos del negocio el principal ingreso económico para la familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is an enterprising, hardworking woman who has her own business and lives with her parents. Her previous loan has been a great benefit because it helped her increase her sales and improve her business conditions. Her plans are to continue improving her house little by little and also to offer her clientele more amenities in her shop. The loan will be used to buy general merchandise such as tops for women, men and children, along with perfume, pants, hand and body cream, bath towels, women’s hosiery, cosmetics, costume jewelry (bracelets, earrings, rings, etc), this being the fast-approaching season when her sales increase the most.

Fátima is grateful to the lenders for their constant help in expanding her business and in improving her standard of living. As stated above, she lives with her parents and her business earnings are the principal source of economic support for the family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Gabriel es padre D. familia y esta construyendo un cuarto en L. planta alta D. su casa. 
Al terminar L. recamara tendrá mas espacio en su vivienda, ya que actualmente cuenta con un solo cuarto y le esta haciendo falta otro el cuarto que será para su hija quien esta creciendo y necesita su propio espacio en L. casa. 
Don Gabriel trabaja en una compañía D. transportes desD. hace más D. once años  y su esposo trabaja en L. limpieza D. casas particulares desD. hace 7 años. El mejoramiento D. L. vivienda es para brindar le comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Gabriel is the father of a family, and he is building a room on the second story of his house.  When he finishes the bedroom he will have more space in his home.  Currently he has only one bedroom and he needs another one for his daughter, who is growing up and needs her own space in the house.

Gabriel has worked for a transportation company for more than eleven years and his wife has worked cleaning private homes for seven years.

The home improvement is to give his family comfort.

loans.use: to finish a room on the second story.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 29 years old and married. He has two children ages 7 and 5. Jonas sells dry goods such as T-shirts, jeans and slippers. He has had this business for 6 months. Jonas works hard to earn and provide for his family. He is also saving for his children's education.

Jonas has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as slippers and shirts. Jonas hopes for his business to be stable.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as slippers and shirts.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Augusta.  She is married, and has 2 children ages 16 and 8. In 1997, Augusta established her pub and provision business. She began her business because after she graduated from school and got married, her husband requested that she start a business so that she could help to support their family. She opens her business 7 days a week and 15 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Augusta requires a loan in order to buy drinks for her bar. In the future, Augusta plans to open her business in other communities and be to help her husband pay university fees for their children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
María Narcisa tiene 31 años es soltera, vive  con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas.

Ventanilla VALLE ALTO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
María Narcisa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es  dar el estudio a los hijos para que tengan una profesión.

Le gusta  jugar con los hijos y salir de paseo.
texts.en:
María Narcisa is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas canton.

The Valle Alto community bank is located in Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

María Narcisa is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for some years. She makes her purchases in Ventanas and makes her sales in Ventanas market.

María Narcisa requested this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The loan will help her to increase her income so that she can provide for her family and invest in her farming. Her dream is to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals. 

In her free time, María Narcisa enjoys playing with her children and going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Nhon's Group

texts.en:
Nhon is 33 years old and has two children who are school age. 

She manages a small wood workshop that makes furniture. Her business started five years ago. It creates a stable income for her. 

Participating in our credit program in 2010, she expanded her production scale. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnam dong (VND) to buy wood for furniture.

Nhung is 27 years old. She raises pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thao is 24 years old. She is a furniture maker. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy tools.

Tinh is 37 years old. She is a businesswoman. She sells everything that can bring a profit. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND as capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture making.

loans.name: Mahadeb Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Urmila is 33 years old. The lady standing to the extreme left in the photo is Urmila. She lives in a house that she owns along with her life companion and their little daughter, who is five years old. Urmila is a young woman who earns her living selling fish as a street vendor in the areas surrounding her community, and that is how she helps to support her family's finances. 

Urmila along with her other group members is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Urmila will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a toilet, as the one they currently have is in bad condition due to years of use. She wants to carry out this construction with the objective of providing her little daughter with better hygiene and better protection against diseases. 

She will use the loan amount to buy the necessary materials, including brick, cement, sand, gravel,commode etc., to start this construction of a toilet.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and to buy necessery materials for the construction of the same

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is a widow with eight children. She takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She is a poultry farmer. She operates her business on a retail basis from home seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags chicken feed. Her major business challenge includes poultry diseases. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business into a big poultry farm. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: He is 39 years old married and is blessed with two children.He has been in business for ten years now.He has borrowed loan to purchase  plumbing stock hoping this will generate income.His hopes and dreams in future is to expand his business, pay school fees and have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing stock

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a stand where he sells tortillas and common Ecuadorian foods. He started the business off with only $10 of capital several years ago. This business has provided for Francisco and his 3 children. He depends on the stand to provide food, shelter and education for his family. He is requesting the loan in order to buy chairs and tables to put around his stand. He hopes that his business will continue to become popular and that one day he can open a restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for his clients to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: H. Valeh is 46. He is an internally displaced person (IDP)  from Nagorniy Karabakh. He has a big family of 5 children. At first, it was enough to have 1 cow and a calf, but later, to cover family needs, keeping another cow and calf became a necessity.  He borrowed $1200 from Agroinvest CU to buy 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.use: purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon Mwaniki is 38 years old and married. He has no children of his own but has two dependants, his aging parents whom Simon entirely supports. Simon Mwaniki lives in Ruai.

Simon was first employed in a lumber-selling business in the year 2000 and worked for three years. During that period, he managed to save Ksh 40,000 (US$ 615). The three-year experience also gave Simon enough confidence to start his own lumber business, which he still has to date, though with some struggles.

Simon’s business suffered a setback in the year 2006 due to his wedding preparations, which ended up causing him huge unforeseen costs relating to the culture and traditions of his tribe that he was expected to adhere to, if he was to receive their blessings to marry his bride. Through this time and due to the financial strain that Simon experienced, his business suffered and he still finds it hard to bring it back up again. Simon needs support in order to revive his business again. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1000, which he will use to purchase lumber to restock his business. He will be very grateful if he can receive this support, in order to improve his business.

Simon believes that once he has additional stock, his customers will be able to purchase enough lumber to meet their needs, especially those who purchase in bulk. This will save them the inconvenience of having to travel all the way to the city center to buy lumber, at a much bigger cost to them. The loan therefore will enable him to serve his customers efficiently and effectively. He will also earn more income so as to uplift himself and his family. The loan repayment period will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for sale

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en: Ms Sevinj is a low income, vulnerable woman. She is 32, married with three children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. She and her husband (he is pictured) run a family business, managing a tea-shop. To develop their business Sevinj needs investment, but she cannot get a loan through a  commercial bank. But her application for $300 loan was approved in Normicro Saatli branch. She plans to use the credit to renovate the tea-shop and increase the quantity and quality of her inventory.

loans.use: For the renovation of her tea-shop

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura is 29 years old, married to Diego Cabrera for 8 years, and they have a 7 year old son that goes to elementary school.

Together they work to support their family. They have a cafe (dining room) where they sell all kinds of fast food, soft drinks, and sweets. The business has had a steady clientele for several years. In addition, Laura also sews. In the future she would like to expand her current business and have a clothing store.

She wants her son to continue to study, finish school and pursue studies in the university so that he will have better opportunities in life.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her cafe, such as soft drinks, meat, eggs, oil, ground cracker, and bread for sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Laura tiene 29 años esta casada con el Señor Diego Cabrera hace mas de 8 años, cuentan con un hijo de 7 años que va a la escuela primaria.

Juntos trabajan para mantener la familia, poseen un copetín (comedor) en donde se vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas, gaseosas y golosinas. El negocio ya cuenta con una clientela formada hace varios años, además, ella también se dedica a la confección. Le gustaría poner para el futuro una tienda de ropas y ampliar más su negocio actual.

Desea que su hijo estudie, culmine sus estudios primarios y en el futuro seguir una carrera universitaria que sea de su agrado de modo a obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos para su copetín, tales como gaseosas, carne, huevo, aceite, galleta molida, pan para sándwiches.

loans.use: Purchase soda pop, meat, oil, eggs, ground cracker, bread for sandwiches.

loans.name: Faisealofa

texts.en: Faisealofa is an SPBD client who joined this programme when she wanted to start a small business. Even though it is only selling pop corn, it has made a start for her as a business woman. She married a man from Mulifanua and that’s when she started her business. She also receives a remittance from her aunty overseas and other members of her extended family. That was her financial support before she joined SPBD for extra assistance. Now she manages to support her family and send her kids to school with this simple business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her popcorn business and also for home improvement

loans.name: Kamuli A3 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Safina is 46 yeas old and married with six children. Her current business is selling firewood. She wans to start up a brick laying business with the extra profits. Zaituni sells milk and wants to use the loan to buy more milk cans and a fridge. Jessica has a bar business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To operate her business at a larger scale and obtain a food stall

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso and Gladis are a young couple with countless plans for their future. Alfonso decided to live in the city of Juliaca to work as an artist and in his free time, to work in a service oriented role on his tricycle to save up money for their big dream. While Alfonso works hard daily in his activities, his young wife does agricultural work and takes care of their young son, Edison. Both of them would like to start a farm to raise hens and guinea pigs. They are certain that this activity will increase their income and allow them to provide a better quality of life for their son. To materialize their plans, Alfonso seeks your generosity to obtain a loan that he promises to repay in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Alfonso y Gladis son una pareja de esposos muy jóvenes con innumerables planes para su vida futura, Alfonso decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca para trabajar como maestro de obras y en sus horas libres brindar servicio de movilidad en su triciclo, con la finalidad de ahorrar lo suficiente y cumplir el gran sueño que tiene con su fiel esposa. Mientras Alfonso se esfuerza en sus actividades cotidianas su joven esposa se dedica a la agricultura y al cuidado de su pequeño niño, Edison, el deseo de ambos es lograr implementar su granja de gallinas y cuyes, están seguros de que incursionando en esta actividad aumentarán sus ingresos económicos y les permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeño niño.Para concretar sus planes Alfonso recurre a tu generoso corazón para solicitarte un préstamo de dinero que promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de 6 meses.

loans.use: to start a farm to raise chicken and guinea pigs

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru:
Nozigul S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married and has seven children. When she had finished school she started her own business. She sells children's clothing and has been in this business for the past 16 years. At this time, this business is the only source of income for the family. Nozigul plans to increase her commodity circulation by getting a loan. It will help her purchase additional inventory. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерова Нозигуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и имеет 7 детей. Закончила школу после чего началоа свой бизнес. Торгует детской одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже около 16 лет. Сейчас этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Планирует увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Это поможет ей закупить новый ассортимент товара, что увеличит товарооборот. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течегнии 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Elisa Ivana

texts.es:
Ms. Elisa Ivana P. C. was born in Coroico, in the city of La Paz. She has obtained one individual loan with the institution. She sells chicken for a living in a rented business space. She has three school age sons, who help out in the shop, under her care. They live in Anticrético in the San Pedro zone.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA ELISA IVANA P. C. NACIÓ EN COROICO, EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, TIENE UN CRÉDITO INDIVIDUAL CON LA INSTITUCIÓN SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA DE POLLOS, SU PUESTO ES FIJO Y ALQUILADO, VIVE EN ANTICRÉTICO EN LA ZONA DE SAN PEDRO, VIVE SOLA Y TIENE TRES NIÑOS A SU CARGO, LOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR LOS CUALES LE COLABORAN EN LA VENTA DE CARNE DE POLLO.

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalina is an insistent and hard-working woman: years of work have made her into a courageous and valiant woman, able to continue following her separation from her husband three years ago. She has taken total control of her house in company with her three small children and has made considerable effort in weaving cloths, which already provide her with sufficient economic income to provide for those she loves most. Please help Rosalinda and don’t delay her in her path towards self-improvement.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalinda, es muy empeñosa y trabajadora, los años de trabajo la han convertido en una mujer de mucho coraje y valor para continuar tras la separación de su esposo hace 3 años ella ha tomado el control total de su hogar en compañía de sus tres pequeños y se esfuerza mucho más en su fábrica de tejas, ya que esta le proporciona los ingresos económicos suficientes para solventar a los que más ama.Apoya a Rosalinda y no se detendrá en su camino hacia la superación.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve her work

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan lives in a neighborhood about 15 miles from the main highway of Ticuantepe. He is 27 years old and married with two children who attend school. His wife is a stay at home mother and takes care of the family. Juan has a bicycle repair business, which he's been running for 3 years now. With the loan he is requesting he wants to invest in his business, increase his income and be better able to provide an education for his children.

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Km. 16 ½ de la carretera a Ticuantepe, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y sus hijos están estudiando, su esposa es ama casa. El trabajo del Sr. Juan es técnico en reparación y tiene tres años de experiencia. El dinero que está solicitando es para incrementar el negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes incrementar las ventas y educar a sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: INVEST IN EQUIPMENT FOR HIS BICYCLE REPAIR BUSINESS, INCREASE HIS INCOME AND BE BETTER ABLE TO PROVIDE AN EDUCATION FOR HIS CHILDREN.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mr. Lorn L. (61) and his wife, Mrs. Hauly Thaung (56) who live along Tonle Basac River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the youngest son is construction worker.

Mr. Lorn has been a mason and wooden house builder for fifteen years. His wife is not employed, and instead stays at home to do housework. Currently, Lorn's construction materials are old and broken so he needs to buy new materials to replace the old equipment. Therefore, Lorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase some new tools for his business. He will use the rest of the money to help his daughter with her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and grocery items.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Назаров Саидмурод житель Хуросонского района. Занимается животноводством вот уже 10 лет. Эта деятельность очень распрастранена среди сельской местности. Дело приносит неплохой доход.Поэтому он решил уаеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Саидмурод женат и имеет троих детей, обеспечивает всю семью сам , благодоря бизнесу.
texts.en:
Saidmurod N. lives in Khuroson. He has been working in animal husbandry for ten years. This work is very widespread out in the country. His business brings in a good income. Therefore, he has resolved to increase sales by taking out a loan. He can pay off the loan in ten months. Saidmurod is married and has three children. He provides for the family himself, thanks to the business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying calves

loans.name: Elizabeth Rocio

texts.en:
Elizabeth Rocio B. J., 27, is part of community bank Kuskanchik at FINCA Perú. She has three children and lives in Ayacucho, Perú. Elizabeth sells men's and women's clothes. On weekly trips to Lima, 10 hours on a bus (one way), she delivers orders that she has received. Furthermore, when her husband needs help, she also works at his mechanic shop. 

She will invest her loan into her business by purchasing jeans, sweaters, and bus tickets to Lima. With her savings, she dreams of being the administrator of her own store.

loans.use: She will invest into her business by purchasing jeans, sweaters, and bus tickets to Lima.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Chút Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Chút năm nay 52 tuổi, Ms 01030013 là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó và vui tính. Chị luôn niềm nở với mọi người, nên được mọi người xung quanh cũng như khách mua hàng biết đến rất nhiều. Hàng ngày cả 2 vợ chồng chị đều bán hàng ăn như : Miến ngan, bún gà và hàng cơm phở …Ngoài ra chị còn làm thêm nghề xay sát bột cho trẻ em, còn con trai chị làm thợ điện, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình rất ổn định từ 200.000VNđ đến 220.000VNđ/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình nên hết chu kỳ chị lại tiếp tục đăng ký với mức vay 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng của gia đình. 
 Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :
Chị Nguyễn Thị N. Ms 01030012 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng bán xe đạp, đồ ăn chin. 
Chị Phan Thị Lý Ms 01030014 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua nguyên liệu sản xuất kẹo.
Chị Nguyễn Thị V. Ms 01030015 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ mua dụng cụ sửa chữa máy tính. 
Chị Đặng Thị H. Ms 01030016 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua gỗ sản xuất bàn ghế, tủ. 
Chị Nguyễn Thị T. Ms 01030028 vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để mua đồ trang điểm, cắt tóc.
Chị Đặng Thị

loans.use: to buy supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Rubina Peter Bota Group

texts.en:
Rubina Baji is a 39-year-old lady and resides in a place named Ismail Nagar, which is situated in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 13 years. She is an educated lady. She is doing a job in a private hospital as a nurse. Her husband's name is P. B.. He is a cook by profession. He has a food business where he sells a Punjabi dish (Daal Chawal). He has been in this business for the past 15 years.  Rubina Baji has three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in 5th standard. Her elder daughter is in 7th standard and her younger daughter is in 4th standard. Rubina Baji is applying for a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice) for her husband’s food business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rozi Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. Nasreen Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Sonia Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Samina I. Baji wants a loan to buy a furniture polisher for her furniture polish business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her food business

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
This small group is composed of three borrowers. Mr. Kok P. is the leader. He is 50 years old, and makes a living purchasing cows from far away places to raise in his house, which will result in a profit. He is called an ox trader. He is married to San Rorn, age 52, who is a rice farmer. She is a good mother of four children; three are single and one is married. Two of her children are employed; one is a construction worker at Thailand Country and another one is a garment worker in Phom Penh City.

His cattle business is the main source of income for P.. Recently, P. is lacking capital to expand his business operation. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy more cows to raise for sale. (P.'s wife appears in the picture because he was not available.) P. is asking for this loan along with two members:

Pan P. is 39 years old, a rice farmer. She requests a loan to purchase rice to store for sale and begin a new business for raising pigs. San H. is 55 years old, and widowed. She is a local farmer that applied for a loan to start a new business for raising pigs at home. The borrowers are people who living in Spean Tnot Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim M., 59, is married and lives with her husband and children in Bati district, Takeo province. She and her husband are grocery sellers and are able to make around US$20 everyday in revenue. This couple also has support from two of their five children who are office workers. The other three children are students. Mrs. Yim M. is asking a loan of US$500 to increase her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Rebbecca

texts.en:
Rebbecca A. is currently in the business of selling beads at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Rebbecca is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has two children, who both go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling beads.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona D. C. is a rice grower. She is 26 years old and has 2 children. She also maintains a vegetable and flower garden in her backyard. She has been a farmer since she married her husband, Helbert D. C.. She owns a 9-hectare farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She uses her harvest to support her family's needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. She has been a CEVI client for 2 years now. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. This also will help her start a new business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start up and run a business on their own. They teach people to earn a living for their family. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help their clients sustain and grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 42-year-old divorced man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Khalil has been selling chicken since 1993. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Khalil has been a micro credit client for six years now and has always paid on time. 
Khalil's previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. Khalil decided on doing this business because of his high living expenses. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Laurence Ouma

texts.en:
Laurence Ouma O. is a 37-year-old married father of one child. He is a boda-boda driver here in Kisumu. A boda-boda is simply a bike with a platform above the back wheel that the customer can sit on. Riding boda-boda is the most common way of getting around Kisumu.

Laurence is asking for 20,000 KSH so that he can purchase eggs to sell in addition to riding his boda-boda, which is not bringing in enough income these days.

loans.use: To purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more sorghum flour, millet flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри Давлатова занимается торговлей. У нее на рынке имеется торговая точка. Она торгует техникой, детскими игрушками и т.д. Она проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Мехри бизнесом занимается 5 лет. До этого она работала по своей специальности учительницой. С бизнесом ей помогают дети. Муж работает водителем маршрутного такси. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Mehri D. is in retail. She has a vendor space on the market. She sells electronics, children's toys and etc. He lives in the Vahdat region. She is 51 years old, married and has six children. Mehri has been doing business for five years. Before that she worked as a teacher. Her children help her with the business. Her husband works as a shuttle taxi driver. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор- молодая женщина 26 лет. Образование высшее. Гулрухсор замужем мать 2-х детей. Муж Гулрухор находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Гулрухсор преподает в средней школе, но у нее очень маленькая заработная плата. Поэтому Гулрухсор занимается дополнительно переработкой пряжи и вязанием шерстяных носков. Но полученный кредит она хочет, купит оптом пряжу и переработав продать. Она очень рада, что снами сотрудничает и благодарна  нам.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a young 26 year old woman. She has a college education. Gulruhsor is married and is the mother of 2 children. Gulruhsor’s husband is earning money in the Russian Federation. Gulruhsor teaches at a high school, but she has a very small salary. Because of this Gulruhsor also processes yarn and knits wool socks. She would like to use her loan to buy yarn in wholesale quantities and to sell it after processing it. She is very happy that she works with us and is grateful to us.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
“If others can, why can’t I?” This is what Maribel says about her business.  With her patience and hard work, she was able to sustain her business.  At the moment, she would like to request again for another loan amounting to PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that having enough capital will enable her to further improve her general store business and to maintain its stability.  

Maribel lives in Barangay Binarzang in Quirino, Isabela together with her family. She is married to Chito and he works as an Overseas Filipino Worker. They are blessed with only one son, named John Michael.  Maribel hopes that by the time her child enters school they will already have saved for his education through college level. As parents, they always wanted to give the best for their son.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria M. nasceu em inhambane, tem 56 anos de idade não teve a oportunidade de ir à escola devido à falta de condições dos seus progenitores. E casada e mãe de 8 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 25 aos 45 anos de idade todos eles são casados

Maria sai de inhambane a namacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia com seu esposo este que era policia civil e afectuo em macuacua uma localidade do distrito que dista 
7km da vila. Maria inicia seu proprio negocio de criaçao de galinhas do mato pois na zona onde ela vivia era muito adequada para pratica dessa actividade e revendia os na vila. Com o fundo colectado e com ajuda do seu esposa ela consegue comprar um carro que lhes permitiu mais ainda expandir o seu negocio, para alem de frangos passa tambem a vender carvao na capital. Mas devido a guerra maria perde todos seus bens e muda se para vila onde continua com a sua actividade.numa conversa que teve com seu filho que e nosso cliente ela aproxima se e solicita um emprestimo para recomeçar com o seu negocio de frangos. Hoje ela agradece muito a hluvuku e kiva por lhe terem financiado o valor, tem conprado no maximo 5x100 caixas de pintos gastando 28.000.00mt revendendo cada a 100.00mt, tem ganho um lucro no valor de 8.000.00mt consegue poupar por mês 2.000.00mt porque tem de pagar dispesas dos seus netos 
que encontram se a estudar.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de maria na hluvuku e segundo com kiva. Estes 20.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo emprestimo pois para alem dos seus negocios conta com ajuda do seu marido.
texts.en:
Maria M. was born in Inhambane, she is 56 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study due to her parents lack of resources. She is married and has 8 children between the ages of 25 and 45, all of them married. Maria left Inhambane for Naamacha, a neighboring village on the boarder of Swaziland, with her husband who was a police officer in Macuacua, a town 7km from the village. Maria started her own business raising guinea fowls and selling them at the village. She was able to buy a car with the funds she raised and the help of her husband. Having a vehicle to work with, allowed them to expand their business and start selling charcoal in the capital city of Maputo. But, due to the war, Maria lost all her assets and moved back to her village, where she continued her business, with difficulty. After having a conversation with her son who was already a member, she requested a loan to rebuild her business selling chickens. She is very grateful to Hluvuku and Kiva for having provided her with the amount she requested. She was able to buy 5x100 crates of chicks at 28.000,00MT and resell each bird at 100,00MT, having a profit of 8.000,00MT. She is able to save 2.000,00MT a month because she has to support her grandchildren who are attending school. This is Maria's third loan with Hluvuku and her second loan with Kiva. The 20.000,00MT that she is requesting will be used to grow her businesses. She is confident that she'll be able to pay her loan back without any problems and later on request a new loan, because besides having her business she can also count on her husband's help.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her poultry business

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Абдухакимов Абдумалик – молодой человек 30-ти лет, женат, имеет 2-х детей.
Он  занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока.Абдумалик  занимается этим бизнесом вот уже более 6-ти лет. Когда он начинал вой бизнес, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Абдумалика большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Абдумалик планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам по KIVA.
texts.en:
Abdumalik A. is a young, 30-year-old man, who is is married and has 2 children. He is involved in raising and selling livestock, and his wife is involved in processing and selling milk. Abdumalik has been in this business for over 6 years. When he first started his business, he had a very small quantity of livestock. Now, Abdumalik has a large quantity of small livestock. His wife also has one dairy cow. Abdumalik plans to purchase another dairy cow and a calf for his wife, and he is grateful to our Kiva creditors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and calf

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.en:
H. Abdurauf sells confectionery like candies, cookies, pastries and fruit jelly. He is 49 years old, married and has two children. He has been in this business for three years. His income allows him to support his family – he is the only breadwinner in his family. Today, Abdurauf requests $1000 US to purchase confectionery to enlarge his range of goods. Abdurauf thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay his loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase confectionery

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 26-year-old businessman who owns a retail shop in Nairobi. He has been in this business for the past two years. Patrick is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 in order to add to his stock and convert his business into wholesale. A father to one, Patrick hopes to buy houses in Nairobi for his family and for commercial purposes one day. He describes himself as hardworking, friendly and social.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages never defeated Rano, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Rano is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 40 years old, widow and has a child. For more than 7 years, she has operated a store where she sells kid’s clothing. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful. Rano hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her dearest child. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose Rano requests $2500 USD. She promises to repay the loan in time and thanks everyone supporting her.      
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
